On the dental-work destruction front, they are rivaled only by JuJuBes and Milk Duds.

Anyway, the very same artificial banana flavor appears to have been used to create Simon's little joke about a lady boy's anatomy. Ha ha. Good thing he didn't go into the entertainment business. Once the banana fumes clear out (and they are very fumey--like most of the loud scents of this house, always toeing the paint-thinner line), then judging by the ingredient list on the vial, I should love LADYBOY. Anthemis nobilis (chamomile), Cistus ladaniferus (could be a type-o--it's supposed to be labdanum resinoid), Viola odorata (no explanation needed!), and the sacred evernia prunastri (oakmoss), which everyone knows has been pulled from the vast majority of perfumes, resulting in sometimes tragic reformulations.

I do think that this particular Lush concoction ends up smelling pretty decent by the end, and it is not destroyed by Simon's apparent near anosmia to citrus oil (I can imagine him in the "kitchen", adding more and more lemongrass oil to his creations, never reaching the point of detection, all the while unaware that he's actually hyposmic to the stuff!) No, grâce à Dieu--or reasonable facsimile--there is no lemongrass or any other citrus whatsoever in this perfume! It's a miracle! But in place of the caustic citrus oil, there are banana fumes.

I think that LADYBOY is okay. For me, it's a sure trip down memory lane, every time I wear it. But how many more times do I need to reflect upon my junior high school days, walking to Tenneco to fill my mouth with Beich's bananas? Not on my wish list, in the end.

Had no idea what the notes of this was before I sprayed it - yes it hits you like a smack in the face, synthetic banana. However I've been searching my whole life for an artificial banana scent so this was a welcome smack in the face....

Reminds me of that banana medicine they give for kids with ear infections, (again I love that smell lol).

On the spray card about an hour and a half later sadly the banana has pretty much gone, got a very natural minty aquatic smell left, it reminds me a bit of Lush Dirty.

Wish the banana lasted a bit longer, but overall it's an interesting 'aquatic' , going to save up for the 30ml bottle.

The previous reviewer must be kidding. "Unwashed human"? C'mon... Are you serious?

Well, after testing it, I decided to buy the solid version (just because I haven't got any solid perfume), that is supposed to be "in honour of Brazilian beaches" but, I assure you, there are no ladyboys in Brazil. Ladyboys are part of Thai culture. Anyway, I like the scent but I think Lush fragrances are a bit pricey and the product design (black plastic with a sticker) is boring and cheap.

The opening to me smells like some kind of "banana candy" (NO "unwashed human", at all).

I had a visceral reaction to this when I smelled it. It reeked of unwashed human to me. Something about the banana and seaweed together I think was horrifying.

That said, I was impressed it gave me such a reaction.

Ladyboy is a unisex perfume and it smells wonderful. First violets and then a sweet amber smell with violtets in the background.

It's a very special perfume and I agree with Lush, it is sexy.

I’m still in shock- a Lush scent I dislike?! It starts out with a strong citrus note, but then a strong urine-like accord takes over and drowns out everything. This is definitely not a good blind buy, so try it out first.

A vintage Lush perfume. I love wearing this one in Spring. It‘s a really clean fresh aromatic scent. At first I get a lot of citrusy notes of lemon and grapefruit which are followed by herbal lavender, sweet jasmine and bittersweet fennel. A soapy Lush woody base. It reminds me so much of first Spring days. Like the feeling you get when you smell new blooming flowers on a refreshing breeze. Again it‘s not my favourite but I enjoy wearing it and I‘m glad I have it in my collection. Very likable. Easy to understand. Doesn‘t change much.

-Vintage-inspired scent.
-Rather nondescript. Some unidentifiable spices (coriander?) and powdery notes.
-Unless you're into smelling like the inside of an empty spice jar, I wouldn't reach for this. (-)

First of all little background info: this is the same fragrance as Be Never Too Busy to Be Beautiful`s B Scent. Lush used to be BNTBBB, same owners, same creators.

This scent is definitely a dividing one. It has something, that is very eighties. Then something I can`t put my finger on, but feel like, it is the same thing that makes the classics the classics. To me this is very classic-y, nevertheless unique, different.

It is elegant, yet playful. Sharp, but not fresh. Very sexy, I love wearing it. The masculine notes make it very sexy to me. It is indeed the perfect unisex scent, as it is truly both masculine and feminine.

Very different. Qualité bohémien.

I never got the dry down of floral that is mentioned, just woody-citrus. Like high-end furniture polish! In a good way, though. Another unusual fragrance from Lush.


Edit: So I bought the solids of some random Lush perfumes right as they were being discontinued, but my scent-palette wasn't very devoloped at that time so I didn't really know what to think of these.

Well, they've been aging on my shelf for about two years now, and I have to say they have only become more amazing over time! So glad I impulse-purchased these!

Anywho, so this is one interesting fragrance. I'm definitely getting more of the powdery-floral notes on top of the citrus and spice. Much more complex than furniture polish, this is more like the whole woodworking shop!

The imagery these evoke are really something to experience. And leave it to Lush to make me eat my "dislikes" list of perfumery notes... :/

A big surprise from Lush, since they usually do real weirdos (for which I bless and adore them). I love Ladyboy, and respect and admire Breath of God; B Scent is something new, pretty without being complacent, edgy without being aggressive, fun but not freaky.

B Scent opens with citrus, lemon, I think, a tasteful and discrete rose, and a surprising and delicious note of fennel. There's also a very subtle backing of white flower. It has a straight-forward dry down that doesn't change the composition of the perfume much, although the fennel fades a little and a more earthy note shows up. It stays roundly and sweetly pleasant.

This is a terrific summer perfume, with the fennel providing a cooling note, and the rose prettying up your sundress and flushed cheeks.

Yum. One of my favourites from Lush! (After Tuca Tuca and Vanillary)

Sharp, herbal, yet soft and floral. Works a treat on my skin.
I am not a fan of citrus/herbal/woody scents and this is exactly that. It smells like the sound of a crayon on a black board. Harsh, super dry and not sensual. Reminds me of insecticide.

Lush B Scent is an intense herbal-lemon fragrance with a hint of musk. Once again, I am left speechless, in awe of this brand's unique style.

B Scent opens with a somewhat sour, lemon detergent note, which is strangely alluring despite the fact that I'm not a huge fan of lemon. Fennel and lavender make a rather brash entrance in the heart, smelling like a cross between liquorice sticks and play-doh. I know this blend sounds revolting, but it actually smells quite nice.

The lemon accord gets sweeter and sweeter throughout the course of this fragrance's development. The musk and sandalwood in the base are both smooth and earthy smelling. That distinctive 'hippie vibe' that Lush is known for is definitely present in B Scent.

I think B Scent is either a love it or hate it. I totally dig it, but I must admit that my friends don't understand why I'd want to wear it. Like Sherapop so eloquently put it, this fragrance is a bit of a 'punch in the face' in terms of sillage.

Like most Lush fragrances, B Scent has excellent longevity and is another eco-friendly scent. I feel like I'm embracing my inner bohemian whenever I wear this fragrance.

I guess, to be perfectly frank, I'm really not feeling the Lush love. All of these extremely potent perfumes have a very hardline edge of essential oils--often citrus, spices and herbs--which makes them come out on my skin more as pre-bath concoctions than as perfumes. They really are rough-hewn, it seems to me, and part of what I am perceiving, what carries over from fragrance to fragrance, appears to be the Lush house base. It is so much more powerful than any of the delicate flowers with which it is combined, that it comes through no matter what, even in a jasmine bomb such as LUST.

I'll keep trying, but it's going to be a hard sell. I keep donning these "made in the kitchen" perfumes (which I do believe!) in the hopes of seeing the light--or rather sniffing the magic, but in the end they always make me feel as though I need a bath. B SCENT opens like a punch in the face with a citrus accord which appears to feature lemongrass--or has some of that essence absorbed permanently into my fat cells from my testing of other creations from this house? Then it just takes time for it to settle down to an acceptable level of nasal assault, but honestly I cannot understand how anyone could consider this a rose perfume! Really?

Ultimately, this all boils down to a matter of taste, it seems to me. If your idea of a pleasurable olfactory experience is to spend an afternoon at the Lush store, then you may love everything in this line! Do you find Keiko Mecheri "boring"? Well, you may be the perfect Lush customer, my fragrant friend. When I went to the store in Harvard Square to purchase a bottle of LUST, the SA gave me a complimentary slab of LUST soap, the scent of which is so powerful that every time I enter my bathroom I cannot help but remember my visit to the kaleidoscopically colored land of Lush. Maybe that's the point?

I have recentley discovered Lush perfumes.

At first I can feel citrus and fennel and after awhile it has turned into the most beautiful floral perfume, I love it.

B Scent was inspired by a French waitress who worked in a restaurant that Mark Constantine used to frequent during his trips to Paris. Inspired by foody notes of Fennel and the Lemon and rose notes which lingered on this lovely lady herself, he created B Scent!

With my chemistry, this fragrance is exceptionally herbal and completely enchanting. After a while, it begins to smell like an old fashioned confectionery, as it grows muskier and sweeter over time. B Scent is my lucky day scent. It's the one I wear when I want something magical to happen.
i swear lush be using and reusing the same notes.. Im so tired of bergamot yall
This LUSH fragrance has an enormous sillage. I can smell it from a mile away! It's like a more approachable version of LUSH Salty, fresh, airy, and subtly smoky.

I don't get cucumber water like the other review , moreso a hint of smokiness with the citrus and something else which must be thr wood. All in all, pleasant and unisex for sure! I have smelled aventus and this is not the same at all. Aventus has a lot more going on, so maybe it's a cousin of aventus

Not my favourite scent from Lush. Though it's mainly bergamot, to me it smells like cucumber water. One of the store assistants described this body spray as how they imagine Pedro Pascal smelling, which I agree with. It's a very gender-neutral scent, I think that because there is no musk scent that usually masculinise a fragrance, but there are wood notes. It's quite fresh and I believe perfect for summer. Though, if you're thinking of blind-buying it, I really recommend smelling it in store.

Exact dupe of Fathom V by BeauFort.

I SWEAR

And it’s a damn good deal to have 200ml for 37£ instead of 50ml for 150£

Longevity is insane

If you're a Lushie, this scent will not be anything new to you. I couldn't put my finger on if this is an old scent from a Lush product, but it still really smells like Lush.... a classic lush sort of scent profile. Hard to define but I'd say, the woody notes from Lush Elpheba (not so much the piney notes) body spray with bergamot and a hint of sugar as it dries down (not vanilla). It smells like Lush. Not something I would wear personally but nice enough. I adore HTTYD and the bottle has Toothless on it, so I really wanted to love this as I wanted it in my collection, but it's a bit too masculine leaning for my personal tastes!

This perfume smells good but in a way that isn’t as mass pleasing as other perfumes for men. It reminds me of how I perceive the creed Viking line. I like it but not every person would wanna wear it, it has a bit of individuality to it. I’d recommend giving it a sniff it’s quite interesting !
It's cool and all but what is that bottle gng 💔

I have been obsessively coveting this all year and finally picked it up today. delicious. it’s been quite some time since I’ve smelled tobacco vanille so I can’t compare however this reminds me a little of the dry down of mm by the fireplace
I am selling my 30ml bottle (UK only) - take a look at my profile, I'm downsizing my huge collection, selling loads of discontinued gems!
Rich chai latte that dries down to pure vanilla and lasts 12+ hours
If Cardamom Coffee was too dark for you, try this
I love tonka!!!!!
Good longevity and projection but I feel this year it smells different. It’s very spicy and smells a lot like clove. Not very smooth or vanillary like I remember older bottles
I love it! This is one of the scents I am looking for during fall and winter. Dark brown spicy warm vanilla and spices. Yes! The other perfumes are hella gross at Lush.
I absolutely love Turmeric Latte by Lush! It’s warm, cozy, and perfectly sweet-spicy, exactly the kind of scent I’m obsessed with. That perfume screams autumn to me 🍂🤍

i wont lie, never smelled tumeric in my life but like?? theres something so smooth and almost tea like to this???? its like a smooth milk tea, with spices and amber?? it gives like a fall candle a little but i like it!!!!!!

i fear i am doomed to dislike any scent made by lush, regardless of how appealing one might sound. this one is no exception. i was desperately searching for a chai latte fragrance (if you know of any scents that smell like the dove spiced chai latte deodorant, please hit me up) and i thought this one might be a winner. unfortunately, it was not.

to my nose, this is all turmeric and no latte. it's overly spicy, and i usually enjoy spicy frags- but this is just straight up turmeric with a slight milkiness. i could see this working better for a guy. this perfume could be saved by layering it with vanilla, but for the price point i don't think it's worth doing all that. all the lush fragrances i've tried have this weird DNA i can't really pinpoint. they all smell "off" for some reason :(
I do not see any connection with Tobacco Vanille. To my nose it has citrus opening and developes to a kind of raw and sweet dry down. I'm glad I didn't buy it blindly, but it is worth more testing.

I'm a bit confused by people describing this as a spicy or chai scent. I detect zero spices. This is a slightly lactonic, very earthy turmeric scent. Not sweet in the slightest. I was hoping this would have a bit more interest to it, but it's a straightforward realistic turmeric.
I love this but I need to stop sniffing it. Also one spray goes a LONG way so it's a good investment

I LOVE Turmeric Latte!! I FINALLY picked this up today after wanting to, meaning to, but not being quick enough about it for the past few years! Today, I went into LUSH with purpose, and picked up the 100 ml after sniffing it for the 3rd year in a row and being thoroughly enchanted by this caramelly, sweet, rich vanilla. I really wanted to love Bianco Latte, but felt underwhelmed by it. THIS is what I wanted that to be, and THIS, baby, is my latte scent!! It's also SO reasonably priced given the current state of perfume prices these days! I also happened to finally smell Tobacco Vanille today and I personally don't find Turmeric Latte to be very close to that one (and I also REALLY want T.V.!!). This one is sweeter and more easy going, great for every day and a 100% autumnal scent. I also don't pick up on the turmeric -- it's giving more vanilla latte and I'm very much fine with that :-) LOOOOOOOVE!!

PS- for a really fun sweet coffee experience, layer this with Versatile’s Croissant Café 😘👌

This smells like a chai latte. I really like it, but yeah it just doesn't smell like a turmeric latte for me. It also reminds me of gingerbread houses. I've been waiting to purchase this for a year after seeing it at a Lush store last Christmas, and it has returned in stores now that Lush has started releasing their Christmas stuff again. Longevity is mixed – sometimes it lasts a good 7 hours and other times it lasts maybe 5 max. Could be weather/temperature dependent. Otherwise the longevity is really not much to complain about. Sillage is also stronger than expected for me. This makes me feel like I spent hours and hours inside a cafe drinking countless amounts of coffee and tea and my clothes have ultimately absorbed the scent of the cafe. Lovely scent and to me, a purchase well worth waiting for.
I'm sexually attracted to this perfume
I love this perfume but all i can smell from is it tobacco vanille

I thought this was going to be as strong or even stronger than for example Chelsea Morning but this turns out to be one of the "softest" spicy fragrances I have seen at Lush. Smells like the colder seasons. Not sure I would wear it as a perfume, but as a room scent I would enjoy this.

love love love. it almost starts off a little boozy on me (my bf agrees that it smells like some kind of spiced liquor), then it settles down into this perfect spicy n toasty vanilla. the spice really does come through imo, i'm definitely getting strong whiffs of sweetened turmeric amidst the vanilla. it makes me feel super sexy, but in a cozy and natural way. i'm disappointed that it's limited edition, hopefully they bring it back!

This is a warm, cozy fragrance with a hint of spice. The opening bursts with turmeric and vanilla, creating a unique and comforting scent. As the turmeric softens, the scent transforms into the feeling of stepping into a coffee shop on a crisp autumn day. It’s exactly what I imagined, I absolutely love it.
Sexy spicy vanilla. Smells like a fall candle but not in a way that's offputting for a perfume. Would be really nice on a man or woman.
Opening is very spicy but dries down very similar to tobacco vanille. I remember this being stronger. Not much projection. Rlly nice layered with vanillary

This one is definitely not what I expected. It smells like sweet, old wood, like a heritage building with a lot of wood furnishings, but in a nice, non-musty smelling way. I don't hate it, but it doesn't smell like anything edible to me. I do detect a spiciness, but it reads more as wood to my nose, like a spicy sandalwood.

I didn’t get a chance to purchase turmeric latte last year, and I sincerely regret it because of how much I loved it. After smelling it again this year I undoubtedly will purchase. I’ve not seen any other person mention this, and the notes in this fragrance don’t really suggest this — but I personally feel that this is a photorealistic Thai tea scent. Albeit a tad bit spicier than a real Thai tea, the turmeric and benzoin do a lot of heavy lifting to give this a sharp tea-like aroma, balanced by the sweetness of Tonka and pure vanilla.

I was in a department store a few days ago and sampled Ambre Nuit Espirit de Parfum by Dior - I was immediately in love and kept smelling the sample card throughout the day trying to place where I had smelled this scent before. It was haunting me all day, I knew this scent, I was deeply familiar with it… later I opened my perfume drawer to apply my post shower fragrance and Turmeric Latte by Lush caught my eye. I gave it a smell. It couldn’t be? I grabbed the sample card with Ambre Nuit and smelled them side by side… wow. There are definitely differences and Ambre Nuit is far more refined and well rounded. But Turmeric Latte by Lush is an INSANELY affordable likeness. I always get complimented on it too. Worth picking up. Just say it’s Dior.

Guys, it’s that time of the year. Turmeric Latte is back in the UK! 🍁🍂

Edit: sniffed the 2025 version and it’s so much smoother, creamier and less scratchy.

I tried this perfume in-store last year and became a little obsessed. It's very comforting and unique. I didn't end up purchasing it, but think about it from time to time. Today I tried the popular niche fragrance called "Blanche Bete" (not a Lush perfume) and to me, from what I can remember, they are cousins! Blanche Bete has some incense notes that Turmeric Latte doesn't quite have, but the dry down I found very similar. I don't often write reviews, but I wanted to share this in case anyone loves Turmeric Latte and has a hard time finding it since it's limited edition
Give this some time and spray very lightly, below your waist, on legs, clothes. Its absolutely delicious in the right dosage. Rich, comforting, spicy, holiday wear. Love it.
I have the massage bar and it’s genuinely so good I wish I could get my hands on the actual perfume

I need it but I cant find it anywhere if someone wants to get rid of it let me know please. :')

Its really an addictive, gourmand scent perfect for cold winter days or autumn as well. It does smell exactly like a turmeric latte, but in my mind it almost feels like a spicy caramel.

seriously so sexy!! it's a little dark, and i know there's no tobacco note but there's something smoky about it to me? idk. downside is that the projection is not the greatest in winter/on clothes, but i bought this in summer and wore it all the time and it actually works quite well in heat? for me, at least. Anyway this was one of my first fragrances so i'm probably biased but i love you turmeric latte you are beautiful to me in your own way<3

i got the massage bar of this recently and it smells heavenly, maybe the smell differs between products but oh my gosh this smells SO nice. i’m not usually a fan of spice scents like turmeric and ginger that sort of smell but this is really nice. as you apply it the turmeric hits you but not long after it’s followed by tonka bean and later on the turmeric dies down leaving the scent as a nice, warm and heavy scent.
you could probably layer this with eilish 1 or very heavy/pure vanilla scents if you do prefer that with hints of warmness, i can’t wait to layer the massage bar with vanillas in the colder months i can imagine it smelling incredible
i’ll def be getting the perfume ASAP
update: i smelt the perfume on skin and the first 20 minutes was awful just full of ginger and spices but the dry down was so lovely, creamy vanilla with a hint of spices. idk if it’s worth me suffering the first 20 minutes of wearing this just so i can have a bottle :/

i love this but not on me.
it’s strictly reserved for my winter knits (scarfs, woolly jumpers and coats) such a comfort when it starts to get a little nippier outside and you can smell that very distinct note of autumn, mmm.

It pained me to have to sell this fragrance because it’s an iconic limited edition lush perfume, however, it’s not versatile enough to wear. You could only really get away with this in the cold winter months and even then, I have other warm perfumes I’d much rather reach for. It’s delicious, but not something I want to wear.
to me this smells like christmas in a bottle, not bad but i’d probably only ever wear it on christmas or cold winter days/nights

This is a lovely, layered fragrance with real vanilla wrapped in woody, resinous warmth and a gentle kick of spice. The vanilla seems to mellow and sweeten the turmeric, with a rich rooibos tea infused with turmeric and woodsy tonka heart.

Despite the long list of base notes, it only lasts about three to four hours on my skin, so I happily respray. This is gorgeous and an accessible spiced fragrance. I'm often wearing this on an autumnal work day.

Notes:
-The Tobacco Vanille comparison works in terms of autumnal cosiness, although this is less dense and more tea-forward. I do not see this as a dupe at all. Maybe if someone has a limited collection and only wants one "autumnal cosy chai/tobacco," they would choose between them. This isn't me.

-For me, it was part of the journey into spicy fragrances, and it is the perfect bridge for someone moving from a vanilla oriental or vanilla gourmand into vanilla with depth. You start with turmeric latte, then you might blend Vanilla + Babycat. Fast forward, and now you're wearing Ishq Al Shuyukh Gold.

-I would rate the turmeric higher than it is on the voted notes. I think the vanilla takes the edge off it though, so I can understand how it was rated. This is a good introuctory turmeric for the spice-nervous

I didn't find the perfume at my local Lush but only the massage bar, and it smells the same. I find it very unique as it remind me of a sweet cacao dessert but a gourmet one. I'm a gourmand perfumes lover and particulary every perfumes with caramel notes, cacao, vanilla... and this one didn't dissappoint, I find it sweet but not too much, the vanilla is there, the tonka bean and benjoin too and then the star, the turmeric. it's kinda weird first because it's so uncommon but then an addiction begin 🫣😍
It’s a very strong smoky masculine vanilla with some tumeric in it. Not the biggest fan but I can see why some people like it! It’s not a sweet gourmand and very suitable for winter.

I love Tumeric Latte. I should have gotten a full bottle when it was out

Tobacco Vanille? Not so much. Bottom 3 tom fords

I don’t know what Turmeric Latte yall smelt but you should get your olfactory receptors checked out.

I didn't like this at first but it's really grown on me recently. It has a sweet vanilla smell not in a cookie or cake kind of way but like vanilla extract from the bottle which can smell kind of synthetic but I like it nonetheless. Not a safe blind buy but definitely worth trying if this kind of smell is what you're into. I wish it was a little less sweet because it can be overpowering but it's a nice kind of darker and headier gourmand.

Has a similar profile to Matiere Premiere's vanilla powder for me but sweeter and less powdery, as both are sort of dark intense almost synthetic vanilla fragrances on my skin.

Lives up to its name, but leans more into the insence/coffee/smoky side than gourmand vanilla; the sweet vanilla side is certainly there, but it isn't as forward as in some other Lush gourmand scents. It's wonderful when layered with Vanillary (I use the solid perfume).

Letting this one macerate for a few weeks helped to remove the strange cola tinged opening...

I've known Lush for 11 years, I kinda know what to expect from their perfumes, but this one still left me speechless.

It's a comfort in a bottle. It's cozy, delicious in a way, it's unique but I'd have never, ever thought it will be so complex. There's so much going on here, it feels like there's a whole world inside the bottle.

There's smoke here and warmth of autumn sunny days, there's comforting but earthy vanilla, there's spice and sharpness, there's sweetness here too. So much thrown into one scent, yet it's balancing each other perfectly.

This isn't a safe blind buy, not a vanilla gourmand girl dream. It's mysterious, smoky, dark and intense, but warm and comforting like a blanket at the same time (and super long lasting!). It's one of the best and most unique perfumes I've ever had.
not sure if i got a bad one but it really strongly smelt of just straight up alcohol and not in a good way. in theory this is a fragrance i would love but i had to return it.

Smells like the loveliest chai latte in the quaintest little coffee shop you could imagine. Definitely a warm autumn fragrance for me, always highly complimented and I love smelling it on myself throughout the day. I have heard of people complaining the opening is plasticky or artificial, but I’d say this goes away really quickly and settles beautifully.
This does NOT smell like Tom Ford Tobacco Vanille. It smells like old root beer to my nose. Not a pleasant scent.
Absolutely adore this scent, and it stays on all day. Rich, dark, warm, but definitely not too heavy. One of my favorites.

I wouldn’t call this a 1-to-1 dupe for TF TV because turmeric here smells completely different than the clove/cinnamon dominant spices in TF. There’s also no tobacco here and an unremarkable but present one in TF. This smells like a hyper-realistic golden latte. Like if you go in youe kitchen right now and simmer turmeric and spices in milk, you’d get this scent.

Omg....smoky gorgeous incense vanilla.
Pretty much a 1-1 dupe for Tom Ford Tobacco Vanille.
Sprayed it in the Lush store and thought it was very subtle but as the day wore on I noticed its presence with the intense smokey wafts all around me. It really comes alive once it warms on the skin.
It really is a masterful fragrance.
Cozy stunning powerful smoky vanilla.
Love it!!!
10/10

A freshly brewed spicy coffee simmers down, glowing on the skin with a strong and fragrant dry down of tonka, benzoin and faint lingering turmeric; this is not a vanilla that is light on the nose and can get cloying extremely quickly sprayed more than twice on an individual wrist. Most of the lighter vanilla gourmands I own do not have the proximity that Latte does.

Turmeric latte is spicy and sweet. Read that again, because if you don’t like either of those, this will be a MAJOR no for you as it leans heavily into both. But for me? Looovveee this. It’s cozy yet bold, sweet yet spicy, playful with some edge, unoffensive yet totally in your face. It’s a chaotic little hodgepodge of everything I enjoy in a fragrance. Combine that with amazing performance, and in my humble opinion, it’s easily one of the top fragrances in this scent profile. Don’t believe me, choose your best fighter, I’ve already put my money where my nose is.

I actually made my coworker mad with this perfume - he smelled it in the kitchen and hoped for a German Gewürzkuchen, just to realise that the delicious smell was just Turmeric Latte. I made him a Gewürzkuchen as an apology. This perfume just smells so so delicious!!

got this to gear up for winter. this fragrance is spicy, it's vanillic; reminiscent of a chai latte. the tonka comes in during the dry down and adds to the warmth and comfort this fragrance brings. having read the notes prior to trying the fragrance, i was a bit weary of the turmeric note. however, the turmeric note is very weak and not off-putting; it mainly sits in the background and only adds to the spiciness. a unisex gourmand for sure. perfect for autumn & winter exclusively.

what a beautiful entrance into a new season and way of welcoming the cold.

i really tried to like this... but it just smelt like incense and tobacco to me, no vanilla whatsoever. i waited for it to dry down and nothing changed. maybe it just works poorly with my skin chem but it was just horrible to me

The description had me longing for it and I wish it lived up to the hype. The sweetness is nothing like vanilla, I actually think it smells like a certain brand of baby wipes or a sickly yellow floral while the benzoin was weird and medicinal. This is both in regards to the perfume and the massage bar, but only when they decide to smell like the same scent family! Sometimes my bottle plays a strange game where it has a 1/10 chance to give me a smoky blast of burnt wood out of nowhere while the bar has a weird tendency to smell like an ancient cucumber Dove deodorant I have lying around. I thought I wanted that smoky edge but the perfume was just distracting and people around me kept asking if something was burning. I don't think I can enjoy TL directly but I keep the bar in my drawers without any storage and it acts like an eternal room freshener.
spicy at first then dries down very sweet and tonka-y
an amazing spicy chai gourmand, gotta love her!

Turmeric Latte reminds me of being young and stepping into the bustling Indian market, where the air is rich with the scent of spices and mithai. This perfume's main accords are a blend of warm, spicy notes intertwined with sweet, milky undertones, reminding me of a traditional Indian turmeric milk drink (haldi doodh, for those of you that are desi).

Upon the first spritz, you're greeted with a bold combination of turmeric and spicy notes, which can be a bit overwhelming initially. As it settles, the fragrance unveils a comforting heart of vanilla and tonka bean, adding a creamy sweetness that balances the initial spiciness. She can be your summer, depending on the region of the world you live in and the season, but she can also be your winter too. Warming, spicy yet vanilla and ever so creamy.

Longevity is impressive, with the scent lingering on the skin for hours, and its projection is notable without being overpowering. Some might find the opening too intense, and the dry-down could lean towards a slightly synthetic sweetness. It’s a unique journey that reminds me of childhood and transports to the heart of India, blending traditional spice with modern gourmand elements.
Kind of reminds me of a toned down version of sticky dates, and also an iced pumpkin spice chai latte from Starbucks

A must, if you like spicy, woody, warm, incense-y, not too sweet fragrances. I wore it all winter. Layer with Bianco Latte and you'll smell like Christmas gingerbread cookies. Personally I love that, but can totally see it's not for everyone.

VERY spicy, with a sharpness that never dies. Barely sweet but if you're looking for an earthy vanilla, you've found it. Very individualistic. I love this and could definitely see this being a fall or winter staple/signature scent.

Three words: confident, eclectic and self-aware.

This has a strong unpleasant opening that smells like alcohol with some dirt. Eventually it becomes nice, sweet, vanilla, and milky. It is sometimes slightly too sweet or bitter, but overall I think it is a good fragrance. It lasts over 12 hours.

This perfume does not smell like chai, sorry. I love it. It's one of my favs. But it does not ACTUALLY smell like chai. Maybe it gives the impression but no. Its very smokey, almost cigarette smokey. It smells like vanilla, smoke, some spice and BREAD. It's very very bready. Some would even describe it as starchy rice. Like standing next to a rice cooker. If you want a realistic chai scent B&BW has a chai mist you can find online.

It’s not quite what I expected. Aside from the notes mentioned, I definitely also smell a very present nutmeg, pepper & maybe even clove? It totally smells like a local cake/bread hybrid we have in the Netherlands called ontbijtkoek.

I may or may not have blind bought a 30ml bottle so I’m interested to see how it develops and how it wears later this year.

A warm chai latte with frothed oat milk: bottled.

𝐬𝐜𝐞𝐧𝐭 𝐛𝐫𝐞𝐚𝐤𝐝𝐨𝐰𝐧 - Creamy, sweet, and spicy this fragrance opens with a sucker punch of warm chai spices like cinnamon, nutmeg, and cloves mixed with milky and smooth vanilla that's extremely reminiscent of the vanilla found in "Tobacco Vanille" but even more amped up. As it dries down a wonderful nutty tonka comes in to mingle with the sweetness and spices and forms a great connection between the two accords.

𝐩𝐞𝐫𝐬𝐨𝐧𝐚𝐥 𝐭𝐡𝐨𝐮𝐠𝐡𝐭𝐬 - It's quite literally like you take the spiced vanilla aspect from Tom Ford's "Tobacco Vanille" and boost up the amount of spices, add a lot of nutty tonka to the mix, and add a frothed milk-like accord to the mix. Honestly, it's one of the best Tobacco Vanille-esque fragrances on the market, and I highly recommend picking this up before Lush inevitably shelves it after the winter season.

𝐩𝐞𝐫𝐟𝐨𝐫𝐦𝐚𝐧𝐜𝐞 - 8-11 hour performance with great 6-foot projection for the first 3.5 or so hours.

𝐫𝐚𝐭𝐢𝐧𝐠 - 9.5/10.

𝐰𝐡𝐞𝐧 𝐭𝐨 𝐰𝐞𝐚𝐫 - Museum and coffee dates; Snuggling under your favorite blanket while sipping chai on a cold day; holiday shopping dates around midtown

𝐬𝐨𝐧𝐠 𝐯𝐢𝐛𝐞 - Feather by Nujabes, Cise Starr and Akin

𝐓𝐋𝐃𝐑 - Tobacco Vanille Vanilla + chai spices + nutty tonka + whipped milk accord. Intoxicatingly delicious yet simple. Easily one of the best from the house, and a must-try if you love spicy vanilla fragrances.

How is this L'Artisan Parfumeur Tea for Two?? I'm blown away by the similarity- spicy, smoky, sweet black tea. Since TfT recently started to smell different on me (hurray, menopause), I bought a full bottle of Turmeric Latte at 12 hours after testing when it had finally disappeared from my wrist.

I'm currently rewatching Twin Peaks and as Turmeric Latte is one of my ultimate favorite frags, I sprayed some of it on my wrist before continuing an episode and it is just the perfect scent for the show, if that makes sense. Cosy like a warm drink by a burning fireplace, sensual, mysterious like an adventure in the woods, and a little odd in the best way possible. When I first smelled this in a Lush store I was a little puzzled even though I liked it, but now everytime I smell this it comforts me yet transports me to a more exciting place.
This is a scent that I hope will never get discontinued, a true gem.

this smells really good however it’s very sweet! the opening can be off putting but the dry down is really good, it smells like spiced vanilla?

edit:

smells like middle eastern black tea with cloves, cardamom and vanilla! not sure if i wanna smell like that but it’s nice

Lush’s perfume game is absolutely nuts compared to other bath and body companies like B&BW and their synthetic ass mists that last microseconds. Lush is genuine quality and they.. actually.. PERFORM!!

Turmeric Latte on the opening is smooth, velvety chai spices that quickly envelop into a milky & spicy chai latte that you’d have in a café on a cold winter morning. Amazing!!

I absolutely love this perfume. To me, it's the perfect mix of spicy & creamy sweet vanilla that's cozy and comforting for winter. It is definitely reminiscent of a chai latte, and the sweetness isn't too overpowering, the balance feels great. Simply delicious & has me sniffing my wrist all day!! Projection is nothing crazy but it does last a fair amount on me (6-8h). Definitely buying the 100mL next autumn.

I wish my skin liked this perfume, I sampled it in store, let it set for a few hours, and I still NEVER smelled any of the vanilla. I suppose it smells like chai, but I'm not into strong spicy scents, especially chai..... It was giving burnt rubber, and my skin absolutely hated it lol

This is incredibly smoky on me. Instead of chai latte, I get a soft vanilla scent ruined by the overpowering smell of something burning nearby. Not a fireplace, but a huge bonfire producing thick black smoke. It made me think of the ending scene of The VVitch with the naked witches around the firepit (After rewatching that clip I must say, that this smells much smokier than their fire looks). Very strong and suffocatingly smoky. I almost need to cough, when smelling this. Softens a bit after a while, but it's still unwearable for me.

Realistic chai latte smell, reminds me of my first semester ever at college where I would get chai lattes in between classes at the local cafe. A very expensive habit I made, I know, but it made me feel more studious and was obsessed with chai lattes at the time. This brings me back. Easily a fall reach, has good longevity and pretty decent projection. Creamy and lactonic but also spicy from the turmeric. Perfectly linear frag, notes don’t change whatsoever throughout the lifetime. Just very, very realistic. May be a little too realistic if you’re not a gourmand lover but if you are and love chai, you need this in your collection. Don’t know when I will bite the bullet but I will at some point :)

they really need to make this an all year round perfume, i don't care if it doesn't suit spring or summer, this perfume is just absolutely amazing.

a super smoky bonfire with a strong layer of a vanilla bean custard that's been dusted with turmeric. it reminds me a lot of replica's 'autumn vibes' but the vanilla is much stronger.

it's definitely something i'd wear nearly daily in november-december, but still wear occasionally throughout the year.

definitely interested in looking into lush's over perfumes now, i was only really interested in their soaps and bath bombs before...

This is an absolute masterpiece that’s still under the radar. Once people realize how good it is, they’ll regret not getting a bottle, especially now that it’s discontinued. Turmeric Latte is a truly hidden gem, blending warm, spicy notes with a creamy, cozy undertone. It’s rich, unique, and far from the typical mass-market gourmands.
surprised that no one say this smells like BBW marshmallow fireside. it is really similar

My first ever perfume purchase and I could not be happier. Seriously addicting. I love it so much I got the Turmeric Latte massage bar from Lush too, so I could smell it without using up my precious perfume!! My blind first impression on paper was that it smelled like a delicious wooden desk, but now that I have worn it many more times I definitely understand people describing it in gourmand terms, or "smelling like christmas". Feels sweet in a cute way both feminine and masculine, which I really enjoy since I'm nonbinary. Friends who I've shown it to agree that it smells delicious. Not sure how it holds up in hot weather/spring/summer months, though, I can see how it might become cloying. I can also see the potential for it to smell like Play-Doh in the unfortunate way that a lot of Lush stuff does when it goes sour. I understand why it's a seasonal winter product but I wish it wasn't so limited edition!

I blind purchased this after falling in love with their Sticky Dates and Yog Nog products. It is a nice spicy vanilla scent but I was kind of dissapointed that it wasn't a bit sweeter. The notes made it sound like a very sweet, caramel spice fragrance. I get no caramel at all. It also doesn't have great longevity. I will let it sit and come back to it.

Don't listen to anyone who says it's smoky or similar to TV or whatever. Those people have a recently purchased bottle of Turmeric Latte. For like a year, that's what it smells like. But then it changes into rice pudding. You know, like the dessert? Just milk, rice and vanilla. Just the slightest trace of smoke, so slight you'd have to be looking for it. My husband always comments that I smell delicious whenever I wear this. Buy it now and forget about it in some dark recess of your closet until next fall or winter. Then try it out and you'll have your newest favorite cozy scent for cold weather.

This is my favorite winter cozy scent. It smells like a Christmas candle, but not overly artificial which is amazing. It is just a little boozy on me, as well, which I love. Syrupy, fragrant, cozy, a little boozy and smoky. Kinda smells like a bar in your hometown the weekend before Christmas with a simmer pot in the background. It smells more like Tonka bean to me rather than vanilla. Longevity is not the greatest on me 4-5 hours and then it dies down. This is a great winter nighttime perfume though so that does not matter. Projection is fantastic! I would rate this a 8.5/10.
Much more Almond / Marzipan foreword than I expected. I like it after it's been on the skin for 5ish hours but I can't get over the initial almond every time and so will probably not keep.

This IS a TF Tobacco Vanille dupe but better, it doesn't have the odd metallic dried fruit note that I dislike in TF. Projection is amazing, I tried it on and had people a few feet in front of me comment on it.

This is a gorgeous scent with a warm and spicy, vanilla dry down. It creates a beautiful, warm and comforting scent bubble around you that lasts all day! I’m not keen on the opening, which I find quite harsh and punchy, but this does settle quite quickly. The dry down is everything! Perfect for a cold autumn or winters day.

This actually reminds me of BDK Rouge Smoking. It’s also relatively cheap and currently limited edition. If you like chai latte fragrances, this is an excellent buy! Get it while you can. I hope they bring it back in 2025!

Absolutely love this fragrance. The tumeric notes are very subtle, it's mostly a strong, spicy Tonka and vanilla scent. One of my most complimented. Layered with the Chelsea morning solid perfume, you've got the most sexy gourmand fragrance ever! Will mention, it is pretty strong and spicy so if you're not into smelling a little bit like a fireplace, you may not like this. But this is my winter signature scent!

I am by no means a fragrance expert, but as someone looking for decent vanilla scents, I’m in love with this spray. I stumbled across it while sampling at lush, and it was the only one that wasn’t too sickly. Since it is from lush, I personally don’t feel like it’s actually that complex of a scent, it doesn’t really change throughout the wear. But it’s very good for a vanilla and gentle spice.

I have actually gotten comments about smelling like vanilla while wearing it! It doesn’t last the longest over clothes, maybe 6H max, but UNDER clothes it still smells phenomenal even after a 12h active on-my-feet shift.

Love it for the cold months, it’s great for layering with the vanilla bourbon MixBar body mist. Currently my staple scent, but probably won’t be on the top for the rest of the year.

Overall like an 8/10 especially for a perfume that’s from a bath company rather than a “professional” perfume company.

I am not smelling anything chai from this. I was very excited for this release and finally had the chance to test it out. To my disappointment this is a super harsh and woody fragrance, with hardly any vanilla or anything gourmand. It's straight up turmeric with other unknown spices thrown into the mix. Longevity was barely there, so this was easy to wash off.
Very very smoky & incense heavy. It is a little sweet but it’s more of that smoky sweet. It does smell nice but it’s nothing something i’d wear
christmastime at grandma's house. chai tea latte. gourmand candles in winter. (and yes, smoky spicy playdough)

I actually hated this one, so glad I tested in-store and didn't blind-buy based off the glowing reviews on the official website. It just smelt like playdough and incense to me, I sprayed it on my arm thinking maybe it'll get better but still playdough and incense.

Its very warm and spicy i luv it, i blind bought it and i didnt regret it at all. For me it smells kind of ginger and tumeric when you first smell it, but when it dries down it smells like a warm milky vanilla latte, and tbh i dont really think it resembles a chai latte. but kind of disapointed that the sillage of this perfume isnt good enough, it last long on your clothes but doesnt last really long on your skin.

Smells so warm and cozy reminds me of Tabacco vanilla for the pipe and how body shop vanilla fragrance used to smell like it’s stunning and can’t wait for them to bring it back again next year as they always bring it out for Christmas lush know how to perfume and do it so well

Spicy. Sweet. Warm. Cosy. Comforting. It's perfect for colder weather and the Christmas season. Don't let the "Latte" in the name fool you though, I wouldn't describe it as creamy or lactonic as the word would suggest. But I love this scent. Good projection, lasting power and sillage. Have received compliments at work on this one.

Spicy, sweet (but not too sweet) vanilla with some smoky amber. I also get a slightly lactonic impression of hazelnut? It's not all that creamy/milky for a 'latte' perfume, but it's very cosy. Strong and long-lasting (particularly on clothes), which does make it easy to overspray.

Okay I know that I love this, however I opened a new bottle I got from the lush seasonal sale and upon the first spray I seem to be getting a whiff of slime??? Like borax and glue slime???! Very weird, hoping It just needs to go into a dark place and age for a little while, if it's a bad bottle I will be upset :(

Easily one of my favourite fragrances of all time. A gorgeous spicy vanilla scent with a touch of incense. Slightly smokey, but so beautiful on the skin. Smells great in the cold, i’ve had so many compliments on it! I adore it so much I had to pick up three bottles. Could be overwhelming if you’re used to more gentle vanilla scents.

First spray is quite jarring, a very back-of-the-throat fragrance, not a huge fan on the initial spray. One of my favourites when it's been sitting for 20ish minutes. Gorgeous smoky vanilla, my personal everyday alternative to babycat

Incredible addictive.

This fragrance is lovely. Warm and cosy, like a hug from a maternal figure. Grounding and comforting.

I purchased a 30ml in store and had to get the 100ml when I realised this is a limited edition.

I simply cannot live without this scent, it’s sublime.

The projection is great too and lasts all day, I’ll be thinking about this scent for years to come.

On me, I get vanilla and a LOT of woodsmoke, like full-on campfire. Absolutely no turmeric or coffee, though, so I don't really know where the name comes from. I actually don't feel comfortable wearing this to work because it smells so clearly of smoke -- not a 'clean' scent by any means, but absolutely fab for weekends and nights out. Really affordable, too (I paid £30 for my 30ml bottle last year).

this is a beautiful scent. blind bought this based on some reviews and wow! on me, it pulls as a spicy, sweet vanilla, almost like a chai concentrate with ginger. my partner says it has an incense like smell to them on paper, but not so much on skin. it doesn’t radiate very far, but it is super long lasting and comforting. i want to purchase the larger bottle so bad its perfect. 10/10

was shown this in lush the other day and fell in love instantly. i smelled vanillary at first, which was a disappointing assault of jasmine on my nose. this was everything i expected that to be!! sweet, spicy, yummy gourmand goodness, perfectly smoky and warm. it brings to mind the experience of eating chai cookies fresh out of the oven, or a hug from someone just departed from a bakery on a cool winter evening. i'm quite surprised nobody has mentioned this as a dupe for van cleef & arpels bois doré. trying both on the same day, i was struck by the sheer similarity; both maintain a gentle balance between smoky-spicy and sweetness. truly two gorgeous gorgeous scents, but tumeric latte especially for the price point!!

My nose is a mess after having COVID last August, and perfumes with natural ingredients seem to be the only fragrances that don't smell "off." I decided to give Lush fragrances a sniff, and I really enjoyed Tumeric Latte. There's a lovely incense (not listed) in the beginning that I wish stuck around longer, but overall, it smells like a better, more natural version of BDK Rouge Smoking. As it dries down, it becomes softer and simpler until you're left with a vanilla/amber skin scent. It lasted a solid six hours. Lovely perfume that isn't too sweet or gourmand.

Literally the best thing I've smelled to date. My friend told me I 'smell like Christmas' when she first smelled it on me. Turmeric latte is a comforting cup of coffee paired with a massive piece of delicious gingerbread on a dark autumn evening as the leaves on the trees dance down to the ground. It's a little smoky, very sweet, delightfully warm -- perfect. It's the fragrance that has gotten me the most compliments and I deserved them.

This is a weird one for me, I don't get any gourmand from this, on me it's straight up smoke and incense from the start. Kind of intense. After an hour or so, it's still smoky but less intense, like bonfire embers? No Chai, no Latte, no spices, not sweet, barely any vanilla at all, maybe a hint at the end. Mostly smoke. I'm a little bummed because I would have loved to smell what you all smell. Debating whether or not to return it, I kinda like a little smokiness with something else, but this is nothing but. Maybe I'll try to layer it with something else and see.

Wowwww, second winter wearing it and I'm in love all over again. It lasts ALLL day and stays on clothes for ages. Cozy, spicy, powdery luscious vanilla. The slightest milkiness, but not sickly sweet. A bohemian gourmand*~*~

Marzipan and Nag Champa 🥹

Many people here have described it as a chailatte, so when I blind bought it I imagined a rather vanilla, light, fluffy chailatte scent. But this one is much spicier and darker than I thought. It has a syrupy kind of sweetness and I can feel a hint of something lactonic in the background. It would have been perfect if it wasn't for the metallic scent that I get on my skin at first when I spray it. After a while it goes away though and after I first let it macerate for a couple of months the metallic smell got weaker, although it didn't go away completely.
The longevity is up to maybe five hours and the sillage is good enough for other people to feel it if you walk past them.
This smells just like the starbucks chai tea latte. Spicy and perfectly sweet. Might be the perfect gourmand scent for winter and fall.

no idea where people are picking up the gourmand vibe in here because this scent definitely translates into straight up powder on my skin (especially on the dry down), which yes i absolutely love but just didn’t expect from the reviews.
i tried the turmeric latte body bar before buying the perfume and i can assure that it’s a pretty strong scent! the body bar alone can be smelled on my skin even the day after using it and i’m sure the perfume will perform well!
the spices are definitely noticeable in this so it’s not something to consider trying if you’re a fan of those sickly overpowering sweet gourmands ;)
i put this on my puffer coat 2 weeks ago and it still smells of delicious gingerbread with no reapplying. this is IT.

i fell in love with this immediately. feels like a comforting, warm hug in the winter as you sip a cup of chai latte. it's my favourite fall perfume, worth a try if you're looking for a gourmand that's not sickenly sweet!

A photorealistic gourmand, perfect if you want to smell like the most delicious Chai Latte. This one and Sticky Dates are, so far, the most interesting fragrances from Lush.

Turmeric Latte smells like a photorealistic Chai Latte, full of yummy spices, cinnamon. It's very spicy, but not the pepper spicy kind, more like the yummy spices of gingerbread.

A true gourmand, it makes me hungry when I smell it, or it makes me crave something sweet or a Chai Latte. The notes that are listed are irrelevant, just as they are for many Lush fragrances. I guess they don't want others to know their recipe. The only listed note that is noticeable is vanilla. An apple note in this fragrance would've been chef's kiss. I recommend layering Turmeric Latte with an apple pie perfume. Small note to myself, this smells exactly like the Spiced Chai Latte from Renee Cafe, minus the baked apple taste (which was the best Chai Latte I've ever had in my life). It has depth, smells way more complex than 90% out of all the designer fragrances.
Layer with the tumeric latte body balm lasts 12 hours

This just smells like TF's Tobacco Vanille for me. I genuinely cannot smell a difference, apart from in the drydown, I smell more of the turmeric note but it's slightly sour so more like a tamarind. Not a bad sour though. Rich, dark and slightly boozy. I sprayed it once in the morning on my wrist and could still smell it (not strongly) throughout the day. I get the spice and the woodiness throughout the day.

it smells so good it has depth on its own . it can be amazing to layer and add depth to other scents , i would describe it as like smokey vanilla with slight peppery/spice notes . it has good projection

I really enjoy this perfume, though it makes me sneeze when I first put it on. The bottle (especially the lid) also feels cheap, and the atomizer is not amazing, but good enough. The spicy/peppery smell does not linger very long compared to the vanilla, but the vanilla smell itself is very pleasant. Sweet and warm.

This is addictive. It’s giving amber vanilla custard with spice, but somehow is not overtly gourmand at the same time. It’s also not a loud scent, which I prefer. It’s a little dark, moody, a touch a sweetness and something exotic. Definitely will be in my top rotation this winter!
smokey playdoh. The drydown is nice but it takes way too long to get there and by that point it's a skin scent.
I love this but after spraying 6+ times a few hours later I couldn’t really smell it. It’s too expensive for just a skin scent.
hmmm it’s just smoky marzipan on me. which makes it a miss, but probably just because i don’t like marzipan.

I hated it straight from the bottleat first, all i was getting was the turmeric and benzoin, i was sad that i wasted my money and swore to never blind buy again but after like 30 to 60 mins it became heavanly. The best Tabacco Vanille dupe ive ever come across (edit: while both are unisex, Tabacco Vanille leans more male to me, Turmeric Latte is like a tiny bit sweeter more female leaning version of Tabacco Vanille). Its like a warm smoky cozy tonka hug.

Omg....smoky gorgeous incense vanilla.
Pretty much a 1-1 dupe for Tom Ford Tobacco Vanille.
Sprayed it in the Lush store and thought it was very subtle but as the day wore on I noticed its presence with the intense smokey wafts all around me. It really comes alive once it warms on the skin.
It really is a masterful fragrance.
Cozy stunning powerful smoky vanilla.
Love it!!!
10/10

No, no, absolutely not!
I am into spiced vanilla ambers but this is not it, annoying cheap spice cupboard smell 😑

Tobacco Vanille is (was?) my favourite perfume period, but I just couldn’t justify buying a perfume for that much money… so when I caught wind that this is a dupe, I had to get my hands on it. I’m obsessed. Not only is it a great dupe, but the longevity and sillage are great, especially for the price.

A beautiful, smokey vanilla that only becomes more complex as it dries down. Sweet, but with a darkness that stops it from being cloying or nauseating with wear. Definitely my signature cold-weather fragrance now.

I really don't get a latte style scent from this. I think when I wear this I small like a bonfire with a marshmallow toasting in it! I reminds me of wearing something sweet while sitting next to a fire pit. Cozy and lovely but I'm not sure it matches it's name (not on me anyway!). I'd have called it Bonfire Night!

This is VERY woody and a lot less sweet/milky than I thought. It does not smell like tumeric or a tumeric latte at all. There's a hint of sweetness in there which pops out more after 1-2 hours on my skin, but it's still a bit too dark for my taste. Very suitable for colder weather though! Not a safe blind buy but definitely worth testing in store.
Absolutely obsessed with this. It smells like a warm, cozy cafe - absolutely delicious. There's also something sexy to it though...

I truly smell like a fresh latte from a small coffee shop when I wear this. It goes on extremely loud, but by the time I’m out the door, it truly settles into this cozy, warm cinnamon scent. This is a true fall/winter scent that I love to wear in the day time if I’m running errands but may be a bit overwhelming in small settings because it projects pretty loud.

sooooooo yummy.. initially very strong and almost offensive but when it dries down it's the most wonderful delicious inside of a tiny coffee shop on a deep autumn day type scent like just sooooo good and it lasts on my clothes for ages... will get a huge bottle next year...
When I wore this to work a while back, a coworker repeatedly asked what or who had baked or was eating gingerbread cookies. 😂 😁
This is back in stock for the fall! It's a perfect Tom Ford Tobacco Vanille dupe but much less expensive! Grab it if you can!
Very synthetic vanilla and turmeric with some tobacco. Reminds me of a cheaper version of tobacco vanille.

love love love this fragrance. i've been slowly trying to get into vanilla/gourmand fragrances and although i think the spice could be a bit intense for some, i think it complements the vanilla really well. there's a bit of creaminess in there as well. weirdly smells like thai tea to me? i see a lot of people compare it to tobacco vanille, but i personally much prefer turmeric latte - i don't get tobacco at all from this. lasts forever on my skin as well. huge fan!

not a safe blind buy for sure, but if you like gourmands go to ur local lush and try it when it comes back!!!

9.5/10
Not sweet, not creamy, not interesting. Smells kind of like cardboard. No sillage either!

this is literally just a spicier tom ford tobacco vanille—it has the exact same vanilla note. i like it but if i had known it was basically a dupe, i would’ve passed. fortunately i also got the massage bar that’ll help the staying power where tom ford only usually lasts a handful of hours on me before its basically just a skin scent. i like it, but if you have tobacco vanille, you do not need this lol

edit: this does still very much smell like tobacco vanille but i sprayed it again today and it smells more marshmallow-y than my initial wear. interesting.
Gingerbread syrup, mellow and comforting. Christmas but sexy.

The name is so fitting. It smells exactly like a turmeric latte but not in a heavy sticky way. I can see why people are saying this smells like chai tea latte but in my opinion it does not. Also, this smells nothing like tobacco vanille. This is definitely worth the hype. Will be buying once it’s back in stock.

Edit: I recently tried this again and I think something with my skin chemistry is different because I now do not like it. There’s something that gives it a weird metallic like smell on skin. Whereas on paper it still smells nice.
I get such strong BDK Rouge Smoking vibes from this. There isn't a 100% synthetic cherry smell coming from turmeric latte, but something reminiscent there on the dry down is similar to rouge smoking.
Smells like one of those Müller yoghurts to me. Can’t complain, as it’s actually really good for the price.
This reminds me of Baxters Buns loose leaf tea from T2. I might try layering it with something sweet to give it some extra dimension.
Okay, am i crazy or this smells like TF tobacco vanille!?

Turmeric Latte smells like spicy roiboos tea with a hint of vanilla and a little milk on top. Rather bitter at the beginning, like if you left the teabag in the cup for too long. I also think I smell some smoke, maybe it's the turmeric. In the drydown it becomes sweeter and more vanilla comes through. It's not sweet enough for my taste. I expected something different, something like sticky dates but different 😅 i have a bottle though and it grew on me 😬🤭
this does not smell like a chai latte lmfao
Vanilla, dark sugar. Not spicy at all, more herbal or earthy from the turmeric. Vanilla in a dusty old antique store.
tobacco vanille if it slayed

my signature scent. smells like molasses and vanilla/baking spice incense that’s been burning a tad too long. it’s distinctly not creamy - like the black coffee of spiced vanillas. this is a textbook autumn/holiday scent that kind of just makes me feel at home in my skin and body. it’s decadent and rich, but not significantly sweet, which i think would make this palatable for a huge range of people. i would call it a very elegant gourmand, which i think are relatively rare since warm gourmands often evoke cloying b&bw sugary sweet. careful spraying this, as it’s dark enough to stain light fabric a little bit, but this is such an elegant and interesting spice scent that has become an extension of my body

hmm, everyone keeps saying that it smells like a fresh chai latte but idk. Would probably only layer it with something vanilla heavy and sweet/creamy to add some spice. On itself I find it to be too 'sour' or tangy, not rounded. Thought it would be softer and creamier. (I still have to wait for the dry down after a few hours, a lot of people say that it gets better over time)

Update: Nope, i hate it

I echo the three reviews below me, initially upon first spray it smells like Chinese 5 spice with a BLAST of extra clove!!!

It almost gives the texture of a Christmas tree trunk, I do love clove but the opening is just so strange and a little off-putting. On me that opening lasts longer than the vanilla phase which is unfortunate. This has little to no lasting power and the colour of the juice aside feels very watery?

Hopefully with time the vanilla with come out more...
I don't enjoy the initial spray, but after a few hours it evolves into a very warm, spicy vanilla scent. This is definitely a fall fragrance

I've worn this for the first time today and never before have I received so many compliments on my perfume!! My coworkers have described this as a Christmas Bakery - I'm from Germany and in our Christmas Baking we use a lot spices.. not Tumeric though. A lot of people smelled cinnamon and a specific German gingerbread blend called Lebküchengewürz which makes me feel like this scent is way more winter leaning even though I like it as a fall "pumpkin spice season" scent. Even customers have complimented me on it which was a first for me and that was at the end of a 9 hour shift without reapplying it! I love sweet, gourmand scents so this was right up my alley!!

smells like campfire, smoke, fragrant wood burning. i dont detect too much spice. definitely unisex, and not as sweet as i expected? i don't think i would even classify this as gourmand..? i like it though, but i wish it lasts longer. definitely a cooler weather/nighttime scent. i bought this because i loved the massage bar - but it was sadly way more creamy/sweet than the perfume. at first spray the smell makes my nasal cavity close up, literally like i'm breathing in smoke so i definitely can't overspray this one.

So moderately spicy and sweet that it actually comes off a little boring. I would use this to layer. It's not bad, and you might like this if you're into uncomplicated scents. I do agree with the other commenters, do not blind buy. This reminds me of Eau Duelle (which is much more powdery and not as spicey. Not a dupe, just similar). This is earthy enough to not be mistaken as anything other than a Lush brand fragrance.

Not blind buy safe. This is not a gooey gourmand. This is somewhat like a woody-slightly sweet scent. Try to smell it in store, there's no chai vibes here, nothing lactonic. It is like...a vanilla candle? Disappointing tbh I think it would smell better on clothes than skin

This one’s confusing. It smells good then bad, then good, then bad. When it smells good, it smells like tonka bean, when it smells bad, it smells like literal dog food, kibble. Do not blind buy this and test on skin.
If you didn’t know it before, it’s delicious and it’s finally back in stock!
my friend says it smells like cough syrup :( cant unsee now

I really wanted to like this. It starts out with an earthy, smokey chai, with some vanilla in the background, but the dry down smelled more and more like liquorice on my skin. Maybe 20-30 minutes later it’s begins to smell like a nicer soft vanilla which I like just not willing to wait to get that vanilla note I like. Smells better on my girlfriend than on myself, but definitely a unisex scent

Very spicy and a little bit pissy. More so than I thought it would be. Dry down is softer and vanillin like. I wound not wear this in its own I think, but definitely will be layering this with sweater vanilla scents to give them more punch. Very unisex in my opinion and might even be better on a man!
Its literally like a warm hug, very comforting and cosy for winter…. cookies, christmas vibes

Ahh! Are you my signature fall scent, Turmeric Latte?!

This scent is just...everything. It's the cozy drink you order at your local café; it's the perfect fall candle you buy as soon as it hits September. It's an ode to comfort and soft, quiet nights with soft jazz and a book.

Sweet, just a touch smoky, just a little spicy. Nothing too strong. Less nuanced than I expected, but I love the scent so much that it's okay to be a bit linear

Sampled at the store and had all my friends say that I smelled like a candle (in a good way)

I never would've smelled this on my own - but the Lush associate recommended it! So pleasantly surprised

If there are any Canadians who think this smells familiar but can’t quite place it, it smells exactly like the vanilla scented orbeez air fresheners in a little plastic tub they sold at Dollarama in the early 2010s (might still sell them actually)
very similiar to ysl babycat, albeit a bit less leathery and smokey. probably my favourite lush fragrance, if you like a spicy gourmand you’ll probably like this

smelt in stores this reminds me so much of frustration by eldo definitely a cheaper version of frustration and less boozy but this is sooo good i am not a gourmand person but this deep spicy gourmand is incredible
It's back, everyone!

I’ve got so many perfumes of all different price ranges but this is an all-time favourite. Spicy, soft, warm, interesting, beautiful. One of my most worn and most complimented frags. And it was £25! Magic

the best cozy, gourmand, winter scent.. warm, spicy, delicious, without being cloyingly sweet. it's so good, i'm so happy they brought it back. it smells exactly like golden milk/haldi doodh, i'm in love !!!!!

I really hope they bring this back for winter 2024 - I bought a small bottle last year and I've almost used it all up. The ultimate cozy winter scent - gourmand, but not sickly sweet. Perfectly unisex.
Not a review but a comment. I haven’t tried this perfume but I know I don’t want to smell like tumeric. My tumeric pills smell horrible. Can’t knock it until I try it I guess.

I do like the scent of this but on me it came off a little strong, and sort of invoked a memory of someone cooking something delicious in a cosy kitchen. Not a bad memory per se, but I wouldn't want to wear it all day unfortunately.
Discovering this while working at lush was the best thing I got out of the job. Very wintery scent but I wear it all year round because I like it so much. Spicy gourmand and vanilla excellence.
Hmmmm the turmeric latte massage bar is so good hmmmmmm

This is nice. It’s nice to see it when it’s on sale. It’s like a hug in a bottle. Like walking into a candle mom’s house around fall/winter time (iykyk). It sort of has an almost plastic undertone to it similar to vanillary, but it’s way better. It doesn’t seem to be a loud and intrusive smell, but I don’t see a bottle lasting me that long, tbh. I’d probably have to use a bit. It almost reminds me of serge lutens chergui, but softer and a little more feminine. I do think this is unisex, but leans more feminine.

One of my favourite perfumes ever, so whatever I'll write here might still not give it justice! But I'll try.

My husband said it smells like Christmas. I get tonka, caramely benzoin notes, and cloves. Absolutely ZERO tumeric. None. Chai latte would be a much better name, but even then, this is not milky enough.

It's very rich and creamy; I can also see where the comparison between this and rice pudding comes from. It's a gourmand perfume that does not copy all the other, pedestrian gorumands available on the market. It's definitely more of a winter scent, but, to my suprise, it works well in any weather. I live in a country that is hot all year round and I found it easy to wear even when it's 30 degrees outside. Some vanilla perfume can get boring after a while, but this is just wonderful. I can't get enough!

The projection and longevity is spectacular, particularly if you spray it on clothes. I wore it on a windy day and I kept getting these whiffs of deliciousness throughout the day.

Lastly, I agree that this is similar to Tobacco Vanille by Tom Ford, although perhaps slightly less smokey (in a good way). Myrrh and Tonka by Jo Malone also comes to mind, but not so much in terms of how it smells: it is a similar "vibe," or genre of perfume, particularly in the way it uses tonka. If you are into either of those, you should definitely try Tumeric Latte! Don't let the name fool you.

I wore this to work one time for the first time and someone said it smelled mmm mmm good like rice puddin’!!! I wasn’t mad at it though. 🤷🏻♀️

When I smelled it in store for the first time it had that campfire Smokey element at first blast which is what I first loved about it and made me want to purchase it! However when I ordered my bottle online… that campfire smoke aspect was no where to be found. So I’m still on the hunt for a campfire burning wood scent. But this smells nice and it projects like a beast. Someone gon smell you chile that’s for sure lol.

It’s giving off chai latte vibes.

It’s giving a snickerdoodle cookie, with a glass of almond milk on the side vibes. It’s a spicy, mature gourmand.

I went from disliking this to loving it, to it being one of my most used fragrance. Originally I thought it smelled like very flat vanilla. Now it’s a warm and inviting, slightly spicy scent. Not suitable for the hottest summer days, but it’s still quiet versatile and enjoyable all year round.

This is a really interesting fragrance I like having in my collection. I like that this fragrance is authentic with its more raw form ingredients, it doesn’t get cloying due to this and it’s easy to wear even during the day despite it being and warm. I wore this for a big walk in the heat of the sun in summer and it didn’t make me feel sick or anything.

This is spicy like chai with a vanilla base which makes it yummy, however I personally don’t find this fragrance that sweet. Perfect autumn smell, really different and yummy. It for sure has that raw unrefined feeling to it which I appreciate.

At first whiff I definitely get the Tom ford Tobacco Vanille, however once you are familiar with both they are really quite different so wouldn’t say this would dupe tobacco Vanille. It’s a totally different vibe of perfume. TV is intense, night time, sexy. TL is yummy spicy, raw, soft, approachable.

This brings me back to uni days when my flatmates used to make chai and the whole apartment used to smell. It's really sweet, it's got milkiness as well as spiciness. I can't say turmeric is the spice I feel the most, it's more like cardamom to me. I didn't have the best of luck with Lush perfumes so far, having not like Shade, Breath of God nor American Cream, but this one is really good.

The turmeric in this is the most powerful note. If you don't like food from other places in the world, you won't like this, it's pungent! It's absolutely perfect, spicy and smoky and just like having an almond milk chai latte, heavy on the chai. Yellow, root-y, slightly charred. Love spraying it in my hair, works really well with oils. Reminds me of steam coming from a pot in a spice market.

There's a smokiness & bitterness to this that I can't tolerate.

Another reviewer said something along the lines of it not being a complete fragrance, there's something missing to round it off, & I agree.

It's trying to be gourmand but it's just not sweet enough! Perhaps layering it with something sweet would do it for you. I've read some reviews where people have layered it with Vanillary (also by Lush). Maybe give that a go ¯⁠⁠_⁠(⁠ツ⁠)⁠_⁠/⁠¯

There is something about it that draws me in & messes with my head! Overall however, it lacks the gourmand-esque vibe that I was hoping it would give.

It's a NO from me!

these perfumes are so comforting! it is my latest blind buy and i have to say, i’m love. it’s so warm and addictive! if you expect lactonic vibes, i don’t feel it to be honest. it’s more sweet warm spices without milk. it gives me a TF tobacco vanille impression. perfect for colder weather.

Very very very similar in dry down as TF Tobacco Vanille.
I worked in Lush for a couple of years and have a bottle of TL at home.
One of my male friends visited me and was wearing Tobacco Vanille and it kept reminding me of something.

It didn’t take long for me to get to Turmeric Latte. It’s basically a dupe!
(The body spray with the same name smells the same and is even a better bang for your buck!)

Selling my 30 ml bottle, I bought three months ago. Text me here or on IG: radia_parfum.
It’s lovely but smells like burned almonds on me.

This is a rollercoaster of a perfume to me. Very intense and overwhelming (but in a good way) at first, rich smokey and spicy scent, but the drydown is soft, but gets rather tacky couple hours down the line. I don't like the residue smell it leaves on clothes either. I really wanted to love it when I got it, but it's been a little deceiving, to be used in moderation.

honestly, to me this reads quite powerdy, almost like a fresh diaper. I didn't like that aspect of it at all. I wanted to life this perfume, and the smoke/spiciness is nice- just a. bit too much for me. I also found myself wanting it to be a bit sweeter given it's a Christmas time release and it's supposed to be gourmand.

Rating: 🤢
Do I like it: Nah
Who it is: 🤢
Smells I get: 🤢
Meyer's Briggs type: /

Too sour for me. The only Lush perfume so far that I've scrubbed within an hour after application. Spicy, pissy vanilla. Putrid.

very smoky, more than expected from a perfume called turmeric latte, i thought there would be hints of coffee or cream, either way its a lovely sent for winter and autumn, I like to layer it with other vanilla or amber scents, I imagine it would work nicely with an almond smell also.

A lovely, heavy, sweet winter perfume. It felt so comforting and familiar when I smelled it in store. It's a little more dark and sultry than a typical sweet vanilla. Not super smoky, but a deep spiced vanilla. It leans more honeyed than sugary. I don't get turmeric, but there is some anise, cinnamon, and coumarin in it.

Trumeric Latte fills a niche in my fragrance wardrobe that saves me from buying other high-end perfumes. It isn't a dupe, but it reminds me of the following that have been on my wishlist: YSL Babycat, TF Tobacco Vanille, Acqua di Parma Mandorlo de Sicilia.

Unfortunately, the packaging doesn't match the quality. The metal cap scrapes against the sprayer and makes a terrible sound and it has already started to leak.
Selling my Tumeric Latte if anyone wants to buy x I am based in London.
I don't think this smells like tumeric or a latte, but it's very good. Definitely more like a smoky (tobacco smoke) vanilla.

Perfect cozy parfume! On my skin turns into a sweet vanilla after few hours, but on clothes stays smokey. Its not that long lasting on the skin, i believe max 4/5/6h, but stays longer on clothes. Someone said that lush parfumes stained their clothes, so would definitely recommend trying it first on a random white shirt u dont wear outside😅

This a nice perfume, but it's not what I thought it would be based on influencer hype. The top notes are strong and almost dirty/dusty. The vanilla then starts to shine through and it smells a lot like Tobacco Vanille by Tom Ford.
If you already have TV, I don't think you need this in your collection but it would make for a good dupe/substitute.
It's got a spicy, dark vanilla vibe that is cozy and warm.

I agree with reviews saying it smells similar to 'By the Fireplace', it is SMOKY. There is vanilla and tonka yes, but it's more of a unisex type, it's not sweet at all nor creamy. It doesn't smell like a chai latte at all. So if you see this and hope it's a gourmand like I did, sadly it's not.
