This is coming from someone when trying on skin gourmand/vanilla notes tend to be elevated usually. I'm shocked it was the other way around for this one. Lush is really unpredictable.

The weird thing is, when I smelled it from the bottle I did get the vanilla in a sophisticated way and barely any smokyness, but somehow when I sprayed it on myself it was SUPER spicy/smokey, amber-y and kinda bitter (?). Like it reminded me of the bitterness of taking medicine. The vanilla is kinda there still but just gets buried underneath all the smoky heaviness for me, which is a shame. I tried at least.
FINALLY I have found it… after years of searching… a perfume that actually smells like a chai latte!!!!!

It Is my duty to add a review for this beautiful scent after an extensive wear in the past 2 months. It is utterly delicious, cozy, hygge, you get the idea.
Velvety benzoin, dry vanilla, spicy but not too much.
Perfectly unisex, reminding (just vaguely) of TV but a lot more wearable.
My delicious layering combo:

Choco musk roll on
Black Opium le Parfum
Turmeric Latte
Delicious winterly Gourmand yumminess ❤️

When I first smelled Turmeric Latte, I was kinda liking it but, then I let my mom smell and she said it smells like a bathroom spray. Can’t get that though out of my head, it’s not bad but not for me anymore.

Bought this because it is the same scent as the Power conditioner. I had actually emailed lush asking them to make a perfume version of the conditioner, but i had no idea they already had one! I think this smells delicious, it is a bit spicy and take some time to get used to. Once you pick up on the creamy vanilla note, you will fall in love

to me the opening was way too spicy and harsh, but the dry down was super pleasant!! a very cozy sweet fragrance, i only tested it for about 4 hours but i could still smell it, doesn’t really project tho. i think it’d be a really nice scent for a candle but it’s a little too spicy for me i think
For me its kids perfume, but its nice. I like their bathbombs though

I don't know how I feel about this. I really wanted to love this after hearing everybody talking about it, but the initial spray made me gag, and I don't really know why? Maybe I got a bad batch? The earthy notes and clove was far too intense, it felt like I was smelling turmeric mixed with dirt. For the first few hours I was desperately trying to wipe it off. However, it's been approximately 8 hours since I sprayed it on and now it's a really nice, warm, vanilla scent that smells scrumptious. However I don't think the initial few hours of nausea is worth the vanilla, nothing special. A+ for longevity though!
i want this in the small size so badly my heart actually aches because of it.

Tumeric Latte is mostly sweet tonka and warm spices to my nose. I sprayed this once in the Lush store and got several complements on how I smelt when I was walking around the mall. This is quite heavy so I would only wear this in cold weather. Its more unisex than I typically go for with heavier scents but I love it regardless.

Lol I came to say that it smells like burnt marshmallows over a smoky firepit and I can see that quite a few people feel the same! I'm not sure if this one leans too medicinal on me or not. I think I might like it, but maybe not enough to actually crave wearing it when I could be wearing other warm and sweet LUSH perfumes.

If like me you wanted to love Replica By the Fireplace but found it sickly, too smoky and too vanillic, then Turmeric Latte might be a good one to try! They don't smell the same at all but they both smell like sweet bonfires!

I believe I saw a review here saying that this smells like a marshmallow burnt in a campfire, and that’s spot on to me! I was expecting something sweet and creamy, but to me this is definitely very spicy, and smokey first and foremost. There’s for sure sweetness, but I don’t think this is an overly sweet fragrance.
Not what I was expecting, but I actually really, really like! The perfect cozy, warm scent.

I loved this perfume from the first sniff. I was in lush store buying shower gels and sniffing my way around the store when the sales person asked me what perfume I was wearing. I'm pretty sure I stupidly applied lemongrass and vanilla essential oils directly to my skin. She pulled me over to the perfume display and sprayed this for me. I went through two bottles and multiple travel sprays during the time that it came as in production. I worked at a department store at the time and I smelled different to most people working on the sales floor. Getting complimented that you just smell good all the time and not overly perfumey is the best. It was earthy, sweet and fresh all at the same time. I haven't found anything that smells like it since.

A wonderful, fresh perfume.

Everything comes together quite well in this perfume. You'd expect the litsea, lime and lemongrass to overwhelm this perfume, but they meld in so well with the tonic that they don't stand out as top notes, but settle in to create a deep ambery, silky, and somewhat sharp scent. While this would be great in the summer due to its freshness, the caramel aspect makes it a great evening or even autumnal scent.

You'd love this if you're already a fan of Lush's Turmeric Latte, Love, or Cardamom Coffee.

A wonderful scent I'd love to see come back, but I'm glad I still own.

I've held onto this fragrance for a ridiculously long time but I love it. It's very long lasting and sillage is wide. I wore it one thanksgiving and my family asked if I'd been baking before arriving - they smelled cinnamon/ginger on me (similar to another reviewer!) I haven't been able to find a single fragrance like this again, and I miss it dearly.

I had a travel spray about 10 years ago and this scent was remarkable for its uniqueness, longevity and silage. Why was it discontinued? I loved this on my skin and so did others. I received many comments that I smelled like cinnamon rolls, which seems strange with the note breakdown, but it was sweet fresh and clean with a little edge.
The first fragrance I ever truly loved and called my own. I had the solid and it would stain my neck sticky blue. Still find myself drawn to ultra sweets and citrus 10 years later.

A perfume for those who dare to wear unconventional fragrances, like all the fragrances created by this maison.
Lemon, lime, lemongrass ... explosion of citrus notes and then change towards more smoky, sweet, candy notes. You do not go unnoticed in wearing this perfume. The history of its creation is known ... the mix of floral arrangements for wedding moments ...

I'm indifferent about 25:43. It's definitely citrusy and very sweet. I'm not a big fan of in-your-face citrus fragrances, however, I adore sweet gourmands. This is both. With each spray, you get b#*!h slapped with lemon & lime, which makes me think of kitchen cleaner, ugh. But, directly after the citrus assault, you're caressed with creamy sweetness. This isn't a fragrance I would ever wear, but I do enjoy smelling it.

I adore this perfume. One spray in the morning and it lasts me right up till bedtime. I love the zesty citrus top note but love how it develops into a sweet caramel butterscotch scent with a touch of powder and just a hint of citrus like a kiss remembered. So many people have asked me what it is that I'm wearing as they love the smell. My fave perfume of all time has to be Yves Rocher Rose Ispahan (special occasions only - unfortunately down to my last few drops and can only find a couple of bottles of EDT which is nowhere near as good as the Parfum), but this has got to be my second fave so far.

This perfume captured my fancy at the LUSH boutique in Abu Dhabi in 2012. The top note is definitely lime and lemongrass with a bit of hay. When it is first sprayed, the smell is a bit overwhelming so go easy on it if you are going to be in tight quarters quickly. Once the top notes mellow out, the base notes with caramel, tonka, vanilla come out to play and on my skin, the result is a very nice gourmand fragrance that makes others within my personal bubble say, "Something smells amazing. Is that you?" This is simple, yet classy and light scent for the type of girl or perhaps guy that likes a fresh, citrusy beginning with a warm & decadent end. Definitely a unique fragrance that I would recommend to those that are looking for something delightfully innocent.

I got this in one of my first swaps and tried it today. I waited for warm weather since I got this during the winter months, and thought the citrus would be better warm, but this is a big no... I love the idea of it, but it smells like lime Lifesavers candy and baby wipes on me. Had to wash it off.

This smells like Yankee Candle's 'Vanilla Lime' candle! Very zesty but smooth due to the vanilla base.

Not overly complicated, but a nice summer/autumn scent for every day wear.

I didn't know how much I disliked lemongrass until I smelled 25:43.

When I first put it on, the lemongrass was *so* overwhelming. It took about an hour for it to fade into the background. I really wanted it fade completely away, but it didn't.

Being a gourmand lover, the caramel and vanilla dry down was very nice and warm. It saved this from being a scrubber. I can see how people would describe this as a "zesty cheesecake."

If you can hang on for about an hour after first spray, it does become something other than lemongrass. That I can promise.

25:43 made my LUSH YUM list.

i love this scent. LOVE. i'm big into lime so right away i'm like, "OH LIME!" which makes me smile like a crazy person. then i get hit with heady waves of caramel and tonka... tart and sweet and tart and sweet. its projection is so yummy it may trick people into thinking you're a tiny, cupcake! so be warned, they may try to eat you. nom nom nom

YUM LIST:
25:43
b scent
imogen rose
love
cocktail
dirty
1000 kisses

I have to agree with Sweetiepea, this reminds me just like a sweet, zesty cheesecake. i personally adore this, though i am a fan of incredibly sweet fragrances. This one is definitely girly, though whilst i'd not think of a bride when i smell this one, it does remind me of the first, fleeting tropical holiday romance

Just purchased this past weekend; really wished I hadn't. Smells like a lemon pie. Fruity, with the crust. It smelled ok when I sampled it, and went ahead and bought it, but after getting home and actually wearing it, I regret my decision.
Maybe I can learn to like it.

25:43 IS an interesting one. Actually quite the little masterpiece for something created in less than a half hour.
Delicious, candied, spiced, lemon/lime. A scent that is both fresh and warm.

As one review states, this is almost like two separate fragrances in one. Opening with the ever so zesty and mouth watering lemon/lime sharpness of a frozen margarita, 'summer holiday", but then drying down with warm caramely/vanilla spices, and just a hint of lingering citrus,"winter holiday".

25:43 is a gender bender with a refreshing and unique duo personality. But as unusual as it may be, also possesses a clean, casual elegance.

I could definitely see this as a wedding fragrance for the right individual.

Holy crap!! I just had a epiphany about this fragrance. My original review is underneath, but I just wanted to add that this smells EXACTLY (from beginning to end), like fruity zebra-stripe bubble gum that was sold in the U.S. throughout the 80's and 90's. I can't believe it.

...

I appreciate 25:43 for two reasons.

The first is that it evolves big time, so I don't have to wonder whether it is my imagination that the fragrance has changed completely on my skin. Often, but not always, I feel that a scent is losing its character as it develops instead of transitioning through distinct and beautiful phases. Compositionally unbalanced or not, 25:43 expresses itself unapologetically from start to finish, and never leaves me thinking my imagination is to blame for the appearance of its unique faces.

The second reason is that it smells pretty good! It is definitely weird (after discreetly spraying it on my arms and then getting into a car with my boyfriend's relatives, they remarked that something smelled "WEIRD, like cloves and tobacco or something... What IS that?!"
However, to my nose, it smells good because it smells weird. Beauty and strangeness do not necessarily go hand in hand, and one absolutely does not imply the other. However, on my skin, the beauty and the strangeness work out. They just do. It's weird though. No doubt.

Here's what it smells like to me:
Fresh and realistic lime oil/lemon grass citrus blast
changing to:
sweet cinnamon bubble gum flavored mouthwash
changing to:
powdery Cow Tail brand caramels with the vanilla cream center (with all of this "changing to" stuff, I feel like this fragrance was based on the I-Ching),
and finally tonka bean with a trace of Nag Champa incense.

Longevity and projection are only slightly above average, which I feel in this case is a good thing, because this is more of a carnival ride type experience than something you would want people to associate with you. Unless, of course, you are a carnival ride of a person.

...and no, I do not get any cloves.

The End!

--

What kind of woman lets her husband's father decide what she smells like at her own wedding?

Will the father be featuring heavily during wedding night/ honeymoon, I wonder?

And indeed, what kind of perfumeur brags about how quick it was to compose a perfectly mediocre (or perhaps "inept", as some say) fragrance?

Having read the name, I was expecting to read some hulabaloo about the magic of the 25th hour.
But no. It's much worse.

I'm not usually fussed about how my scents are packaged/ sold /marketed, but this tale is creepy and off-putting enough to make me stay away from this purely on principle.

Lush founder and autodidact perfumer Mark Constantine tends to wield citrus oils with a heavy hand, so I braced myself upon reading the ingredients list for Lush 25:43, near the top of which are lemongrass oil and Persian lime oil. The first two ingredients are alcohol and tonka absolute, and I am happy to be able to report that the sweet tonka wins out in the battle of the notes. Usually the lemongrass and lime oils used in Lush creations are at nose-burningly acidic concentrations, but here they have been moderated to some extent by the tonka bean. Which is not, however, to say that they are not still strong!

Apparently this perfume was composed in twenty-five minutes and forty-three seconds, which is probably twenty minutes longer than most Tweet-esque perfumes being pumped out by the multilaunchers these days. All in all, I'd say that this creation is not bad for a half hour's work. I find it to be more of an event perfume than something which I'd choose to wear in a regular rotation, so I won't be acquiring a bottle, but it was nice to imagine what the wedding of Simon, Mark Constantine's son, must have been like. I suspect that there were plenty of drugs on hand. Perhaps they whipped up some acid-laced Koolaid punch?

This fragrance starts out promisingly enough, with lime and lemongrass so persistent that you'll be lulled into believing you might have found a cologne that will last for more than a hour. Then there's a really inept transition to a horrible caramel note. The two co-exist for a time - which is a real stink.

Strong and nasty stuff.

Question: What kind of a perfumer brags about the short amount of time it took him to throw together a fragrance?

Answer: One who is being way too clever for his own good.

Thanx Allinug for a sample. This one start very citrus and lemongrass-fresh in a very nice way. Then the Caramel hits my nose and it turns syrup'ish. To me its very caramelsweet all through the pyramid. I'm not a fan of sweet or sugary scents - so this one is not for me.

Tack Alling för provet. Denna startar med citrus och citrongräs-fräsch på ett superfint sätt. Sen smäller karamellen till och alltsammans blir sirapslikt. För mig är den karamellsöt rakt igenom hela pyramiden. Jag är ingen fan av sockriga eller söta dofter, så denna är inte för mig.

Love this! Starts off with a burst of lime. I really wish the lemongrass in the opening would last longer. Later it mellows out into this delicious caramel and cinnamon. The dry down reminds me of L by Lolita Lempicka. Will be buying a full bottle of this.

I love this scent! I smell Lime and Tonka Abs at first with a little bit of Ylang Ylang. It's not strong to me but it is very addicting, I find myself smelling my shirt several times after I spray it on. Reminds me of Coconut Lime and sun bathing in Hawaii.. One spray is all I use. One negative is that I find it does not last more than 2 hours.. I have tried almost all Lush's perfumes and I think I have found my favorite though!!

This is a unique scent.

The citrus is short lived. It's all day strong tonka bean and vanilla add a hint of caramel. Kind of cinnamon/cardamom like.

Not too heavy of a fragrance. But too tonka spice for me!

Reminds me of a particular night club where the tables all had vanilla/cinnamon candles burning.
Smells like the Lush store, kind of
I smell only lemon and vanilla in this fragrance. Very nice scent! Love it!

This is a strange but sort of fun fragrance. Initially it is very citrusy with the lemongrass standing out, but within 10 minutes the citrus notes are nearly gone and it turns into a sweet syrupy tonka bean and vanilla scent. It seriously reminds me of the cinnamon buns you buy at the mall with the slightly lemony frosting (cinzeo I think) which is nice. Unfortunately following the hour or two of "cinnamon bun" goodness it becomes cloyingly sweet caramel. Overall this is a fun cheap and cheerful scent if you like gourmands, but it is very unbalanced and not particularly well blended. Maybe if Mark Constantine had spent more than 25 minutes making it, it would have been better, oh well.

At first it starts off with a blast of lemongrass and lime.... very strong! But only minutes later it fades away and a vanillacaramel note along with the tonka appears, sooo delicious!! Mmmmm, a unique lovely scent with a powdery hint.... reminds me a little bit of a cake but at the same time very fresh. One of my favorite from Lush along with Karma, Love, Ginger and Orange blossom... by the way... I love most everything from Lush :))

Till en början doftar den citrongräs och lime.... mycket starkt! Vaniljtoner och karamelltoner finns dock med hela tiden i bakgrunden, sååå ljuvlig. När de första skarpa tonerna har lagt sig (ganska omgående) tar vaniljkaramellaktiga och tonka bean över och 25:43 doftar ljuvligt!!!! Mmmmm, en unik underbar doft med en aningen pudrig känsla... påminner lite grann om en bakelse, men samtidigt fräsch. En av mina favoriter från Lush, tillsammans med Karma, Love, Ginger och Orange blossom... för övrigt äääälskar jag det mesta från Lush.

I have two signture perfumes and this is one of them. At first a little strong smell of citrus but it calms down and then I smell vanilla and something like gingerbread, a soft and warm smell. It's a gorgeous perfume and I have got compliments both from my family and others.
I bought it today on the sales ! Nice milky caramel with lime and vanile,very yammi.

Finally! I have been waiting for this to be added to the database for so long and now I'm very excited to review it! The fragrance starts off with a blast of lemongrass and lime. If you love lemongrass, you'll find this intoxicating. It's very fresh and summery. Oh but wait... there's more... As the lime and lemongrass fade, the tonka and vanilla come out with a hint of caramel. The drydown is like a creamy, sweet cheesecake, with a sprinkle of powder. It's thick, delicious, and so unusual. The lemongrass with a hint of citrus never really leaves, but remains in the background even through the drydown. From the topnotes, it would seem this perfume is more suited to summer, however the drydown is rich, thick, powdery, sweet, and to me could be more suited to Fall. One more thing I appreciate about this is that it reminds me of my beloved Avoshower limited edition shower gel. I am clinging to the last ounces of this with my life but the perfume helps fill that hole! Overall, beautiful, unique, lovely perfume. Sillage and longevity average to above average. A-
It's very simple sweet orange and cranberry with hint of spiciness, bit artificial - much more candle or room spray type of fragrance.
Snowbells lit up all aglow with grapefruit and spices :)

Absolutely adore this fragrance, it smells more like Orange than grapefruit, the spice and sweet are perfectly balanced and the name really captures this. It’s perfect for Christmas, it smells like freshly cut oranges and warm spices. The scent is really strong too, one spray will linger for hours and it’s a scent you don’t really go nose blind to. I can imagine this isn’t to everyone’s taste as it does smell a bit like pumpkin spice but I personally love it and wish it was available for purchase outside the advent calendar.
So great, I always get compliments when I wear it. It’s like a cinnamon bun! So delicious!!!

My all time favorite dessert is Sticky Date Cake from Trivoli Tavern here in Chicago. If you're ever on town, PLEASE do yourself a favor and try it. Anyway, this smells JUST like how that tastes. I cannot believe how delicious this is. You have to be a lover of gourmands to enjoy this, but it's honestly so amazing
Smelled this on behalf of someone else so of course I find it too syrupy but I LOVE the milky note
soooo stinky:( i smell this on so many people so at least the sillage is good but the scent is so syrupy, medicinal and heavy
It is a beautiful and delicious scent. BUT get the hair primer and/shower gel because they are so much better then the body spray imo. Really excited to see how the dusting powder is like.

Every time I tried this in the shop, I found it absolutely disgusting. I am a huge fan of ragingly sweet scents, like Lush's Snow fairy, and other gourmand foody and diabetes inducing smells, but I found this to be horribly rancid. It smells grossly synthetic and foul, it doesnt smell sweet or delicious at all. It smells like the ingredients have gone bad.

I was once gifted a "sweet smelling" lip balm many years ago, but I hated the smell of it, and to me it smelled like it went bad, so I never wore it. After I tried this scent for the first time, I realised it reminded me of exactly that lip balm.

I really wanted to like this scent, as on paper it's something that should be right up my alley, but it unfortunately isn't and probably never will be.

I usually love gourmand scents but this one was... too much for me. It's almost nauseating. I still didn't like it 4 hours later. If you love how dates smell, you might like this, because Lush really nailed that sweet syrupy smell.

something about lush's gourmand body mists smelling horrendous compared to their shower gel counter parts. I really liked the shower gel for this scent, but the first minutes of spraying the mist are so awful that i dont even want to wear it. it goes away and smells pleasant enough afterwards, but its just not good enough for me
My friend has this and I'm so jealous! It is such a pretty scent.
This is cozy winter vanilla done right. If you want to smell like a scrumptious cup-cake cookie dough this is it. And it’s not even sickening.
a really dark, rich maple syrup gourmand

A thick, dense scent with that rich raisin-and-date sweetness — definitely one for the true gourmand lovers. It lasts really well, though perhaps not quite as long as Let the Good Times Roll by Lush. I’ve tried several dupes of Sticky Dates and nothing even comes close. This will be a forever favourite for me.

caramel in all caps. quite polarizing. i know theres a lot of caramel scents out there but they all still smell like perfume, you know? (duh, bc they are perfumes) but sticky dates smell straight up like caramel syrup that sticks to your skin. its not my vibe but i know some people love it, and i can see why.
My bottle is almost empty 😔 I will definitely buy it again. I love that warm caramel scent
chewy caramels left in the pocket of someone’s jacket. It leans more burnt for a couple moments as it sits on my skim, then it returns to pure caramel. for the love of god DO NOT overspray

This is a scent that truly earned being viral . It is a gorgeous gourmand that the majority will love ( I got told I smell like Christmas :p) But beware you only need one spray of this or else its quite potent and potentially headache inducing to yourself and others . This last so long on skin , I'm surprised that a body spray can even last 6hrs on skin. One of may favourite autumn / winter scents <3

Do not apply more than one spray of this. Otherwise everyone within your immediate vicinity will literally begin to experience absolute nausea and dizziness. I am only slightly exaggerating. And you yourself will feel ill. This is nice at first, but so incredibly disgustingly overwhelming. Such a shame because i loved the scent of the sticky dates shower gel by lush…
If you're Asian this scent will hit so hard fr

Imagine if you are a teen in a mall doused in Bath&Body Works spray, but it actually smells pretty good. Ungodly sweet at first. I have never ever smelled anything this sweet before. Obnoxiously sweet for the first hour. Then the scent transforms into a milder creamy caramel note that makes you smell like a delicious, sweet treat for the whole day. It definitely is rich, gourmand.

definitely an acquired taste.... to which i do not have.........,,,; smells very nauseating sweet with a weird unidentifiable stench behind it, like the congealed goo at the bottom of an expired frag. reminds me a lot like old molasses, it got in my throat a lot from one whiff. just an amalgam of artificialness and raisins. 42 for a body spray and esp for sticky dates is diabolical........... not my thing

"YO DAWG!! I heard you like sugar!!
So guess what!?!?!?
We put some sugar inside your sugar...put some MORE sugar on top of your sugar....and added some MORE SUGAR!!!"

This is disgusting.
It is 90% Ethyl Maltol.
This smells like the Ethyl Maltol abomination I made when I first started making my own perfumes.
It was completely unwearable...just like this disgusting mess.
For the first 2 hours it's an oppressive cloud of Ethyl Maltol that chokes the life out of you. Then at hour 3 you start to get nuances of something else in the background...what it is, I couldn't tell you.
I can only pick up sugar sugar and SUGAR.
I cannot understand how anyone can wear this...and I wish I hadn't asked for this garbage for my birthday.
I would return it if I...actually...I'm going to return this.
There is no way in Gods green earth I'm wearing this...

UPDATE:
You gotta be kidding me....at hour 4.5 it dries down to "ESCAPADE GOURMANDE"!!!!!
DANGIT I ALREADY HAVE THAT!!! And I don't have to wait 4.5 hours to get the EXACT SAME THING with "Escapade Gourmande"!!!!!

UPDATE: Swapped this at the Lush store for another bottle of "Let The Good Times Roll"

This totally walked me like a dog for five months. I loved sticky dates, had it in so many forms, but then summer rolled around and it got too heavy and I kind of forgot about it. I'm in more of a chocolate mood these days.

It is everything you think it'll be, and yes, people usually love to smell it. Buy it at least once. Toffee is such a delicious scent.

smells like burnt sugar on me, but on my sister who i ended up giving the bottle to because it was so unpleasant, it smells like a cupcake filled with werthers chewy caramels so it's really a 50/50 and i would recommend spraying in store before buying.

I took a chance on the body scrub in the late summer and loved it, but wished the scent was stronger and lasted; I'm glad that I bought the actual body spray, as it's completely exceeded my expectations. I was a bit nervous given that sometimes certain smells don't translate well if they're going from lotion to perfume to body scrub, etc, but it smells just like the body scrub! This is truly a lovely scent, just like a rich dessert, a caramel flan or a caramelized sweetened condensed milk can. Now it just needs some gold shimmer ⋆.˚⋆₊ ⊹

Really not my favourite. I was so excited for this as I'd heard a lot on TikTok, and I've been looking for something sweet to wear, so when I went to the mall, I instantly got it, which was a bit of a mistake.

I truly think other people could absolutely love it, but the weird bitter, burnt-ish coffee-ness is *not* my vibe. If you enjoy the more bitter foods and drinks in life, I think you'll like it, but I really don't.

Honestly at first it really wasn't to my taste but as I wore it I started to warm up to it and like it, I even got a compliment :D At first when you spray it you get hit with this very intense burn caramel- almost incense like smell that hits a bitter taste in the back of your throat and has a mild liquorice hint, but after like two hours it develops into this warm spicy sweet smell, it's not going to be everyone's cup of tea but for me it's quite nice :D

This gets compared a lot to Cheroisa 71, and for the record I'd like to state that it's in the same scent family, but in a quite different direction. I don't think it's necessary redundant to have both if you're a detail oriented freak like me, but I don't think it really matters when smelled from afar.

One one hand I really want to love this, as to me it smells like Bailey's liquor in the opening and then as a toffee liqueur for the rest of the wear. However, while I do like it - on me, so to speak, I feel like it's a jump that never lands
Something that is just a taad too...waxxy? weak? not sure.

I think I would prefer this if they leaned into the alcohol notes, I think that amped up liqueur - caramelised vibe would really brighten it up.

It's nice, but it simply lacks the wow factor or anything that would signal to my brain that this fragrance is "my own", even though typically I do enjoy foody gourmands.

I think I would prefer this as a candle. Who knows, I might change my mind in a couple of months when winter bears it's fangs properly, but for now this is just "nice", and not anything that I feel I must immediately get.

Smells like photorealistic caramel dusted with cinnamon on top 😋 I love that slight spiciness, makes it feel kinda more organic/natural, lasts really long as well, 2 sprays lasted me 6 hours. It’s marketed as a body spray but has the longevity of a perfume. Perfect for autumn 🍂

Very strong indeed but lacks the SDJ 71 sweetness… instead it’s just really syrupy and sort of, kinda nauseating. Cute dry down but I gag a little when I spray it. I’m not even sure how to rate this. Not for me I fear but now I have a 35€ full size bottle on my hands and ion know what to do with it 🧑🦲

First impression: Absolutely not for me. got an artificial alcohol and coffee note that makes it smell rancid.

I’ll try it again in colder weather.
I need this in a solid ASAP, I am swimming in caramel soup.

I couldn't smell this for longer than 10 seconds, so maybe it gets better, but my initial impression was an overwhelming burnt caramel scent, similar to LTGTR. Only tested on paper, which I promptly discarded.

I like this some time after I let it set, because when spraying it I feel like I’m being waterboarded on rum soaked toffee.
Apparently I’m sensitive to alcoholic scents but this is really quite heavy.
Everyone else seems to love it on me, I guess because they don’t get attacked with the aggressiveness of the spraying.
Lasts for a long time on clothes and has a strong projection.

i love the sticky dates scent but the spray just isn’t rich enough for me. not the scent’s fault at all it’s delicious but it’s a pretty superficial brown sugar and dates gourmand without anything to ground or deepen it. it’s like a little richer than a b&bw scent when i’m looking for some more substantial base notes. completely my fault for wrongly assessing my own wishes the scent is delicious though if that’s what you’re looking for

This truly is the most powerful body spray I have ever encountered. I've had mine since the community release with the brown label - maybe 2023? - and it's still insane. The projection on this one is enormous and it lasts for days and days on clothes, I easily get a full 12-15 hours out of it on skin alone with no lotion to help it stick.

It's like burnt brown sugar (in the best way possible) with the most luxurious vanilla extract and thick gooey caramel. I don't love the lotion so much, on me it pulls more fruity, but the body spray and body wash are absolutely worth every bit of hype they get. I love this in autumn and winter, though I do find it's good in the summer as long as you don't go too crazy with it.

I find this layers particularly well with coconutty scents - Kayali Utopia Vanilla Coco is excellent with it as is Le Monde Gourmand Lait de Coco. I also like it with Cheirosa 71 or layered with Vanilla 28 to amp up the vanilla even more, but it's honestly not necessary to layer this one if you don't want to given its comically nuclear performance.

10/10, I think this will be a repurchase forever.

tried this at a mall and it just never stopped smelling like alcohol. maybe something was wrong with the tester??? my friend said she could smell the caramel but to me it was just bailey's. i don't know! also i cant get over the packaging
Intense date syrup bomb opening but the dry down is immaculate. A little goes a long way, especially when using the bath and body products in this scent.

When I first tried this scent out I completely hated it. I thought it smelled like a cigarette smoker that tried to hide the scent of cigarette by spraying warm vanilla by bath and bodyworks all over themselves. HOWEVER,,,,As I walked around the mall, I kept wanting to smell my sticky date stench on my clothes. I was captivated. I even got pulled aside by a girly to ask what I was wearing! Of course I ended up buying it...Online. I was too ashamed of stepping back into Lush at the time after my distasteful outburst of complaints I spewed to the entire store about the scent.

when i had first smelled it, it was very molasses-y and a bit overwhelming. i ended up leaving the store buying something else not perfume related instead but as i was driving home, i kept smelling this complex, warm scent and it was this body mist ! the next time i went to lush i got a bottle of it bc i finally understood the hype. i just had to give her a chance to settle !! i can’t wait to use her more in the winter but im enjoying using her right now in this weird fall/summer weather.
i think due to its unique scent its giving me the same vibes of lolitaland by lolita.. the folks that get it get it and the ones that don’t don’t! it’s all about preference <3

Textbook example of "sickly sweet to the point of throwing up". I enjoy gourmands, but this one is unbearable. It's so strong and sweet, it genuinely feels like someone made a mistake and added far too much of sickly artificial caramel to the mix. If you use this spray, you won't be able to smell literally anything else around you for days. Had to return it before I suffocated to death. Strangely enough, I also have SD body lotion and it's brilliant. Not so heavy and offensive, it's balanced and cozy.

To me this is a very intriguing scent.

I finally bought it after having tried it many times, and comparing it with other Lush fragrances as they developed in my skin at the same time. In my experience a lot of Lush fragrances tend to dry down to very similar notes, but this one works a little differently.

What FASCINATES me about it is that what on a first impression seems like a fun & teen-like gourmand caramel, on further inspection reveals itself to have a hard, burnt, bitter, masculine, woody structure.

The dry down is interesting because it goes from feminine to masculine, in my opinion. Around 3 hours after the first spraying, the caramel loses intensity/freshness and the sandalwood becomes the protagonist, but it's quite synthetic, so it smells a tiny bit like cheap incense or male deodorant.

Sure, you can smell the molasses and some toffee, but what it reeeeeally brings you to is: "I was baking flan today for a party and I accidentally burnt the caramel until it became very dark", but you're NOT the person baking, you're at home, you had lit a sandalwood incense in the living room, and you're just finding out something is burning as you enter the kitchen. The burnt caramel smell spreads and mixes with sandalwood incense background.

That's my most accurate description of what it smells like to me.

I would not recommend spraying too much, to me it has the potential of becoming nauseating and vulgar when in overdose. Works better as a scent that one feels only when close to the skin. But it's not for everyone. Very weird perfume. I do like it though.

Also, since it's made from essential oils, I suppose this will change on the bottle as months go by as well... We'll see.

Honestly, the body spray really dissapointed me. Maybe it wouldn’t had let me down if I didn’t use the shower gel before (of which I adored).

At first it smells far too smoky, almost burnt, which completely threw me off. After it settles on the skin it turns into a sweeter caramel scent, which is nicer, but still not what I expected. Sadly no sweet, rich date note at all… Eventhough that’s the whole point?

Bonus points for the projection and longevity, you can get really far with 1-2 sprays.
As good as everyone says unfortunately! Really rich and slightly bitter, not too sweet as a good sticky date pudding should be.
Absolutely not for me. Wayyyyy to sweet. A lot of women I know have this has their signature scent and it smells like popcorn to me more than caramel. One way ticket to smelling like a carnival
Straight up caramel. Not for me.

This smell like licorice and caramel. Last about 2-3 hours on skin. It smell sweet. It does smell like caramel tho but very synthetic. I am a gourmand lover. But this has not enough lasting power or dept to keep it interesting. Its nothing like sol de janerio 71. That one smells like nuts.
This had no nuts at all. Its nothing like khamhra by lattafa either.
Over all okey scent.
Lattafa Khamrah, body spray edition
This was the signature scent of a very sweet boy who I knew for a few months in 2024. I wanted to inhale him. This fragrance is total femme bait.
Layer with LTGTR and watch the compliments roll in!

first, i loved it. then, now after wearing it all day, i threw my clothes in the hamper and showered it off. there is to much "honey" smell, which translates to, this smells like pee. or a diaper. GROSS. i am returning it! I'm going back to BumBum cream!
A yummy caramel scent, what’s not to like? Much prefer this over LTGTR.
sorry but smells like vanilla incense sticks :(

Buy this if you want to smell like a delicious caramel drizzled cookie for life. This scent lasts ALL DAY AND NIGHT, if you fall asleep before showering guess what? It’s still going to be lingering onto you lol. 40 for a body spray… questionable, but when you purchase you will truly understand. Lasts better than 98% of my perfumes. Perfect for a cozy day/night in winter and fall, love it! BUT truly only for gourmand girlies, if you dont love smelling like sweet baked goods it WILL be nauseating. DONT WEAR IN SUMMER WAY TOO WARM SMELLING

So warm and cozy... I smelled it at the mall and bought it expeditiously. It lasts all day on me and a little goes a long way! I don't get why it's called sticky dates when there's no date note, but I won't sweat it.

I hate that we seem to be in an era of aggression when it comes to gourmands. This would be so nice if a) it wasn’t quite so concentrated, and b) the spray bottle didn’t absolutely douse you in the stuff (or look like that). That said, this also has a really strong treacle / molasses note on my skin that isn’t entirely pleasant. I only wore this once or twice (both times out clubbing as that’s the only time something like this felt appropriate), and I had to give it away as it just overwhelmed the senses.
smelling this makes me hungry it’s so delicious
So sticky date-y but doesn’t last long on me unfortunately.
Dries down to maple syrup. It’s a straight forward burnt/smoked caramel. Better than Let The Good Times Roll, which smells strange to me (I don’t get popcorn at all)
The most delicious sticky toffee pudding with custard, it’s photorealistic. Bakeries and restaurants should spray this into the street to get customers.
it sweet

Sprayed once on my wrist and once on my hair and people around me can still smell it 10 hours later. This is definitely to be sprayed sparingly or you’ll suffocate. Gorgeously gourmand and sweet, with the benzoin adding depth and complexity.
Unbearable sweet nuke. Quite realistic but completely asphyxiating

I LOVE this fragrance, however I’m not sure if it’s the bottle I bought or what, but I found that it was not long lasting at ALL. Very different to my other Lush body sprays. It feels like I can’t even smell it anymore the moment I walk out of my bedroom. Hoping my bottle was just a fluke, because I’m a huge fan of caramel scents and this one hits the spot.

i made an account JUST to review this because holy moly this shit smells amazing. i had bought sol de janeiro cheirosa 71 and was disappointed- sticky dates is like a way better version. it doesn't have the weird salty piss smell (i think it was supposed to smell like popcorn) that cheirosa 71 had on me, it's much sweeter, yummier, non-headache inducing and i think more feminine, dare i say cuter and sexier. it also smells good on a hot day, which i found that cheirosa 71 didn't. not trying to be a hater because the 71 smells good in the bottle but just not on me, so if you wanted to love it but couldn't and are looking for similar flavours i recommend trying sticky dates instead!! u can finally smell like the pancakes and toffee and heaven of your dreams :P i want to eat myself
lowkey expensive for such a small bottle though and the design is kinda quirky

I will never not want to smell edible. So I saw the picture and I was sold. I'm so glad I blind bought this. Its scent combines predominant caramel notes with very realistic dates. It's creamy, nutty and sweet -a well rounded gourmand. Whenever I want to buy something pricy, I tell my husband it's "therapy" or "a work of art". This fragance is both.

This is one of the best gourmand body mists on the market. The scent is incredibly sweet and delectable, with decadent caramel and a hidden liquor note that makes it stand out. The performance is truly EDP tier, sooo much better than any VS or BBW spray out there. If you wanna smell like a sexy dessert, if you want to make people wanna take a bite out of you… go get yourself a Sticky Dates body mist!

it's literally sticky, the sexy version of let the good times roll from lush. it's a bit darker, the caramel is deeper, and overall it feels ambery, but on my skin it smells sweet, literally like a photorealistic butterscotch coffee. i was between this and cheroisa 71, but cheroisa 71 is literally a mall girl perfume, while sticky dates is way more mature than ltgtr and cheroisa 71. almost no popcorn, no cookies either, just a rich caramelized coffee, slightly burnt, paired with a butterscotch pie in a cozy setting. my husband tried to eat me the moment he smelled it. highly recommend.

I really tried liking this, I just ended up using it as a room spray. Way too sweet, synthetic, screechy and it reminds me of some sort of medicine. I wouldn’t mind smelling it in the air, but not on myself.

Looooove sticky dates! The first spray is very very very strong but it dries down beautifully. Lasts ages on my clothes. Bought it about a month ago now, so I’ve only had it during colder weather. I think it’s an all year round scent tho! It’s $50 AUD for 200ml which I thought was a little expensive at first but now I think it’s good value for money bc of how long it lasts

Initially, I LOVED this spray - I wore it for a couple of months in autumn and winter and couldn’t get enough of it. It smelt exactly like my mum’s sticky toffee pudding. However, I can’t stand it anymore (I am not sure whether this is due to personal preference changing or the formula maturing.) I honestly regret buying the full size as I can’t wear it without feeling ill and I still have over half a bottle. Something in the background of this scent smells a bit like urine. Other than that, it is so overpoweringly sweet and chemical-y, very synthetic smelling to me now, which I didn’t get before.

this body spray is one of my favorites. it is super strong and smells very yummy,the notes are accurate and its sweet as fuck. smells like unicorns and rainbows!!!!!! perfect if you love gourmand scents plus it lasts a long time. one or two pumps from this and im literally nose blinded it is highkey rlly strong. its perf for winter and fall,but im going to use it this summer too bc its so good i wanna drink it.
overwhelming, sticky, very sweet. The dry down is more bearable. I got it for my birthday and I love my sister so I wear it sometimes, but the first blast is a battle
Whenever my girlfriend wears this I want to eat her up.

fresh dates but amplified. i literally gasped in the store when i first smelled this, it is truly unique and they somehow managed to exactly pinpoint the scent of dates dipped in caramel.

i honestly would buy a whole bottle of this and im not a huge gourmand fan
lush scents have this specific smell. nauseating

I was once wearing this on a train - I'd spritzed it on in the morning; this was around lunchtime. Someone walked into the carriage and exclaimed "this train smells like cake!"

I adore gourmand perfumes, always have. I adore Sticky Dates, but it's my absolute upper limit.

It smells photorealistic. You know that sticky toffee pudding you order in the pub after Sunday lunch despite your better judgement? It smells like that. Thick, buttery, dollops of hot creamy custard all over it, toffee sauce mixing in. Exactly that. Maybe a dash of rum in there.

To me, it is the ultimate gourmand. Literally foodie. I've had mixed reactions - some people love it, other people have recoiled from the burnt caramel smell. A male friend of mine adored it to a point he asked me not to wear it around him! Interestingly he also picked up coconut notes, which I can kind of get.

It's not a safe blind buy. I mean, I adore smelling like what my best friend calls "a slutty cookie", and this absolutely fulfils the brief. You're sweet, oozy, plump with fruit, slathered in custard. Sophisticated it ain't, and not everyone wants to smell like pudding. I do though!

Sugary sweet caramel vanilla ! As a lover of sweet gourmand scents I love this so much !!! I definitely wouldn't recommend it to someone who doesn't like very sweet scents , as it is slightly cloying but I personally like it very much . Don't blind buy !

despite how popular sticky dates is i dont think ive ever smelled something like this before on anyone or anywhere. i went to my local lush to smell it and it was love at first smell. i have never eaten / smelt a date before but sticky dates to me smelt like a strong coffee with caramel syrup, then it progresses to a buttery toffee popcorn and the drys down to warm, creamy vanilla - with a perfect amount of sweetness to me. but when i bought a new bottle it was way more sweeter (almost sickly sweet if i spray more than once) maybe after a few months the sweetness will mellow out. people around me who smell it on me describe it as “vanillary”. i bought this in the summer time but i think it would be more enjoyable in colder weather.
although its a body spray it lasts so long and smells so strong even after 6 hours! im excited to buy more scents from lush.

lush body sprays always seem to have a terrible opening, but then an excellent dry down. as a lot of other commenters stated, at the first initial spray, you get a really gross burnt caramel smell, mixed with plastic, but the dry down smells similarly to the soap; like a really decadent dessert dripping in a rich caramel sauce. i do prefer the scent of the lotion/body wash, but overall, it's definitely a nice fall fragrance if you can get over the opening!
My best friend wears this and it sticks on their skin even after a shower. Insane. Like actual fresh caramel. So strong at first but sits beautifully on skin.

Superrrrrr sweet and that’s coming from a gourmand addict for perfumes. I must say the dry down is beautiful but that initial spray is horrible, smells like burnt caramel and maple syrup to me. Don’t blind buy if you can smell in on stores do it before purchasing

I smelled this for the first at the store to see all the hype. It’s way too sweet like sickeningly sweet I felt nauseous after one word because of the sweetness. Definitely not for me even though I love gourmand perfumes this one is just too much. I honestly don’t get the hype around this.

"who baked cookies?" MEEEEEEE :D no but on a real note a very heavy scent. I can def smell the "burnt" caramel notes if that makes sense? Don't spray too much on urself tho, otherwise it will become too overwhemling (comming from a girl who loves a scent that u can SMELL) < 3

The first time I smelled this sample in the store I thought it smelled wonderful, then someone got it for me as a gift, and I was really excited to wear it. But... after smelling it actually on my skin and clothes and wearing it multiple times it's almost just too syrupy and candle-like for me :( I really wanted to like this one and I've worn it many, many times to see if it would grow on me but sadly it has not. I do see why other people like it though it just didn't work with my skin chemistry specifically.
Burnt caramel and sticky toffee. Thick, rich, and heavy like dark molasses. There’s a syrupy depth to it that I really like. Perfect for cold weather.

This opens as a nice caramel scent that reminds me of Eilish and a little like Bianco Latte. However, something in this makes it smell musty (think old, dusty basement) as it dries down. It is also very potent; you only need one or two sprays at best (especially on clothes) otherwise you and everyone around you will be coughing and sneezing all day long. Personally couldn't stand the musty note so this is a room spray now.

Burnt caramel scent, very realistic. After sample this I think I didn't want to smell like this.

The good side is Its my first time in lush store and very happy that salesperson really helpful.
Sampled in-store, incredibly strong and sweet. smells like you're spraying straight caramel onto your skin
literally caramel. literally. so magical you’ll love this if you are a heavy gourmand girly

The pungency on this thing is next-level; like being smothered in resinous caramel with a side of scorched wood. The sweetness is aggressive, almost confrontational. And don’t even get me started on the alcohol blast—I'm pretty sure I burned two whole new nostrils into my face. Somehow, despite all that, the projection fizzles out faster than expected. Bold move for a sugar-coated flamethrower.

sniffed this yesterday at Lush and I much prefer the body lotion and shower gel over the body spray--i got smacked in the face with alcohol on the first spray and tbh I don't feel like waiting it out for the rest of the notes to take over. the lotion smells divine though, I've been laying off the gourmand scents for a while since it's summertime but this one! this one takes the cake heh

I'm a beginner fragrance collector and this is my first purchase. I already got myself a backup bottle. Exactly my type of scent. It's a scrumptious caramel-date syrup with a touch of wood. It's a little boozey but I personally like that and after a few hours my skin smells like sugary vanilla milk. (This is not a lactonic scent tho, so don't expect it to be milky!!)

Even if Sticky Dates is just a body mist it's still kinda long-lasting and it lasts even longer on my clothes. Only negative thing I could mention is the bottle. I couldn't care less about how a fragrance bottle looks, especially a body spray but the atomizer is sh*t. It gets stuck like every three sprays. Apart from that, this thing is just meant for me.

If you like an almost sickly sweet, syrupy gourmand, absolutely go for it!

The Lush body sprays are great because they're SO strong, you won't even need a perfume. I adore this one, but it is pretty heavy and the caramel is very rich, so it's also very divisive. Definitely try this one in store before you get it. I would also recommend Caramel Skin by Phlur if you want similar notes but a softer scent.

I'm literally obsessed with gourmands so I got this on a blind buy with the body scrub, lotion and body wash. I can truly say this is the first gourmand I didn't like. It's just way too heavy. I normally say the sweeter the better but not with this. Never thought I'd see the day when I'd say a scent was too sweet.

Edit: I wrote this review four months ago and I don't know if it's because it's now fall or if my nose has changed but I actually like this now. It's a very strong warm gourmand, perfect for fall.

The most amazing beautiful perfume
Verry verry verry sweet surypy and mouthwatering delicious
Exactly as sticky date/toffee pudding

The best yet 🥰🥰🔥🔥🔥🔥🔥

I was looking forward to trying this scent since the notes seemed delicious but unfortunately this has a weird buttery note to it which ruined it for me. Despite the notes it’s not super sweet, the scent is quite mild and balanced.

I finally have this mouthwatering delicious sugary sticky dates scent as I am a heavy gourmand lover...... This is so amazing

Sticky dates notes are dates... Caramel syrup..... Vanilla.... Brown sugar molassis and it smells exactly as the lush version


I have order this beauty from sugar co(USA) from etsy and it, s cheff kiss as it is verry strong also and projects verry strong

The sticky dates reminds me of like a super sweet dates dipped in caramel toffee pudding


🔥🔥🔥🔥
creme brulé and alcohol. very sweet.

its suuuppperrrrr sweet but i like that personally. Its just like a sweet caramel teeney bit vanilla smell. It lasts ages but it doesnt really have good silliage. like usually my friends comment on whatever scent im wearing (whether they like it or not they usually say something) but i havent gotten any comments and have to smell my shirt to actually really smell it. when you first spray it, its a bit of a smack in the face with how sweet it is, but after a while it just becomes a nice soft caramel scent. DONT spray on white clothes idk if this is common knowledge but it is like a brownish colour and it left a mark on one of my shirts (it washed out i think). overall pretty good but a bit overpriced at least where i live. im also NOT a fragrance expert by any means so go smell it for yourself cuz i probably didnt describe the notes well.

I didn’t like it. The scent is too strong, with a sharp alcoholic and sour note that I find unpleasant. It does change over time and becomes more bearable, but only if you have the patience to wait for it.
Half a bottle of this mixed with half a bottle of avocado co wash smells very similar to Supermilk. Caramellish burnt sugar lemon cake

This isn’t what I usually go for when it comes to fragrances. I lean heavier towards more herbal fresh scents, but I looove this scent. Very decadent almost sickeningly sweet. Very warm and enticing. It almost has a gooey quality. Makes me think of a Ghirardelli chocolate commercial where an artisan chocolatier bathed in sunlight is melting caramel in a gilded saucepan. A lovely cozy fragrance for fall and winter time. Also has a very strong silage; a small amount goes a long way.
it smells like that one wax melt from walmart

this is genuinely the worst gourmand perfume i’ve ever smelt. the best way i can describe it is a waxy caramel candle. like this smells like a wax melt. it’s disgusting and nauseating. i’ve let it sit on my skin and clothes to dry down and it smelled the same. i really wanted to like this and i wanted it to grow on me. definitely not a safe blind buy but it does last a very long time.

sweet, boozy, long-lasting and with enough sillage to be complimented but not enough to be written up anywhere- the indolic gourmand i've been looking for my entire life. told the lush employee that i prayed for sticky dates to be a year-round scent back when it was an eid exclusive, and god once again treats me like his special little princess!

you definitely get caramel, but not caramel candies- the process of caramelising something, slightly-burnt sugar poured over the fruit of palms. sandalwood keeps sticky dates grounded enough to not be a true 'dessert' scent, vague oud qualities. if you somehow poured boiled, liquified sugar over a date palm, that'd be sticky dates, your perspiration from standing so close to fire included.

sticky dates and rose jam combined smell like yalda to me. heavy fabrics draping over tables, high-quality candles, copies of the divan with pages yellowed by time- all complimented with smooth glasses of wine, syrupy-sweet pomegranate molasses, noon khamei, and whispering poems with your loved ones. lush warrior until the bitter end.

smells like walking into an ice cream shop. delicious vanilla sugar cookie and cotton candy. i love it! i love it i love it i love it! a little goes a long way. i am a sickeningly sweet kinda girl lol

This as a lotion with Chelsea Morning solid perfume and khamra perfume would probably cause people to try to eat you.

I'll keep note of this when fall comes around.

I have a tester in this for the sticky dates body lotion. I will edit when I try the spray.For me the lotion smells like caramel, coffee and dates. I only like it for fall/ winter.(I prefer tropical fruity scents for summer.) I use it with the super milk hair primer. It’s super strong and stays in my hair for days. the lotion was quite nice though, strong as well, until dry. They are both scents I have never wore and I didn’t like them at first,but they grew on me 😀

I’ve been waiting to review this one because I was hoping we would have a falling out. I am a long time Lush hater. The store is radioactive. Couldn’t possibly be for me.

Unfortunately, I am deeply embarrassed to say I am obsessed with this fragrance, despite the truths of the negative reviews: it IS sickeningly sweet at the beginning, it IS weirdly boozy. The benzoin DOES overwhelm at times. But for me, the magic is when the warm, over-buttered butterscotch wraps you up in drydown.

Here’s the thing: the sprayer sucks and lets out way too much fragrance due to being a windex bottle. I’ve decanted some into a smaller bottle with a slightly finer mist and I find that the distribution makes a positive difference. I also recommend spraying clothes, which I normally dont do but it helps to increase the longevity (and also hangs on to the drydown a little better than skin). I never would have tried it if not for the comparison to Amore Caffe (they smell NOTHING alike btw), but I'm so glad I did. I spray my shirt with this before bed and when I wake up I’m still enveloped in a warm semi-skinlike butterscotch heaven.
Color association: dark brown


LOTION vs BODY SPRAY: I prefer the spray because the lotion barely clings to clothes and I miss that drydown. However, the lotion is what made me realize this was actually a good fragrance since it develops much faster and isnt nearly as strong as the spray. I also think the even scent distribution makes a difference here. I might try this in the summer if I’m feeling adventurous.

COMPARED TO SHAGHAF OUD VANILLA TOFFEE: They might share some of their buttery caramel goodness, but otherwise are very, very different. I unfortunately cant recommend it for lovers of Sticky Dates. It misses the warmth of this, opting instead for a slightly acrid and fume-y arabic coffee cardamom note, which in theory sounds great, but clashes in execution. I admit I was a little disappointed, and I’m hoping that maturation helps it out a bit.
Eye watering boozy and extremely literal. This was a scrubber for me. The amount of booze turned my stomach.

Sickeningly sweet. Wore a single spray and my aunt and grandmother complained it smelled atrocious (they are more critical than your average person) and I unfortunately have to agree. Very difficult scent to wear as it is very strong. Makes me feel a bit nauseated. If I were to force myself to wear it, I'd have to pair it with something that counters some of the sweetness (citrus maybe?). If the amount of fragrance by spray was smaller, it could work. Also, tried it in the summer and it definitely wasn't the best choice. Probably a better fit for a more heavily-clothed weather.

Genuinely nauseating. It smelled exactly like a fresh sticky date pudding if that's what you're going for bust its extremely potent and made me feel sick, I sprayed it on my skin and tried washing it off- it was on there for like a whole day. Not a crowd pleaser, so many of my friends and family commented on the potency of the scent. its technically spot on but just way too much. the atomizer makes it really hard to control how much you're putting on as well. I think the packaging is fun, just really difficult.

Sticky toffee pudding! This scent is rich, boozy, and gooey — like a blend of thick molasses, rum-soaked raisins, and date syrup. The combination of dried fruit, caramel, and warm spices instantly reminds me of festive treats like fruitcake and mince pies. A warm, syrupy gourmand.
Lotta hype around this one. Smells like what I imagine raisins soaked in beer being reduced over heat would smell like. Gunna be a no from me.

You need to trust the process for this fragrance. The initial spray is overwhelmingly saccharine and almost headache inducing. but if you wait an hour, sticky dates melts into a lovely, milky, skinlike, biscoff cookie-caramel-burnt sugar scent. It's how I’d imagine bianco latte to smell as someone who's only read descriptions. Lasts longer than most full-concentration perfumes- the base notes linger in my skin and hair, blending pleasantly and naturally with my skin-scent. Fragrance profile is a little flat, but that makes it great for layering!

bought this one very impulsively like five mins ago and i already regret it because i'm not even sure i like it. it's not bad, but it's SO absurdly strong it's overwhelming. don't know how i'll make this work, honestly
assassinated my nose — felt like i took a whiff of caramel scented smelling salts and made the decision to never walk into a lush store again

Super sickeningly sweet, which I love. Lasts a long time on clothes. I sprayed this inside my leather jacket, and it lasted a good week. There is a slight burnt note, which cuts through the sugary syrup. I don't experience that note as strongly if I don't spray too much of it but it is for sure still there. Not a blind buy, this fragrance is thick and could give some headaches. Be careful spraying this HAHA
Smells like how biscoff tastes. Very rich and almsot like a caramel icecream. I personally love it but I do see why people find it sickening.

I love the smell but god is it overwhelming. This scent is so powering. I can't believe I'm going to say this but this would be so much better if it was less sweet. I definitely don't hate this scent, it has to be one of lush's best, but unfortunately it is much too sickly.
I like the fact that after a while the scent slowly fades a little into a less extreme smell, but I'm still on the fence.

Love Sticky Dates! There is an underlying oaky bitterness which cuts through the sugar so I wouldn’t suggest a blind buy but to me this spray is absolutely delicious like a syrup pancake. Layer it with Mar E Sol Caramel Macadamia and Vanilla to become a true caramel cookie!
Sickly sweet. I like sweet smells but this one is very one note. I used it a few times in the same room and the whole room keeps snelling like it after months!
I get so many compliments it's silly but I'm a gourmand girly and iykyk

straight up caramel drizzle, kinda reminds me of the bottom layer of brown sugar boba— but without the milk tea. testing a single drop on a blotter strip is manageable, but i can imagine in spray form even 1 spray would be sickly sweet. very photorealistic and linear, if you want a fragrance that makes you feel like you’re covered in caramel, this is it. the drop stained my blotter strip, so definitely be careful spraying this. the sillage and projection are also enormous.

i don’t love this as a fragrance to wear, too sickly for me, but i can see myself enjoying the scent as a diluted wash off shower or bath product. thank you to the lovely seller who included a surprise sample with my decant order; even though i knew it’s not my type of scent, i’ve been curious about it and i’m glad i got to check it out.
This genuinely smells like my boyfriend’s armpits after a long and hot day out. It’s a mixture of deodorant and bo with a hint of caramel. Please don’t wear this in public.

Disgusting. I'm sorry but please do not buy it. Smells like BEER alcohol and very synthetic caramel mixed with burnt plastic. I sprayed it once on my arm in the store. I was very dissapointed because of how highly people spoke about it in reviews. It just smelt like a bad alcocholic synthetic caramel. I shruged it off and I kept walkig around the city, but this weird, very strong beer scent kept bothering me. At first I thought it was just spilled on the pavement (you know, London) but everywhere? And then I smelled my wrist. It was disgusting and so strong. I could still smell it on my coat the next day, my skin stoppped smelling after a shower, but it was after like a 15 hours, so its longevity is unfortunately insane. The worst dissapointement of my life when it comes to fragrance.

Ok I’m all for sweet perfumes, but this is like diabetes in a bottle. It’s the furthest thing from an airy and light gourmand. I swear it feels like it’s suffocating me sometimes. If you’re thinking this is gonna be like a cute vanilla moment bc of that caramel note, you would be dead wrong. In my head I conflate the two, so maybe it’s just me who would think like that, but🤷♀️🤷♀️. Regardless, it is NOT a safe blind buy. It does have great longevity for a body mist though, so if you’re one of those people that genuinely enjoys this scent then it’s a great value. For me though, it’s almost as if I paid $40 so I can feel nauseous.
Overly sweet

I want to love this so bad, but there is a sharpness in the perfume that tends to overwhelm me (I don't get the same sharpness from the lotion). The projection, longevity, and amount you get for the cost are absolutely amazing. I'm hoping that the scent grows on me and that I enjoy it more the next time I try it out.

This body spray is a true perfume and actually projects better than many perfumes. However, it is extremely intense. I love sweet and sugary fragrances, but this one is just too much.

I don’t agree that the sweetness comes from caramel, but rather from dates. However, on a car trip, I completely got sick of this scent—although I did overapply it. Since then, I’ve been using it as a room spray.

I recommend testing it first. That said, the price is excellent for the amount you get.

I tested it the 2nd time in a Lush shop yesterday as I couldn't believe how good this is.
Wow! What an amazing scent. And so powerful. I took several test paper strips of many different designer perfumes back home and it outperformed almost all of them. This stuff is incredible.
I LOVE how this smells. To me this smells identical to sticky toffee pudding. I'm obsessed. I need it in my life!

Smells almost identical to the body wash!
Never gonna stop wearing this for as long as they make it.
It's sweet, a little musky, it's perfect for anyone who loves a gourmand scent.
I would drink this scent if I could not gonna lie

Stunning realistic sticky dates pudding smell🤤 however, the note of Fenugreek can be too much for some people.
But personally, I love it, I would love to enjoy it as a comfort scent at home😍

I usually go for more sweet candy like scents, but this is amazing! smells like caramel, toffee, and apparently burnt marshmallows according to my parents. I have the travel size lotion, and I regret not getting a full size. it smells so yummy, and it left my skin very soft and shiny.

So i really like this i think it smells amazing, BUT nobody enjoys it on me so i decided to test out why. I had my mom spray it and walk around the house with it and when i passed by her i asked her ”why do you smell like liqourice?” She said that she hadn’t put on anything else except than sticky dates, and i had been getting liquorice comments from other people so that pretty much explains it..

I love it yeah, but i dont want to smell like that for other people.
worst blind buy of mine, so much benzion ruins it

.... It's nice... I guess????? First spray is like sticky toffee pudding and syrupy dates. The dry down is like rum and raisin ice cream. I love rum and raisin ice cream but, I'm not sure how I feel smelling like something an 8 year old would probably love. It's very linear and doesn't have any 'expensive' notes. It might do very well for a cheap way to layer something more grown up and woody to help make it sweeter. Not sure what people are talking about when they get benzoin from this. There is no benzoin. It's something I would have died for when I was an 8yr old girl and still reading sabrina the teenage witch magazines.

If you’re a gourmand lover like me, Sticky Dates by Lush is an absolute dream: a thick, syrupy, sugar-drunk delight that practically oozes decadence. This isn’t just a sweet perfume; it’s a sticky one, like warm caramel dripping over a mountain of dates, drenched in vanilla and a whisper of sandalwood to keep it from becoming completely unhinged. Hence the dramatic prose.
The first spray is a full-on sugar rush: dark, chewy dates meet a flood of toffee, almost like unwrapping a molten candy bar straight out of a dessert fantasy. As it settles, the vanilla and benzoin create this ultra-luxurious, slightly smoky warmth, like the aftermath of baking the richest, gooiest dessert imaginable.
It’s loud, it’s dense, and it’s absolutely not for the faint of heart. Some people might find it suffocatingly sweet (more for me!), but I adore its unapologetic, dessert-shop explosion. If you love smelling edible, borderline obscene in its sugar content, and don’t mind leaving a trail of melted toffee in your wake, this one is for you.
To me unfortunately this smells like rum and raisin ice cream, and I'm not trying to smell like rum and raisin ice cream over here T-T

I've sprayed this on my hand, just one spray. I'm amazed on how this is strong and overpowering. Being completely honest, I couldn't wear this, and I feel like it's something that could bother a lot of people around, but well, we can't say that the name doesn't do justice, it's super sticky.
The benzoin is sooo good in the background. Just having to sift through the caramel to get it is a bit nauseating. AND I am a gourmand lover.

This is the EPITOME of gourmands in my opinion! A photorealistic scent of (at least in my life experience and notes) caramel cheesecake! How nice! Not for non-gourmand lovers, as it is very very gourmand.

The first few seconds of sticky, buttery dates are amazing. Would have bought it on the spot if I didn't start getting hints of burnt rubber. Unfortunately, this is a pattern with most of the LUSH fragrances I've tested - they start off strong, but just can't seem to stick the landing.

As a warm caramel gourmand fanatic, I am obsessed with this scent. I bought it first as a $15 travel lotion and quickly realized I'd be needing a full bottle of it ASAP. Only sad part is, this smells exactly how I imaging LTGTR to smell like but I get next to nothing from that fragrance. (I may be anosmic to it) This one though? This is like opening a bag of caramel popcorn, sticking your nose directly inside and taking a longggg slow whiff. I have yet to see how it does in hotter weather but I got so many compliments in the winter!
I didn't look at the notes before trying this one and I was surprised. I was expecting a more fruity scent. Very butterscotchy, but in an expired holiday candle way. Sadly not for me.

Extremely sweet fragrance, however, because of the burnt sugar note it does not come across as nauseating. Imagine cooking caramel and accidentally burning it — that’s how Sticky Dates smells. Just don’t overspray it, and it’ll be fine. I usually spray twice in the air and then go through the fragrance cloud, which makes the perfume less intense.
literally STICKY TOFFEE PUDDING!! if you're british you know this iconic dessert and how absolutely divine it is- well this smells EXACTLY like it😍😍

This might be the cloying burnt caramel fragrance to end all cloying burnt caramel fragrances. I bought this because I used my friend's Sticky Dates body wash and thought it smelled gorgeous, though after using the body spray, I can no longer stomach the other products in this fragrance line. Nauseating and yucky.

I will open this review by saying that I am normally a gourmand and sweet scent hater. They mostly smell like sugar and perfume to me.

This is great however. Its sticky, syrupy, buttery, and sweet. Its a brown sugar/caramel bomb. I think the rich buttery facet is what sets it apart.

incredibly strong sweet syrupy sort of smell, upon spraying it fills the room. smells of dates drowned in caramel and toffee. divisive scent and definitely something you should sample in-store first (i love it but my bf says it 'stinks' lmao) . it lasts AGES though and has great silage, could still smell it on me at the end of the day. i have no clue what to layer this with as it is rather unique

A very pretty girl was standing next to me at a public place, and almost immediately I caught a whiff of a delicious sweet perfume. I couldn't help to ask her what it was and she said "Sticky Dates by Lush", as she pulled up the phone to show me a picture of it.
This perfume is delicious, its simply a caramel bomb with some ambery tones. It reminds me a lot of JPG Scandal le Parfum for woman, just way sweeter and without the flowery jasmine notes. She walked away and left a cloud of her smell hanging in the air, I couldn't get her smell out of my head for hours.
I can't say anything bad about it because it smells delicious, but I will just say that this might be more suitable for younger ladies. There are other alternatives that are very similar in aromas but with different intensities (i.e Scandal Le Parfum, or Dior Hypnotic Poison).

Never smelled a scent this sweet. Ever.
It is a warm sticky toffee pudding in front of you that you will regret eating. You finish it anyway.
Can’t get sweeter than caramel and dates. Dates are strong in the beginning but eventually fade (slowly). You’re left with warm syrupy caramel or butterscotch. It is way too sweet.
But for some reason I can’t help returning to that strip of tester over and over again. It is a very realistic scent, honestly very well done. And I almost bought it, even! Voice of reason talked me out of it. I have no occasion to wear it. Living in a tropical climate I will annihilate everyone. You haven’t smelled sweet until this one. Not a safe blind buy.

So good! I’ve been looking for a super sweet gourmand and this is it!
Honestly I smell a little bit of sweet lemon in the opening? Which I don’t dislike, as it still has a caramel/toffee pudding overall scent. I tried this along with their Chelsea Morning perfume and it has worn with the same longevity and sillage, which I’ve heard their body sprays have great longevity and I agree. I love the scent so much based off the tester I sprayed in store that I bought the gift set of it (which if you can get it, and you like this scent, is a great deal). For colder weather, I can’t imagine a better, cosier scent to be wrapped up in, so worth the hype.
I do get vanilla in the full dry-down (been on my wrist for about 10 hours), still with the caramel note in there.
SICKENINGLY sweet. Dry down is much better than initial spray. Very potent for a mist.

I don't usually go for gourmand scents but this one is too good. It can be too strong, too sweet and caramel at the beginning but then it settles down to a very cozy warm scent. I get whiffs of it during the day and it's just delicious. I hated let the good times roll but this one is good. It last days.
This is the ultimate gourmand! Pure caramel, liquid caramel, caramel in its most perfect expression. Very sweet, wonderful, a paradise of sweets! If you love gourmands, this is a must have.

A warm, full bodied, satisfying fragrance. Warm dates, thick caramel, brown sugar, good enough to eat. Too sweet to wear in hot weather but serves as a wonderful warm hug on a cold and dreary day. I dont think its synthetic at all, it gives me the feeling of spending an evening reuniting with old friends in a cozy, warmly lit bakery and indulging in syrupy desserts together.

I like it. It isn't an instant obsessive love like Chelsea Morning was - that is almost Holy Grail - but I like it. I absolutely refuse to have one of those spray bottle thingies, though, so I will only be adding a full bottle to my collection if they bring it out in the perfume version and not the cleaner bottle.
Absolutely delicious. Makes me hungry to smell it. Definitely will repurchase. It stays very long, too.
It's okay....I just get straight MAPLE SYRUP or PANCAKES. Brown sugar & caramel. No vanilla imo. It def is a true gourmand fragrance. Great projection and sillage. Just not for me.

Lots of date at first with some rich sugar notes, but it fades into a fairly straightforward brown sugar/caramel that lasts pretty well. I do like it, but it’s not necessarily groundbreaking. And while I’m not itching to add it to my collection, I could see myself picking it up in the future and/or would enjoy wearing it if gifted to me.

I’m excited to finally (!!) find a fragrance from Lush that I actually get on with.
Pure caramel, that’s it. Simple. Caramel.

very strong caramel body mist, smells SO edible, but I get why some people would consider it to smell synthetic. personally I think its a very realistic caramel, but someone told me they think I smelled like crème brûlée which is a win in my opinion!!

also, if you like the scent but think it's too strong/overwhelming, spray it only on the lower half of your body. absolute game changer, it's strong enough to still smell it without it being suffocating

I love this! Perfect must have for gourmand lovers. It is something between Bianco Latte, Amore Caffe and Cheirosa 71. Perfect balance of these parfums. Long lasting. Good for all seasons, day and night. I will layer this with Amora Caffe or BL, or any other vanilla parfume to get more depth. It is nothing compared to Let the good times roll, i did not like that one. If you love this too, please try also Chelsea Morning parfume.

🍫I cant i really cant, this is masterpiece, you will smell like a HOT bakery, i love this scent sm, it works very well with my billie eilish n1 or kayali 28, SUPER MILK HAIR SPRAY or jist with anythink that smells like edible hahha❤️
🚨JUST BUY IT, TRUST ME
🍒AND ITS LONG LASTING!!!
