Not a blind buy safe. True, it is incredibly potent for a body mist. But I smell no caramel/gourmandy notes. Mostly, I'm getting citrus, something else pretty sweet and complex too. Be careful and suggest sampling first before buying?
To me this smells exactly like butterscotch. It also reminds me a lot of sol de Janiero 71 but without the salty & nutty notes. Very sweet and realistic gourmand. Definitely not a safe blind buy!

As a gourmand lover, this was a nightmare! I understand it's a body spray, but this thing drenches you. All I pick up is heavily burnt synthetic sugar with hints of vehicular diesel exhaust. The TikTok hype pulled me in, and the intense nausea it gave me dragged me out.

had such high hopes... i don't get the sandalwood notes at all. very caramel-y, almost smelled like butterscotch. SICKENINGLY sweet. couldn't see myself wearing this but im sure it's good on someone. the body lotion and shower gel smelled good might go back for them
Initial spray is kinda janky but once you let this dry down it smells so heavenly I quite literally cannot stop smelling myself

The new batch with the permanent range are so much better than the limited edition ones with the gold label. Gold label which I have has a weird soapiness that’s also in the body scrub. The new ones don’t have that at all and is a super rich and creamy sticky date scent. Haven’t tested longevity on the new one tho but on the gold label it projects very loud for about 4 hours
literally better sillage, projection and longevity than my actual perfumes???? also this is a gorgeous scent i might have to start buying only lush body sprays

Loving it! I'm all about that creme brulee vibe with Let the Good Times Roll. This one screams buttery caramel and packs a serious punch. Thought about layering it, but it's a boss on its own. Not for everyday wear, but in my car (or office?), it's a game-changer against the smoke. Gonna be my ride's signature scent for sure. That aroma? Pure love! 😍
Caramel dream!!! My boyfriend loves it. However, the sandalwood note is very much stronger than expected. I wore this and someone asked if I was burning a wood scented candle haha
This smells so good!! And long lasting and I love how this is made with CLEAN ingredients

so sweet and syrupy-smelling. definitely not for everyone but people who love super sweet and gourmand scents will love this. smells like a sticky caramel pudding and eventually you can smell a hint of the sandalwood

Ehh, not bad but also not great. The body spray is almost nauseating, however I do think the sandalwood note cuts through the sweetness the tiniest bit, and makes it a bit tolerable. I feel like the "sticky date" aspect gets lost in this frag, I don't get that at all from smelling this. I absolutely LOVE the body wash and lotion of this, but the fragrance doesn't match the scent of them at all in my opinion and is way more cloying. I enjoy gourmands but there are so many other gourmand fragrances I have or know of that I would reach for/purchase over this. Wouldn't say I hate this but I wouldn't say I'm in love with it either. I will be using this up through the winter but I don't think I will be repurchasing. However, absolutely love the body wash and would recommend giving it a try - it has that true sticky date scent and it's what I wish this smelled like.

I HATED THIS BODY SPRAY— which was so surprising to me because i am a big fan of the body lotion, body wash, and body scrub. this spray on the other hand is incredibly sweet to the point where it smells nasty! i would honestly just get the body lotion and layer it with a nice vanilla perfume.

all of the lush body sprays are extremely overdone. the only tolerable one imho is rose jam.

I got to smell this in store yesterday and let me tell you I find gourmands very intriguing but THIS… is just extremely over the top. There is nothing quiet about this fragrance. It stains anything it touches, and it’s violently sweet. I get overwhelmed when I eat something too sugary, it makes me feel sick, and this fragrance elicited the same emotions despite it only being something I sniffed. I cannot say how much I dislike the aggressiveness of this smell. Literally made my face scrunch up. I would never wear this, but If very over the top, unapologetic, attention demanding gourmands are your cup of tea, then this is a must have for you.
sickeningly sweet. so overpowering and a guaranteed headache. whilst it's not my cup of tea if you love caramel a LOT.. you'll love this
In my opinion the bottle is strange. Regarding the scent-very delicious!
To me this smells like a photorealistic buttermilk pancake topped with butter and artificial maple syrup. Do with that what you will.

I finally got my hands on a bottle of this after falling in love with the body wash and lip scrub. Unfortunately, this doesn't have the same beast mode performance as other Lush body sprays and the scent profile is different. The initial spray is very synthetic and screechy, then it quickly dries down to a beautiful creamy caramel that projects for maybe an hour before settling down into skin scent territory. Not a bad price - worth trying for yourself!

I’m pleasantly surprised by this fragrance. I initially thought it would be a beast mode scent. On the first spray, it smelled like dates getting sweeter as they ripen. However, I have to admit that it wasn’t as strong during the dry down, although it does last a long time. At that point, the scent is also more tolerable than it was at first. For me, it’s definitely a wintery gourmand fragrance, and I find it to be a really nice scent.
this is awful. just a much stronger and even more cloying version of cheirosa 71(another fragrance that i absolutely despise)

Damn! She's good.
This is literally Danette flan caramel in spray form, artificial, sticky, a bit spicy too to my nose, but she's right up my alley!
Sometimes you just need a loud girl in your collection, not everything needs to be a complex niche whale titty
milk extract .

First note is burnt sugar. One spray and the whole room smells like this for an hour or so. After that its very caramel vanilla forward. Its a very childish gourmand, okay for layering but not worth the hype.

Yo es como que quiero que me gusten las fragancias de lush pero ellas se resisten con fuerza. Todas empiezan agradandome hasta que centro mas la atención y acabo aterrada. Sticky dates es un caramelo tostado TAN tostado que te dan ganas de llamar a los bomberos. Muy agresivo, muy quemado. Y cuando centras la atención, empiezas a oler una serie de cosas raras y quimicas que emulan el caramelo, pero que no son. Tipo como si varios hombres bajitos se subiesen unos sobre otros bajo una gabardina para parecer un hombre alto. Acabe odiandola, todo esto en un mismo día. Eso si, al dia siguiente seguía en mi muñeca, ya apagado el incendio de ese caramelo quemado, quedaba algo suave dulce y encantador. Pero no compensa aguantar 12 horas para llegar ahi
Who knows cadbury choclairs? This is what it smells like. But its not that longlasting like the others claimed tho. You guys exaggerate tooich smh..
I admit I find it incredibly intoxicating mainly when I’m home . Delicious

Im sorry to say this…. I do not like it. It’s so syrupy in a bad way like I know this sounds good and I love gourmands, but it’s like an overload of chapstick, caramel, chocolate, vanilla, syrup, and toffee/dates.

So I fell in love with the body wash and lotion from this line and decided it was time to finally try the perfume. I was so excited and after waiting for more than a month to get my parcel, it finally arrived just in time for new years!
I immediately sprayed it on once I got it out of the box and was instantly brought to tears by the extremely strong stench. I had to change clothes and tried to wash it off, but it stayed on for the rest of my day. It smells like a very badly burnt sugar, mixed with old sweat to me. Apparently it just does not work on my body chemistry. Maybe if it came out in like a pea sized spritz it would work, but because of the nozzle an entire truckload comes out.
I loved the body wash, with its soft and warm toffee smell, it has just been a delight to use in the shower. But the perfume just smells rancid to me. Maybe it was expired, who knows...

For me a 4/10. Would not recommend blind buying, you really do need to test this on the skin first

This smells like syrupy butterscotch. If you've ever smelled the shower gel, it smells exactly like that when you first spray. But then settles into a more of a sandalwood scent and doesn't really smell like sticky dates. Kinda sad. I love the smell when I first spray it though

This smells like straight up caramel to me, doesn’t even smell like a perfume or body mist, just real actual caramel. It’s very one note and quite intense so I like layering this with other gourmands that I own. It is very sweet since it’s caramel and a little goes a long way with this even though it’s a body spray.

It doesn’t smell identical to the sticky date body wash (which is my favourite). This smells super similar but not as rich or developed as the body wash- this is definitely lacking comparatively. It’s very sweet and kind of shallow smelling. I still really like it but i can see how this could be nauseating to some people since it lacks the depth that the wash has which really balances the scent out. Super long lasting and projects far.

Don’t be fooled. It stinks. I am a big blind buyer but I WISHHH more people tell me now. It’s not nauseating because its sweet, it is nauseating because of how chemically it smells. I can only describe it as being stuck in a room with cleaning products for too long. Not as gourmand as people said.
Smells like Baileys. Would make a good holiday perfume.

the boy i like has been telling me everytime he comes home and goes to sleep after hanging out with me he still can smell the sweetness of this body spray in his clothes and body, that should tell you about how lasting this is <3

This was a lot up front but definitely reflects the notes listed. I honestly just wish it was a bit softer/muskier. It's heavily gourmand in a very sweet way. So if you like those kinds of intense sickly sweet perfumes in more a caramelized variety this is it.
VERY strong and very sweet, def not for everybody but i LOVE IT
A honey note runs through this herbal rose and bitter orange brew, it's divinely edible. A beautiful, brave creation.

*I have 10 ml decants of this available for sale in the USA- message me if interested!

My review: Really beautiful, poetic fragrance. The juxtaposition of romantic rose, bitter orange and dark wood really do evoke a bittersweet, melancholic, but romantic feeling. The notes on Fragrantica don't list wood but I also get a slight woody undertone in addition to the rose and bitter orange.

This is predominantly a rose scent (with bitter orange and a touch of wood). This scent would be a good pick for fans of dark, gothic or pensive, bittersweet rose scents. This scent would also be the perfect while reading a tragic romance or reading bittersweet poetry.

This smells very familiar to me in a nostalgic way. It reminds me of a powdery rose perfume my mum had which would be on her woolen scarf which I'd wrap around me when I was cold on the way to school. It may be a little "old fashioned" for some tastes, I can pick up the orange as it almost smells like someone was peeling oranges somewhere in the distance, there is a very faint smell of violet as well. I like it, I don't love it though. It's nice and safe for a Lush fragrance, I usually like the loud and wilder ones more.
ISO bottle/decant! This sounds so gorgeous to pass up!

I only use the stick version but BEST LUSH PERFUME SMELLS LIKE DOVE SOAP AND SANDALWOOD SHAVINGS OR LIKE SANDER DUST… super clean but in this expensive way, but not trying too hard either… John Galliano bully relaxed nerdy sort of scent, just incredibly pale blue and light light beige! Heaven! Poor man’s Glossier You if you get the travel size.

I love this perfume so much but the first time I wore this my coworker said I smelled like baby powder and also yesterday I went out to smoke a cigarette on my friend's balcony and when I came back my friend said I smelled like her grandmother < / 3

This is a targeted smear campaign against me but it's not going to stop me. It's actually making me stronger. I will wear this every day now and give you sense memories of your dead catholic chainsmoking grandma just try and stop me.

This is comforting, and the person wearing it seems like they smell good without trying. It smells like what someone wealthy would wear. Reminds me of a la labo scent. Simple, classy, comforting. The notes are not reflected accurately. This has west Timor sandalwood, olibanum, and guaiac wood. It’s slightly sweet, woodsy, and clean without musk and aldehydes. Still one of my favorites in my 400+ collection. Can we worn for any occasion.
yeah i second that it smells like baby powder
tried this on my skin in store and it just smells like straight up talcum/baby powder on me. sweet and powdery and not much else.

I always like this in it's later drydown, softer sweeter cedar sandalwood with a tiny bit of that almost burnt caramely smell a lot of Lush scents seem to land on eventually.

The opening/first 20 min or so I alternate between loving and mildly disliking, and I really come here to get clues from the comments on what those early notes actually are. Something a bit lemony and bright, which with the cedar sawdust threatens to tip it into furniture polish or bathroom cleaner for me. Maybe that's just facets of some frankincense? I can see how some could get petrol, a little bit, but not overwhelmingly. Same with a camphor/medicinal smell - maybe a little.

Kind of reminds me of the smell of unscented candle wax, or maybe beeswax? I don't particularly sense the sandalwood, which is unfortunate, as I was hoping for a subtle sandalwood perfume. It's inoffensive, and has a vintage shop, dark academia-y vibe to it. Might go back for this one, but undecided.

yassified church scent. it's very fresh at first and gets progressively more creamy and woody as it dries down. definitely not an everyday fragrance as it requires a specific vibe to really shine. and by vibe i mean an all black outfit with a long, cape-like coat. this should be a mandatory fragrance for all priests lol

for some reason this is spelled Shady in Japanese Lush stores/their website but seems to be the same perfume. strangely enough it reminds me of Laboratorio Olfattivo's Salina, but less harsh. they have pretty different listed notes so not sure why
sexy priest with a small hint of sweetness :-) makes you smell clean and soapy but it also gives woody and frankincense.... yum

honestly this scent is really nice. creamy but woody. I blind bought it because the notes really stood out to me. however, I can't get over this certain part of it that reminds me of hamster bedding, the sawdust/wood shavings lolol. however, my solid lost this note after having it for a few years. I started liking it a lot more, so I decided to buy the liquid version! then I was greeted by that familiar sawdust note again. I've gotten used to it the more I've used it though, now i can mostly look past it x) I think this would be a really nice one for layering

(okay I decided to try it with a tiny bit of cinders body spray and this is heavenly ...)

Wow this scent is special. It is warm but fresh, clean but sensual. It sort of reminds me of old fashioned soap or shaving cream, but there’s a sweet warmth almost musk like. A citrus element is beautiful and sharp in the beginning but fades quickly. Overall a great unique scent that I think would turn heads in the most subtle way.
I love churchy scents and sandalwood and frankincense but this.. it smells like petrol, an immediate scrubber

I love Lush, but I have always overlooked Shade - I tried it for the first time today, and it totally blew my mind. I love sandalwood but often find that where it's included in a perfume, it kind of floats in the background without being front and centre how I want it.

This is such a delicious, creamy, slightly sweet sandalwood dream. It has a resin-y and almost incense-like quality to it. On a tester strip, this has survived a good 10 hours so far, and I was catching a whiff of it from my handbag for the following 5-6 hours that I was out. £25 for a bottle is incredibly good value, especially considering how long Lush perfumes typically last. I will absolutely purchase once I've used up some of my existing fragrances and can justify buying something new.
a somewhat meditative scent. i imagine wearing this in the fall while walking over brown leaves and chestnut shells.

one spray of this will without fail give me the craziest day-long sickly headache. the opening is just so offensive to my nose.. evil Men's Cologne.. it actually dries down quite subtle and sweet but by that point it's already over for me and i'm halfway to a migraine. gutting bc it smells beautiful in the bottle cap. my evil skin is very much the problem. i wish i got the nice church-y experience everyone else seems to be having lmao

I am always in distinct need of a summer perfume. I went into lush one sticky stupidly hot day and talked to the most wonderful worker who happened to be dressed similarly to me (in too much black for the heat). She described this scent to me as a goth in summer sitting in a worn down church after performing a ritual using sandalwood incense... and that is exactly what I wanted to portray! It does that perfectly for me and I am very happy with it!

if ykyk any of those romanticized catholic trauma childhood edits, it’s the same vibe (i lived it)

smells like church- stale and serene

the cinnamon banana licuado your abuelita made you for breakfast earlier that morning while she was getting your hair ready

embroidered tablecloths and plastic rosaries

sweet warm tortillas

its cool because it’s otherworldly and nostalgic, simple and ethereal. so if you want to be quietly haunting, off-putting, and mysterious, go to your local Lush (I beg of you)

I wore this scent during a weekend spent in a friend’s summer cabin. I slept by myself in a guest house and it was raining all weekend. It was the perfect setting for this soothing and mellow scent.

Shade is almost melancholic in a way, like a distant memory. The herbal opening is reminiscent of the smell when you open a bottle of gin. The dry-down is a gorgeous, barely-there sandalwood. The best Lush scent I’ve experienced so far, and oh so perfect for rainy summer days.

I saw a video in a Lush factory once, where they were mixing ingredients and filling up bottles. I do not know if I got a bottle that was filled first or last, when the ingredients may have been separated and therefore out of balance in strength (not really sure if what I am trying to say is coming across correctly here), but mine smells like those white bbq starter blocks. A very off-putting petrol smell. I do not find it creamy at all. It is not a warm, cozy sandalwood at all.

I own several Lush perfumes, about 15, plus the same number in body sprays of other Lush fragrances currently, and have owned several more on the past, I know some of them can be quite earthy and 'harsh' (I am looking at you, original Devil's Night Cap). Shade, to me, is one of those. Fortunately, it is barely noticeable, which in my experience, is not the standard in Lush perfumes, or even the body sprays.

Unfortunately, not what I expected, and I regret spending the money that could have bought me multiple other perfumes. My bottle was produced in July 2023, I received it through online order in March 2025. Maybe maceration may change it, maybe it will be expired before that (2027 it says on the bottle). All in all, not a success.

Oh, and note to self; No more online ordering from Lush in Switzerland, they send you old stuff. Best not buy until I am willing to travel the 2-hour journey to a store.

as someone else said, it's quite cozy. warm and slightly sweet but not cloying or too intense. it's extremely pleasant.
Update 5/16/25: After having the solid version for a few months, I finally tried the liquid version in-store to see how it would sit on my skin. Very little difference between the two, although I find that the liquid is a bit more nuanced and the notes come through a bit more distinctly. I ended up purchasing the full-size bottle because I adore it so much. It doesn't project much but it lasts a long time on my skin. Can confirm what others are saying about the opening being harsh, but it dries down within a minute or two.
This would be a 10/10 sandalwood scent if only it lasted longer and had greater sillage

im not upset about this smelling like camphor, but the sillage is so poor i cant smell anything right after spraying. I thought American Cream is bad enough but this is worse! Not worth the money for buying something that doesnt project at all
Mystical soft cinnamon vanilla and something magic but so close to the skin. Love but cannot justify repurchase
Stunning fragrance it’s dry woody and super long lasting such a cozy scent that will get you compliments

Lush's perfumes usually tend to be quite loud and overpowering. Trying to finish a typical Lush's 100ml bottle can takes decades. However, this is not the case with Shade. This gem is like a skin scent. It stays close to the skin. Shade is a unisex, soft, slightly powdery/chalky, minimal sweetness and minimal woodiness perfume. 10/10.

Shade is one of those gems that doesn’t smell perfume-y.
You know when you are next to someone and they smell super-good, but you don’t think it’s a perfume because it has this soft presence? Like a fabric softener.

There is an aromatic note in the opening, maybe rosemary which fades away within 5 mins.

What is left is a lingering woody, sweetish veil with an intensity of a good body lotion.

An absolute gem.

Edit: The comment on the mild intensity was for the solid version. The perfume has great staying power and strong projection!

P.S. LUSH, please make a body lotion version

A mix of incense and candle wax. The candle wax is a very prominent smell but I’m not sure what ingredient smells like it. Either way, very nice perfume, I get loads of compliments when I wear it and I think it’s quite a witchy perfume. Very nice!

I just want to bathe in that perfume.
When I applied it the very first time I smelled strong older people perfumes. Although my nose had to get used to the difference as I was coming from years of wearing “Lord of misrule”. So not being any patchouli in there, was something I had to get used to at first.
Once it settled, I couldn’t get enough of it. Just absolutely lovely. Since then, it seems to have opened up my love for finer, more distinct fragrances, that are not too heavy. Love it.
Very much like Molton Brown Milk Musk.

Good lord, I usually can handle funky scents but THIS IS NOT IT. The opening is awful… it reminds me of my grandfather in that odd powdery older person smell. Not old person like what old people wear as perfume (cause fragrance to me doesn’t have an age) but more like what older humans smell like. So brutal. Total scrubber on me. Disappointing because it seems like on others there are some lovely woody notes and my skin likes to pull wood scents but not this one.

Once you get past the sharp opening (which reminds me a little of lavander, even though it’s not listed) you’re left with creamy woods and a whisper of incense to balance out the subtle sweetness and keep things interesting. Overall, it’s a fairly simplistic smell but very comforting, like burning palo santo in a log cabin on a chilly fall evening. Soft projection and moderate longevity. Cozy witchy vibes. I very much like it :)

I recently bought the solid version of Shade, and I’m absolutely in love. It's the perfect blend of warm, resinous, and ambery notes, with the sandalwood adding a creamy, almost vanilla-like richness. The scent has a unique twist, reminding me of a creamsicle, but with a deeper, more resinous complexity. It’s beautifully simple yet utterly captivating. Versatile enough for any season, I’m especially enjoying it even in the heat of summer.
Read the review by tanaC..👇👇...it's spot on. Very Zen scent. Calming and centering with that Lush DNA I love.

While I ultimately love Shade, wow... it has the absolute ugliest opening of any fragrance I have ever tried. Mineralic and greasy, like rancid petrichor, like a stick of butter studded with rusty nickels and stubbed-out cigarette butts, melting on wet concrete after a scalding July sunshower in central Florida. But then it does something miraculous. The oppressive atmosphere lifts and turns into a completely different perfume, softly sugared and clean-woody-resinous, like the sacred soapy sap of the mystical marzipan tree. It's so good, too good. Maybe even too-good-to-be-true good. It almost smells like something about which I would say: "I love this, but it's not for me." Because, in some way or another, it doesn't feel like me. Too unstudied and unbothered and carefree, I guess. I'm too neurotic to pull this off! BUT somewhere in the vast multiverse, there exists the chillest, coolest, most untryhard version of me, and this is what they smell like. And when I wear this perfume, I am channeling that person...and it feels really, really good.

Shade by LUSH
(Store test, skin test)

I really like Shade in the manner of Warm, Mild Balsamic Creamy Sandalwood with Slight tint of Powderiness. It is warmer due to olibanum, which on my skin, have quality of radiant warmth.

Shade, can be worn in any occasion due to it Natural Wood profile without much complexity. But how natural profile of Sandalwood play out, this is so wonderful.

Honestly I like this more than TAM DAO by Diptyque : the blue print of modern Sandalwood fragrance because I don’t like herbal, pickle undertone in that.

I think, I will add Shade to Collection. This is very ZEN scent to me.

8/10

Sandalwood, vanilla, frankincense and something woody/ambery I can’t quite put my finger on. Very nice fragrance that almost reminds me of “Chergui Lite”. Similar style as the Serge Lutens, but much more wearable. And Shade will work in any season except for very hot/humid summer days. It is a bit synthetic, but it is well done. Good longevity and sillage as well.

I recently tried Lush fragrances for the first time and this was by far my favourite. I like that Shade is available in 30ml bottles as well. I am impressed with the Lush lineup. Well done for what I have always considered to be just a stinky soap store at the mall. 👍

Very light resins over nice, vanillic sandalwood. I agree with others that there's a couple things going on that aren't listed- most noticeably a little bit of bright, lemony herbal-ness on first spray- but it settles quickly. The olibanum does a lovely job of lending a good bit of not-too-sugary sweetness and some spicy complexity, but this is a woody scent first and foremost. It's very comforting and wearable, warming without falling into gourmand territory, and, imo, very well blended for the price point.

The only Lush perfume that is good enough for me to own in 100 ml size. There is a beautiful cozy warmth to the olibanum amber that complements the freshness of the green woods. I have 30 mls of Lord of Misrule and Dirty.

I get a medicinal note from Shade; not harsh, but definitely a bite of herbal-something? Certainly the sandalwood isn't at the forefront of this fragrance, although there is...citrus? Shade is kind of a funky fragrance; quiet, with little of the projection of other Lush scents (which envelope you for hours in a swirling mist of lushness that few can avoid). Instead Shade sits close...so close I'm surprised that other reviewers comment on being "commented on" wearing it. There's no sweetness here. Its 100% unisex and 'any season' too. And not a patch of other Lushies like Breath of God or Lord of Misrule.
subtle, resinous, earthy. kind of incense-y in a good way. perfect unisex woody vibe for layering. lush slayed with this hidden gem!

Hm. Two separate people on two separate occasions told me I smelt great while wearing this perfume, “just like cotton candy!” Which is a nice compliment but not exactly what I was looking for when I purchased a sandalwood perfume. It smells nice and inoffensive but there’s definitely some kind of sugary note here.

Subtly sweet,earthy. Hint of citrus and resin/incense

Love this one from Lush. It's not too one-note heavy. It has sandalwood but not overwhelmingly so...its buttery-creamy,but not heavy as there is that brightness(citrus?).
It reminds me of fresh earth with a gourmand slant.
It personally evokes walking through dark thick woods with some illumination from sunrays breaking through the trees
Sorry. I wish I was more clear. But this is one of my faves from Lush. Another one of my go-to on the daily,when I just wanna grab a scent w/o overthinking it.

I have this as the solid perfume, and it is surprisingly sweet on me, to the point of smelling almost gourmand. Cozy and fresh and not at all cloying. I am typically not a fan of woody scents at all, but this scent is bright and feminine, as opposed to most woodsy scents I have experienced. Very low sillage, but it lasts a long time for me.

This is the best perfume Lush has ever came out with. Buttery sandalwood, lavender, palo santo, incense, touch of citrus. It delicious and so unique. This is also a very underrated product that I think deserves more attention. It’s warm and sweet but not sickly sweet which is right up my alley. Bravo lush! This is my current signature

I can't believe this only has these two notes listed. I get a very herbal scent from it, kind of fresh, mountainy, perhaps something like fir trees as well. It is leaning a bit masculine and smells a bit like some medicine I have used before. I will see where we get with it.

i don't like the smell as it's drying down but after a while it just smells like bath and body vanilla sugar and also the eva nyc satin something line? i don't know dude, it was kinda disappointing. i can see why people enjoy it though.

Smells exactly like some scented erasers I had in 2000 - 2003. Not sure if there's something rubbery about this one or whether those erasers were simply sandalwood & olibanum scented, seems kind of fancy??? As it's been mentioned, Shade has a buttery feel to it. I could never get into American Cream or Vanillary, but Shade feels more fitting on the skin. It's very smooth. And sweet but not gourmand-y.

light and sweet (cocoa butter sweetness was mentioned below and i'd agree), but i get far more frankincense than sandalwood. linear and pleasant. if you like frankincense, this is the scent for you! would layer nicely with almost anything. i like lush's edgier offerings (i am a freak for lush, generally) and this is Not one of them, but it's so gentle and pleasant that you can't be upset with it.

Luxurious cocoa butter with added essential oils is what I got the first time and I was digging it. Once I got my own bottle and used it for a couple days I started to notice how it’s not as linear as I thought. The first spray starts with a medicinal lavender but it is fleeting. Within 30 seconds it’s gone and the sandalwood comes in. Nice and creamy like cocoa butter. The sweetness is a touch and that’s from the cinnamon. That lingers for a while until the olibanum oozes in. I say ooze because this isn’t a burning incense smell but a gooey resinous one. That steps side by side with the creamy sandalwood and the little piece of cinnamon.
I really enjoy this scent. Definitely sits close to the skin and develops more beautifully on skin than clothes. Doesn’t last too long but hey, it’s luxurious cocoa butter.

I have the solid perfume and it is the perfect nighttime scent. The sandalwood is very alluring and comforting and although the scent doesn't last very long, the convenience of it being in solid form makes it easy to reapply throughout the day in your moderation. It is definitely a staple in my perfume collection and fun to layer on top of scents.

I have this in the solid perfume version. The solid version has almost no silage, so you have to get right up next to your skin to smell it. I like how it gives the impression that it's just your natural scent, and it won't bother anyone around you at work. The longevity isn't great (or maybe I'm going nose-blind??!!), but I don't mind. The solid perfume was the cheapest option, after all, and applying it gives me a moment to appreciate the scent.
I especially like to use this in the fall/winter layered with a vanilla based perfume. It gives a perfect warm, woody, slightly spicy note. On its own it's nice too, with a slight natural sweetness. I think this is a very nice scent for anyone!
One last note -- I would not recommend this in summer, sadly. At least on me, it only smells good in cooler weather.

this smells SO good. unfortunately i can never wear it because my first love/ex boyfriend wore it but GODDDDD this is one of the nicest simplest most delicious perfumes ever, i sampled it a few times and it really is divine. highly recommend

Got the solid version first and had to buy the vaporizer a week later just to shower in it. Opens very sharp and floral, smelling like lavender and calendula. Develops into a creamy amber-like sandelwood with spice and incense notes. It's a comforting and natural sweet scent, perfect for rainy fall days.

Bought the solid perfume so I cant speak for the vaporizer. Creamy and almost buttery sandalwood with a healthy dose of cinnamon and for some reason I pick up geranium though it is not listed in the notes.

Friends loved it! Only thing I wished is that I wouldn't go scent blind to it as with most other lush perfumes that I try on myself. Maybe it's the vaporizer I need?
My favourite fresh sandalwood scent, smells like a LUSH mountain forest lol

I was in the store and decided to play around with their fragrances. (There are less in the shop, than on line tho..)

This one jumped at me. I like both notes that they listed.

Initial spray was harsh and unforgiving. It was very citrusy to me. It smelled like those strong orange cleaners you use to remove gunk..

After about 5-10 minutes it softened. I get this green woody note, that smells really pleasant. As time goes on, it mellows to a powered woody thing on me. I ended up buying a FB, because it was so lovely.
Very creamy sandalwood with a little bit of lavender, the solid is better than the spray imo but wish it would last longer than 20 minutes, even with lotion and Vaseline applied beforehand

Creamy sandalwood, lightly resinous with bright florals at the top. The sandalwood deepens in a very beautiful way as it develops. I’ve been testing the solid perfume so sillage and longevity are basically nonexistent, which I expected. I don’t have strong feelings about it but it’s a pleasant and inoffensive all seasons fragrance.

Within first test I really like that lavender/coumarin/tonka perfume, it reminded me of Lavender 44 from Rania J. and Sartorial. But when I started to wear it I got bored very fast - it lacks depth, development, longevity is really poor... So sold it after week of wear.
Spa, sauna like scent. Inoffensive slightly masculine/ aftershavey blend of sandalwood and frankincense. It’s a soft, woodsy scent that I often wear to bed
It's actually sandalwood, frankincense, and Palo Santo. It's beautiful. So, so beautiful...

The wind ushers the aroma of woodsy, herby floral incense, rousing you out of your sleep underneath a largely comforting tree with ample shady branches. That's what this fragrance is like; unique, ethereal, transcendent. Like many Lush fragrances, it is an experience that transports you somewhere so specific and niche, simply sublime.

I have this in the solid tin and the bottled perfume. Sensual sandalwood, frankincense and myrrh, freshly bloomed lavender that's still a tad green and fresh, subtle jasmine, or similar seductive floral to my nose⁠—definitely a fragrance for incense lovers. Very long-lasting yet intimate on the skin, darkly sweet and suggestive. An enigmatic unisex fragrance.

This is what a mythical woodland temptress adorns themself with; they offer you a guiding hand through an enchanted forest. They glide effortlessly through the trees, while you stumble and falter, you lose sight of them in the shadowy bush, yet your feet instinctively follow this bewitching scent of theirs. You wound up in a clearing, a cabin illuminated from within by candlelight and outdoor lanterns, something enthralling is in the air. They turn to you, putting your hands in theirs⁠—it is electric, mysterious, yet familiar⁠—a smile on their face. What comes after is a mystery hidden within Shade.

Darkly beautiful, very rare.

Sampled this in-store when buying "HIWTK" today.
This is the smoothest sweetest WOODY fragrance I've come across in a while!!!
It might just kick "Kenneth Cole - Serenity" to the curb!
I'll start planning on picking up a bottle of it soon enough...

I had such high hopes for this one but it has left me unimpressed. Longevity is above average, projection is moderate, as is the price.

Unfortunately I get no woody, powdery, amber or even Frankincense. There is sadly something in this composition that causes an instant Migraine. Maybe it's a bad batch, or it's an allergy to an oil used in the blend. I've tried a few times to give it a chance but we just don't get along.

This one will definitely be rehomed.

Shade is inoffensive and pleasant, but I found I really didn't like it.

I'm sure if I smelt it on someone else I wouldn't have a problem with it, but it really bothered me being ON ME.

I think I expected more resins, more aromatics maybe, definitely more citrus. The opening had sharp medicinal lavender, which i loved, but it changed into what I can only describe as smelling of baby hygeniene products and milk formula... I felt like a safe mum type wearing it, and I am not that at all, it really doesn't work with my personality.

This was a blind buy, and for me it's a return, my initial reaction to the first spray was LOVE, but within minutes I found it offputting.

The drydown here reminds me a lot of Covet by Sarah Jessica Parker - citrus, lavender, flowers and gentle woods…. Super smooth, light and cosy. It has a similar level of sweetness but without the chocolate note. The florals smell like honeysuckle to me! So on my skin this starts with a strong lavender and citrus smell, but it dries down to smell like honeysuckle, sandalwood and tonka with a hint of a lavender incense stick smouldering in the background. Very soft. Not much projection at all, average longevity, but super pretty and comforting!

This is what I reach for when I’m having one of those sensitive days and all my (non-lush!) perfumes are all smelling super chemically to me!

Bergamot, lavender, ginger/cinnamon, lactonic note, tonka, resins, geranium, and vanillin….are what I get.

Shade is lactonic, aromatic, spicy, and resinous, rather than woody. It does remind me of the ‘drydown’ in another perfume by Lush, 1000 Kisses Deep (like @maelleinrome said), so I feel Shade is aptly named as it could be called a ‘Shade’ or a shadow of that frag. Just that 1000 is heavier with myrrh and more citruses and is much more intoxicating. Shade is very wearable; also smells a bit like the whole Lush shop, outside the sweet bath bomb section though, which is a bit of a turn-off.

This is very nice, but I don’t think the predominant note is frankincense. I think this smells more like a herbal lavender in the top and benzoin/ vanilla (maybe tonka) plus soft white woods in the mid and base.

The first seconds of smelling it I thought “wow, what a lie!”. There’s nothing ambery or resinous or incensy about it (as the notes lead me to believe) until about 15minutes in -and barely. It starts off very herbal and light/watery, like (slightly rancid) lavender water, then about 15 minutes in it sweetens and warms up quite a bit and becomes a whole different scent altogether: very woody(sandalwood), some tonka, and a slight notion of a resin.
Altogether it’s very light, inoffensive and imo uninteresting, it’s a mildly pleasant-barely noticeable whatever scent. Not a safe blind buy cause I find the notes and the description to be a bit misleading, I don’t think anyone would hate it though.

Shade smells like a Mediterranean summer - creamy sandalwood, lavender and citrus. I’ve bought this for a friend and am starting to regret not getting a bottle for myself. This and Breath of God are by far the best fragrances Lush currently has to offer - Breath of God for autumn/winter and Shade for spring/summer. And at £25 for 30ml they're so goddamn affordable... you could build such a comprehensive natural perfume wardrobe out of Lush's past and present offerings and I will never stop singing their praises

The note list for Shade should go something like this:

Lavendar, guaiacwood, rose, olibanum, sandalwood, vanilla, and tonka bean.

Basically this is an herbal - woody - floral - incense - vanilla perfume. Shade is beautiful, totally unique, and travels a strange and fascinating path.

No doubt this is top loaded with a soft, slightly green, herbal lavendar (no wonder as Linalool is clearly a top ingredient per the list on Lush's website.) The herbal lavendar floats over the guiacwood which acts a bit crazy and roughshod--it smells of woods, tobacco, charcoal, and the whole accord kind of jumps out at you. Here and there are hints of roses, just light, almost reminding me of actual rosewood. The guiacwood calms down and then the olibanum does show up--bring facets of incense and sweeter resins. About 2 hours in you have the drydown, sandalwood, a hint of power, and vanilla, with a faint lingering of the dark guiacwood underneath. So removed from where this all started!

Shade is strange and lovely--I can't think of a perfume that smells like this does, it's so unique. Lasting power isn't bad, considering, maybe 3 to 4 hours before the very end of the drydown, and outside of the first hour or so it wears like a skin scent. I initially wore this for going to sleep, but it's nice to wear in the daytime too. I've never worn a perfume that has the guiacwood featured so prominently, it's a bit of a jarring note but I love it it lens such character to the scent.

Anyway, highly recommended, plus this is available in a 30 ml bottle, but be aware it doesn't smell anything like the description.
On me, it's strongly reminiscent of Chamomile Tea. Not bad, but not something I would like in a perfume. Also, very soft.

-A calming, mildly sweet woody scent.
-Incense notes lends this a touch of mystery. I enjoy it. (-)

*Update*
This shares a similar vibe to 'Moon Milk' by indie brand Stereoplasm.

I got the solid perfume, since it’s quite affordable, but I found it completely different from the spray, a one-note buttery sweet lemon. The perfume proper is more clearly incense, earthy and woody with the evergreen facets you often find in frankincense. Definitely worth springing for at least 30ml of the spray, as it’s strikingly smokey and mysterious-- just don’t bother with the solid perfume.

Lavender and coumarin, some warm woodsiness and the olibanum more as a calming backdrop than «incensy». Lovely, soft fragrance to relax the wearer and their surroundings. I don’t know why this one only has two notes listed as they give the wrong impression of the scent. It’s a nice one none the less.

i see others voting this reminding them of fm musc ravaguer, but no one talk about the"resemblance", so i just want to help others out by saying they arent dupes! even tho shade does smell nice, even at initial spray its way milder. Also shade smells spicy very differently and balsamic whereas fm mr does not! last but not least fm sillage n longevity is way superior. (i own a few backup of fm mr)

Lush is not a company that I have tried before despite reading a lot of the reviews over the years. While on a trip we wandered into Lush and both my husband and I liked Shade. I struggle to put into words how pleasantly middle of the road it is to me. It is warm, woody, and spicy but in the most mild versions of each. It is sweet but only a whisper. It is not a beast projector but walking alongside me my husband would catch wisps of it throughout the day. I don't think I would reach for this in the heat of the summer but is is soft, cozy, creamy (but not lactonic), and very wearable.
All I can smell after 10 minutes is a soft, coumarin and with a hint of milky sandalwood . But it’s pleasant and I imagine it would make a good fragrance for sleep.

This is delicious. It smells sunny and warm. There is definitely lavender in here, similar to Lush Twilight but without the overpowering sweetness and tonka. It also doesn't have the head shop incense smell that a lot of "spicy" Lush products have, or the pickle smell a lot of sandalwood scents have.
I love it so much, smells like my grandpa's house in winter when he fills it with incense. Cozy but in the way an empty church you're hiding in to escape the summer heat is. A dark hiding place.

I was a bit disappointed at first, expecting something with al lot of sandalwood and a bit of incense. It turned out to be more of a warm lavender kind of scent. So I started using it as a pillow fragrance and that works excellent! It’s relaxing and cuddly and now I can’t go to bed without a few sprays. Really nice fragrance!

[Shade]
⚫️⚫️⚫️⚫️⚫️

Colour: Pearl, Ivory
Texture: Velour, Silk, Skin

For me, Shade is a beautiful wearing experience. It plays with your attention, coming in and out of your consciousness. Soft pulses of powder cast in and out by the most subtle of movements. It is a gorgeous aura.

Shade is a nod to the classical fougere without the citric top. Lavender is present but it’s almost like Shade alludes to lavender without speaking it’s name, as the fragile perfume will completely fall apart if it is mentioned. The illusion is broken.

It is a travesty that Lush have marketed this beauty with just two notes (Olibanum and Sandalwood) as this perfume has so much more to offer. The sandalwood isn’t stand out to me, it just softens the base and aids the coumarin in the dry down from becoming too sickly sweet. The Olibanum adds to the phenolic nature and pairs with the herbal aspects of lavender.

In short, it’s bloody gorgeous and a release that will hopefully stick around for a while. Next on my agenda is ‘Sappho’, however I would only need the 30ml which they for some reason made unavailable soon after it’s initial release.

Tested this today in Lush. Opening is quite intense - smoky and in your face. It then dries down to something I realised was very familiar…Serge Lutens Chergui! I love Chergui and this shares a similar drydown for a fraction of the price. On me it has that same smoky, sweet heady drydown. Very nice.

Starts with a moth killer, ugly lavender (saying that as a lover of lavender), continues to rage as hot pebbles in a spa, then dries down into an intriguing miracle that is resinous, salty, smoky, cozy, warm, and has slightly sweet after sex sweat in it.
It is interesting to find an enchantress through all that mess but oh well, love is love.
Why this smells like a lighter version of 1000 kisses deep, on me? 🙄

I was looking forward to trying this as I love sandalwood and olibanum. This isn’t a bad fragrance and for the price it is surprisingly pleasant. It smells like vanilla and cedar, with a touch of incense and pine. Somehow I detect a bit of beeswax here as well, which adds to the creamy and natural effect. I don’t get any sandalwood. I ended up buying the solid perfume as it seemed a bit creamier and I was worried that, with better projection, the scent would become nauseating.

Since this has been discontinued for a while, I managed to get hold of an in-date full bottle on eBay as this was one I have been wanting to try. I wasn’t quite sure what to expect as the listed ingredients are a bit of a hodge-podge, but I was very pleasantly surprised. On first spray, I am immediately reminded of Fentiman’s cola, cinnamon jawbreakers or aniseed balls and Christmas potpourri. Front and centre are cloves and the same red mandarin as in their Icon perfume. There’s a dusky, antiquated background of the labdanum and sandalwood, a combination that conjures images of dark wooden furniture; the worn shelves in which the jars of spiced goodies sit. That would be the image for this perfume, an old fashioned candy shop, but by no means is this blatantly saccharine, it is very subtly sweet, hiding behind all the rich spices. If it were not for the poor projection and longevity, I would declare this perfume as one of Lush’s best. Still beautiful though.

This is another Lush creation that I like a lot. Its an odd combination of oomph in the notes/scent itself without having a strong sillage. I find myself wanting to spray more but that does not increase the sillage. Still, the scent itself is lovely. The cloves is very noticeable and I thought it was with bergamot but notes read red mandarin as the citrus (the blood orange shown above in the notes is an error; should be corrected). There is a soft cola like scent in there, a tiny bit like in the Sikkim Girls, another Lush favourite. Metamorphosis is a little bit mysterious, a little bit incense like (maybe the sandalwood which is listed in notes, and the strong labdanum which I always like), but yet it is somehow fresh at the same time (the red mandarin and the neroli). Its a little bit like a natural version of Estee Lauder’s Youth Dew but with extra cloves. Does not change much over time on my skin. Very wearable and enjoyable, a scent you want to spend your day in. A tiny bit more projection and longevity would make this even better.

This is nice as a "smell" and a bit less effective as a "perfume". It has 3 distinct phases, but the volume of the first two is much, much louder than the drydown, and the first two phases are very short lived.

Metamorphosis opens with spicy woods, bitter floral, and sweet citrus. While dry woody labdanum peppered with spicy clove is the star of this show, the opening curtain is a petitgrain-leaning orange blossom and mandarin. The clove of this fragrance is very classic clean spice. The combination of petitgrain and clove are reminiscent of a fresh morning: Listerine and aftershave. The mandarin and petitgrain/orange blossom fade quickly and the labdanum and clove pervade for 2-4 hours, the clove fades, then the labdanum as well. The labdanum is dry--no amber or resin here--very woody and dark. The last hurrah of the fragrance is a skinscent that is reminiscent of a dry myrrh or a very modern sandalwood, albeit at a barely detectable level.

I believe the inclusion of "benzoin" in the Fragrantica notes is a mistake. Though "benzyl benzoate" is a component of the materials, there is no balmy vanilla benzoin smell anywhere in this fragrance.

As someone who loves labdanum, cloves, woods, and spicy chypres but enjoys an occasional break from oakmoss, this smell hit the spot for me for late summer/early fall daytime wear. It's not "pretty" but it is "interesting" and it definitely smells "good". To my nose it's perfectly unisex.

Unfortunately, the longevity is short and there is very little development. But it's a nice straightforward Autumn scent nevertheless.
VERY butter-y. Not bad but I only briefly smelled that in the air so take that how you will

I'm soo confused by this one. At first, it is POTENT and will have you smell like burnt butter for like one hour. Then after 2 hours, you start to smell the spicy cloves with a hint of caramel... It might be pleasant for some but not for me. I don't think it smells like gingerbread at all. But after 4+ hours... !!! It blooms into a wonderful caramel vanilla scent with a hint of spice and musk... Not too sweet either (imo) It's so so SO delicious I can't get enough of it. This had me smelling my own arms like a freak. Unfortunately I am STILL not sure if I really want to spend $35 on a scent I can't stand for the first 5 hours lol
It's a quite complex fragrance and really good value for its price . also it lasts forever

i really like the yog nog shower gel and considered purchasing the shower gel&body mist gift set.
SO glad i didnt buy it. got to spray it on myself in store and wow, sweet&acid pee smell.
To be fair, this evil scent goes away after a while, but i can't get over the first minutes of this.
Horrendous and not worth it. i'll just stick to the shower gel

This smells like a gingerbread cookie! It's sweet and gourmand but dry and spicy from the clove. The clove in this is pretty strong, which comes across like ginger or cinnamon to my nose. The clove is almost too spicy for me but as it dries down, it calms down to a more chai-like smell. This also smells similar in ways to Killian's Angel Share in terms of that sort of spicy cinnamon sweetness that I get in that fragrance as well. A little bit goes a long way with this one, like most of the Lush body sprays, so you only need so spray about 2-3 sprays maximum. I like this one but if I had to pick from the plethora of gourmand body sprays Lush makes, Let the Good Times Roll is my all-time favorite (yes, even over the ever-so popular Sticky Dates).

I really enjoy Yog Nog! It’s a true gourmand fragrance on my skin, I don’t get any flower notes. On me it smells like strait up ginger bread cookie! Very Christmas appropriate fragrance! Really sweet, spicy and creamy. I’m very pleasantly surprised by this body spray 👍🏻

🎵
Spritz it once, feel the glow
Yog Nog’s got that creamy flow!

Chai latte dreams in the air,
Mood boost magic everywhere!

✨
Unisex and season-free,
Spiced and light as it can be.

No layering, no fuss at all,

Lush sprays got my senses cooked!

Can’t wait to sniff that milky bite!

🎵

Yog Nog leads the scented crew,
Lush body sprays, they’re made for you! 💛
I really like this scent, which I don't like is clove note gets dominant by time but overall it's a sweet caramel scent, lighter than sticky dates
sugary caramel, just a bit lighter than sticky dates. Youthful soft, bit citrus smelling after some time in a very relaxing and smooth way.

Copy of my review under the perfume on September 24th, 2024, back when the body spray wasn't on Fragrantica.

This was back in stock as body spray two days ago and I managed to grab a bottle before it disappeared again from the site.
It came today and I smell zero resemblance to Unknown Pleasures, but 80% (almost a dupe) to the discontinued Vanille Charnelle by Annick Goutal, which I own. The "eggy" effect is due to the ylang ylang - vanilla combo. Yog Nog has cloves on top, which is all you can smell in the initial blast, so I suggest to refrain from smelling/judging it the first 10 minutes. When the cloves subside, this is a very nice gourmand vanilla pudding with gingerbread dry down.
Very lovely and not too strong: well done, Lush!
Smells absolutely divine the first 30 seconds(!) on my skin after which all I can smell is really harsh cloves.
glad I was able to sniff this in store because it's repulsive and smells of infant vomit.

the caramel notes are a bit over powering for me to really smell much of the other notes. it’s just so strong and overly sweet i feel like i need something else to balance it out like the pumpkin spice adds enough spiciness to it that it’s balanced when worn together.

i need this it’s the perfect scent ever it’s creamy, vanilla, caramel, lactonic, slightly spicy oh my days i just need it. sprayed this on my coat as i wanted to test this and after about an hour of walking through town i could just smell this, even when i got home after a few hours it was still extremely strong
update: i ended up getting it a few days later because i couldn’t stop thinking about it

Yeah it smells like chai, but it dissipates quite quickly off my skin and leaves a cardboard-like scent on my skin.

Started out ok, ended as whatever.
Would make a nice candle though.

Lush scents can start off as scents for one with an acquired and quirky taste (or sense of smell). Yog Nog is no exception. It starts off with an enormous blast of buttery, creamy caramel. However, somewhere around the 10 minute mark it gets a weird sour quality that kinda throws off the scent, and that lingers for a good 15 minutes before the buttery caramel returns to the forefront, now joined with spices that a reminiscent of the ginger cookies spice mix, without the ginger. Kinda chai-ish as mentioned, but less strong than that.

After an hour it is fully evolved and what remains is that chai being front and center, with the caramel in the background. Kind of the adult sister of SDJ 71. More spice, less vanilla-y caramel.


I’ve been told that it’s corporate office safe by my colleagues today.
one of the most underrated lush scents for sure. smells like a chai :) i get sooo excited when i get to whip this one out when the weather gets colder

It’s a lot more floral compared to the body washes. Someone said it smelt like yoghurt which I can kinda see. Shame the original body was was divine the reformulation and all yog nog products after it are just not good anymore
my favorite body spray EVER!! very very long lasting, gets tons of compliments, and people say i smell like cookies and christmas. i've loved yog nog for years, it is so worth it. :-)
I really like this one, but everytime I looked over to my fiance who was testing with me, he was gagging. Maybe not for everyone.

I wonder if this has been reformulated. On my skin this is a honey scent with a red rose note. Honey, honey and more honey. Plus rose. That is all. I think it is lovely but not exactly what I imagined. I like it a lot.

When I read reviews on lush for this people raved about it, so I blind bought it. Way to strong of a rose scent, very synthetic rose scent, super sweet, and not in a pleasant way, had to give it away. Too much and not in a good way.
I like rose, but I smell an overly sweet, almost rancid caramel underneath it. I can't explain it! It is just a heavy, off-putting scent.

The perfume is straight up rose. Nothing sweet or jammy about this perfume, unlike the shower gel. I love the shower gel so much and thought I'd like the perfume and boy, was I wrong. I think Armani Si Intense (black bottle) is way similar to the shower gel compared to this perfume.

Edit: the opening is straight up rose and the dry down is quite similar to Rose Jam. Like it so far!

Citrus rose mixed with some industrial cleaner.
Far cry from Turkish delight. There is no delight in this fragrance.
Smells like jam that is rose flavored.

I have never been a fan of rose in perfumes... or so I thought. I bought it because I was intrigued by it being a rose "jam", thinking maybe it would be a little bit fruity.

The day it arrived, I sprayed it and the rose seemed super overpowering. Within a half hour, it mellowed into a delicious, almost berry "jam" scent (which I was so excited about!) The rose was still there, just not as intense. Hours later, I still smell the rose and the jam, but also a very light powdery note. I went from being intrigued but concerned about the rose to this being pretty much my favorite perfume right now.

I spray it at all times of day because I love the scent, not because I need to, because the longevity is surprisingly good. I have sprayed it before leaving for work, no re-applying, and still smell it when I get home 10 hours later. Lots of compliments whenever I wear it too. I also sometimes like to layer it with American Cream also by Lush.

For now I have only worn it in the colder weather, looking forward to how it performs in the summer!

I love Rise Jam but I rarely wear it as a skin scent anymore. My 6 yo and I like to spray our pillows with it right before sleeping. To me it barely smells like roses- but like something else- phenominal! The late drydown isn’t quite as good as its beginning and middle, for me.

Now my older son’s GF is smitten with it lol.

was i the only one who thought of a mugler angel-ish DNA when i smelled this? anyway, i hope that somehow gives you a gist. it's sweet, pastry-like, floral ... not juvenile at all though. really a pleasant surprise.

didn't like it much the first hour, the citrus was too strong, which i'm not too crazy about . but the rose starts to take centre stage and it's combined with something creamy. i simply fell in love then.

the name 'rose jam' is perfect for it, it's a gourmand rose. in the best way possible.

linear but very potent and long-lasting. great value for money. i love this one.

(note: this review is for the body spray)

Yes!!! Wow, this one really delivers!

It smells like fresh rose water, with some sweetness. Rose jam! The name is very apt.

If you are not a rose person, but you want to try and easy-going rose to broaden your horizons, I recommend this one whole-heartedly.

I love this perfume for the same reason people hate it, it doesn’t smell Exactly like a rose! This smells like an amazing sweet rose jam with cranberries and tons of sugar, i could almost taste it. A lot of people are disappointed because it doesn’t smell like rose water,but I wouldn’t want to smell like rose water at all. The longevity is great and the Silage is good too. I NEVER EVER wear rose perfume because I do hate the way it is portrayed through perfume but this is completely different.

I tested the body spray of this in the industrial cleaner shaped bottle, which is very appropriate given how industrial strength this stuff is. I’ve been on the hunt for a Turkish delight scent and this does remind me of Turkish delight. If a Turkish delight atomic bomb had exploded in the same room as you. This stuff is POTENT. One spray and it’s like all the Turkish delight in the universe converged in your nose. You can smell it a continent away. I had to scrub it off 5 times before I could get it off my wrist.
Horrible I had to wash it off. This body spray smells like a bushel of rotting roses 🥀 . It’s very heavy and long lasting.

First 20-30min: very sweet and a little sour rose jam; the whole town can smell you.
30min - 3-4hr: fruit compot, sourness takes over sweetness; still strong.
4-5hr: faint fruity/generic Lush'y skin scent.
5-7hr: pure vanilla (where did you come from?!) skin scent.
Awful packaging (body spray/perfume no longer sold) but it doubles as a room spray I was told. Fab performance for a body spray. All year round scent.

Body spray: I sprayed this on my arm today based on a Youtuber and all I get is all jam and no rose. It was so strong and sickly sweet. I had to go and wash it off twice and put hand sanitizer all over it.

I’ve tried the body spray- not the perfume. To me it smells not like fresh roses but watery rose jam. If, like me, you wondered what people meant by ‘jammy rose’ it means literally like preserves (but not necessarily concentrated). This does have good lasting power though.

All i get is REALLY strong dead roses and prune wine. I was imagining it would smell like my rose water with lemon, but no way! Oh yeah, i get french toast from it too, which i don't mind, but i still don't like it:(

I tried Rose Jam on my skin today and it was so nice! It smells natural to me. It lasted a really long time and smelled very lovely. I smelled rose, sugar, lemonade and ylang ylang, despite the last not being listed. It's very, very lovely but I'm not sure I want to invest in a bottle yet. I kinda love it though.

Below is unrelated but happened today:
I also went to the mall and sprayed on Orchid Soleil on the other wrist and it's just sooooo good! I just want to smell high end all the time rather than natural. lol
-

A lot of Tonka/Vanilla also here, as written on the other profile of this scent (black bottle). ROSE CAKE would be a more appropriate name.

Yes the body spray is very persinstent.

Natural notes? No Way.
I’m so glad to have this body spray now—it’s true that this is truly an edt/edp strength and it’s fabulous. Rose, vanilla and a liiiiitle lemon. It smells like a beautiful dessert.

I have the body spray and oh my does it last and last!! The body spray has superb sillage and unbelievable lasting power considering again, that it is a body spray. I hate the packaging. It looks like you'll launch an acid attack if you whip it out in public, not to mention the sprayer lets out too much product! Good thing it is easy to decant. I decanted mine into 10ml purse sprays. This is by far my favorite rose fragrance. Sweet, jammy, turkish delight rose with a tingle of citrus. Deep, multidimensional, sophisticated but still fun. I have Imogen Rose (also by Lush) and that one is a potted rose plant, doused with a lot of powdered makeup. Rose Jam, however, is a dessert type rose. I prefer the latter now. The 200 ml body spray is going to last me for years.

body spray: Sweet, rosy-floral, and lemony. Delectable, especially as it dries down. Powdered sugar covered rose Turkish delight, but with a burst of lemon. Smells middle-eastern at times. This does not smell like the powdery-vanilla-rose toys of our childhood.
In my opinion, the bottle always sprays out way too much, as it's more of a perfume than a body spray.

The body spray is, as per usual with Lush/Gorilla perfumes, SURPRISINGLY long-lasting.
The rose is very natural, and seems to kind of move in and out of the picture despite being the strongest and most recognizable note.
I didn't get the citrus at all, the parts outside of the rose smell very herbal and earthy to me.
A rose lovers delight. A+

Oohhh….. now this IS nice.

I was browsing in Lush the other day and had a test of their body sprays with the weird-looking caps. I liked several from the range, but I fell in love with Rose Jam straightaway. I wasn't expecting to, because although I love the smell of roses, I often find rose perfumes too light or subtle for my taste.

Well, as is typical of Lush perfumes, subtle is the last word you'd use to describe this. It's rich, strong, deep, rosy, lemony, intoxicating and gorgeous. As someone else mentioned, it really does smell like magical Turkish Delight. It has that enchanting, narcotic quality to it.

It's powerful stuff, not for the faint-hearted, and a spray or two is enough to last all day if not longer. And that's just the body spray, so I can't imagine what the EDP must be like!

I ended up getting the shower gel too, which is also beautiful. Again, a little goes a long way, so I imagine both of these will end up being better value for money that they might first appear.

* black bottle body mist *

I finally got a 100 ml bottle of this in a trio with a body conditioner and shower gel.
HOLY MOLY. This stuff is BOMB.

First of, let me tell you that
1) I love rose
2) this is the only body mist and only fragrance in general that literally lasts through EVERYTHING

longevity, projection, and sillage are just incomparable to anything I have ever owned, any EDP or EDT, whether celebrity or designer.

I am in awe. I spray this on my hair at night and I smell it soooooo strongly in the morning, I smell like a beautiful rose! I smell this through a full day of work, 3 hours of hot yoga, cold, rain, heat, ALWAYSSSSS

The quality of this product is outstanding as you can clearly feel that it's not one of those cheap diluted alcohol flowery scents or whatever. I honestly fell in love with this.
I got a trio for 50 CAD dollars which includes a 100 ml body spray. It is incredible how this BODY SPRAY is much stronger than any any any perfumes I own!

To my taste, this is the best rose perfume ever!
HOWEVER,it is completely different than all the other rose scents. It is NOT the typical , classic rose scent. It is sweeter, more ""sugary""...like a cake icing which smells like roses. If it was a rose, it would be a hot pink one...a fuchsia! <3 it!

Lately I've been kicking myself for not hopping on the Lush train sooner. Talk about a way to step up your self-care game. And, as your token rose lover...let's just say I'm positively head over heels. Rose Jam has become a bit of a holy grail rose for me, so I can't guarantee an objective review. (Is a perfume review ever TRULY objective?)

Imagine: a bed of roses, macerated beneath lovers entwined, petals crushed again and again between fingertips and palms. There's a heady, surging undercurrent of sinfully dark vanilla oil massaged into skin. Then, from above, yet another fresh fall of velvet red rose petals covering their gorgeously spent bodies, dewed with sweat and the brief, tart lemon edge of passion. (There's a reason I'm not in ad copy, but I've thought about trying my hand at schlocky romance novels.)

There is a persistent aura of sweetness, ripeness, and even an overt edge of decay in these layers of roses and vanilla. And for me, the decay is what keeps Rose Jam interesting, narcotic, compelling, and above all things, gorgeously naturalistic. This is no ordinary rose fragrance, and admittedly, it skirts the very edge of my tolerance of gourmands, which is very slim indeed. For all my repulsion of intensely sweet scents, I can't help but imagine this is a shade of the darkly enchanted Turkish Delight Jadis offered to poor naive Edmund. I am ensnared completely. It IS edible. But it is also stunningly true-rose, in the flower's most resplendent stages, even as the edges of the petals start to blacken and wither. "Honey" is another note that other reviewers have mentioned, and I think this is what I may be personally reading as "decay," with its slight animalic edge.

I have the body spray in the terrifically ugly black windex-like bottle. The sillage is MASSIVE. The longevity equally so, at upwards of 12+ hours on my skin. Two tiny sprays will positively fill a room for days on end, in the most spellbinding, intoxicating way. This is absolutely not a safe blind buy, and I strongly recommend trying either the bubbleroon, shower gel, shower lotion, or Ro's Argan soap to see if this is a scent that would work for you. Though it was love at first sniff for me, the edge of decay and overwhelming sweetness could prove an issue for some, even other hardcore rose fanatics.

Valentine's Day is coming up, and I can't think of a better way to fall in love. Rose Jam is a marvelous indulgence with remarkable heft and beauty par excellence. Friends, treat yourselves!

My daughter bought me a gift trio of the LUSH House “Ro’s Argan” scented body products for Christmas. I had to do a bit of research to discover that the 2017 Holiday edition of Rose Jam is apparently the same formulation of the one everyone loved from 2013 that the line brought back at the request of hard core Rose Jam groupies, & I can understand why LUSH was petitioned to re-create its return. It matches the Ro’s Argan scent which is available in shampoo bars, body butters, body washes, bombs & soaps, to delightfully scent ones self f/head to toe. (Although I can’t even fathom the strength of scent you’d be dealing with!) I craved more of this intoxicating scent, & on last weekends trip to Victoria, BC, I spent the good part of an hour at the LUSH store trying to plan on fitting as much ROSE scent in to my suitcase that I could JAM in.
Rose Jam is one of the most intriguing scents I now own. The complexity of the scent seems to lie within its simplistic notes & they work together to create a Jam that is so damn good you will literally find yourself unashamedly using words like, “swoon”, “narcotic”, and “nirvana” when speaking of it aloud.
Vanilla is not listed above in the data description as a note, but it is in fact listed in the description on the front of my black opaque spray bottle my husband purchased for me as an early Valentine’s Day gift.
The bottle reads as follows:
“A sweet, fruity rose & vanilla-scented mist that’ll leave you with a trail of admirers.”
This stuff is a powerhouse. Spray judiciously & I would not recommend wearing this within an enclosed office space or to church. It’s too strong (in a good way).
I tested 2-3 small sprays (it was a body spray after all, not perfume & a couple of hours later my son’s fiancée commented that if I were to get lost or separated f/ them, all they’d need to do is follow their noses to find me! We went to the theater later that evening & I felt self conscious as I had only brought one coat to wear on our trip, & I was afraid the scent, still radiating off of my jacket, would offend noses of others sitting w/in a square mile radius of my seat.
In general, I do not gravitate toward rose scents, (exceptions: Yves Rosher Rose Absolute, Estée Lauder’s Very Estee), but I literally may be addicted to this. In my head, the recipe card for Rose Jam reads like this:

Rose Jam~
Oil from 20,000 deeply colored, LUSH-ly scented distilled Turkish rose petals
500 marshmallows dredged in powdered confectioners sugar
Extract of 100 Madagascar vanilla beans
200 lemons, ( including zest)
20 ounces geranium oil
80 lbs sun ripened berries, mashed
20 bags full of captured hot August summer air from Sofia, Bulgaria
1 1/2 gallons artisan Swiss glacier water

Mix together in large, antiquated, smooth wooden vat. Let set for 2-4 years. Dogs, cats, & children will be called to you. Apply with caution.
Enjoy! ❤️

I have this as a body spray, but it's very strong and long-lasting, stronger than many EDPs. It's easy to overdo it, but if you spray once into your hair, you get a delicious whiff of honey rose every time you turn your head. Today I overdid it - sprayed twice - and it is getting on my nerves a bit, because the smell becomes too sweet and sticky.
You can get it from a Lush store in Germany.

Update: By now I have permanently switched to using it as a room spray, because it is too strong and straightforward, I couldn't manage wearing it as a perfume. But what a fantastic room spray it makes! I spray it on my bathroom curtain, and it stays for 2 days. It has a perfect balance of sweetness and watery rose freshness for this purpose. As a rose perfume I now use the oils by Abdul Karim Al Faransi.

A very well named scent. So jammy and mouth watering. Reminds me of these rose flavored candy chews i used to get from Japan.

The opening is strong. Scent stays pretty much the same throughout. Only less intense in the drydown yet i detect an incredible tobacco like note when the scent tames down. Very well could be tonka.

I love this for fall & winter. Maybe even a spring night.

This is now sold as a LUSH "Body Spray" (more like a real perfume however as it's super strength and lasts for hours), that you can only buy from the Oxford Street (London) LUSH Store or occasionally from the "Lush Kitchen" on their website.

Rose, geranium and lemon all mix nicely to create a Moorish, sweet floral perfume that actually has punch and surprising depth. I could see people wearing this in Winter but also Summer, day or evening, seems very versatile.

Lots of comments already define this as a female scent which I would agree with to an extent. However the floral notes are not particularly overpowering and the rose is balanced out by the overall sweetness, so I think young men in general would be able to get away with this easily if they like the scent. A mature man in a suit however... No way.

Not many LUSH scents can claim this, but the current formulation of Rose Jam (Body Spray - Early 2017) is in beast mode. This stuff has nuclear longevity that just goes on and on, especially when sprayed on clothes or in the house. With that in mind I was really concerned about the projection as very sweet perfumes sometimes have a tendency to become invasive and sickly to other people quite quickly. Surprisingly however, on the skin I found it sticks fairly close to you.

It's not overly sophisticated or mature, but I'm still really impressed by this perfume actually. It seems well crafted, and put together nicely.

My only gripe is that from a distance or in the general area it scores 9/10 but when you get in close to the skin for a sniff, the scent is very different and smells almost bitter and harsh, borderline unpleasant. So Overall - 7/10
my mu has the shower gel so I smelled it to see if my perfume people copy oil is any good, yes, the perfume people version is very accurate!

It smells like my favorite thing to eat, rose-flavored turkish delight! And I know that some people hate the taste of that artificial rose, but I absolutely love it!
This fragrance smells like a rose made in a lab covered in sugar. Lovely and unique
Don't like it. Smells like cheap air freshener or anti mosquito spray. Unfortunately, it's also long-lasting. Not happy with this bottle. Sorry.

This scent is beautiful, girly, romantic, and delicious! I tried out the shower gel first, and immediately had to hunt down the perfume (which now only comes out sparingly on the Lush Kitchen website). I was able to grab a bottle from eBay, and I'm in love.

I would say that "Rose Jam" is an appropriate name to describe the scent. The rose notes are the most prominent, but it is blended so beautifully with the lemon and the geranium that there's a sweet zest to it. While this site doesn't list it as one of the notes, the shower gel label mentions that there is some vanilla in here as well, which adds to more of the sweetness.

I feel like the floral notes, the citrus notes, and the vanilla note all blend together to smell like a rosy strawberry jam. Like others have stated, "floral gourmand" is quite an apt name for this fragrance.

This has become of my all-time favorites, to be honest. Every time I wear it, I can't stop smelling my wrists!
I never got the chance to try this but theperfumepeople.net sell a copy called rosie jam. I paid £1.50 for a 2.5ml sample of oil and its very strong and nice.

Jeezus! I see why this stuff sells out as soon as it hits the shelves. Stuff is like crack! No idea what the secret is here but they have come up with something special. It's rose, geranium and lemon and while that sounds tame this stuff has monster power. Packed with real essential oils but with mega sillage. It will dust out everyone around you 10 feet the first hour. I'm used to very strong perfume but I had to roll my windows down! I put it on right before I got in the car. I absolutely love this stuff and can see me finishing my bottle which is something I never do. This has hoardability!

Mine is the latest batch from Lush Kitchen UK October 2015.

Very decadent! Like others, I fell for the RoseJam Bubbleroon and then went hunting for the fragrance. I layer up with the shower gel and Ro's Argan body conditioner, too. The scent lasts well into the day after it's applied, and lasts a really long time on clothing. Gotta watch the Lush Kitchen or ebay to get it anymore. Seriously, Lush needs to make it part of the permanent collection.

Floral/gourmand for sure! My only complaint is that it can give me a headache after awhile. So sad. Sometimes I just tough it out though, because it smells so deliciously amazing.


EDIT: So I've been trying out the Black Phoenix Alchemy Lab products, and OMG, their "Alice" from the "Alice in Wonderland" line smells so similar, and, in fact, smells BETTER to me! "Alice" is a slightly warmer scent, like more powdery cookie, but I layered it with the "Ro's Argan" body conditioner and the "Jason and the Argan Oil" shampoo bar and I smell DELIGHTFUL. I'm so happy to have found this, no more overpriced ebay hunting for "Rose Jam."
