Fragrantica needs to update their BPAL products, because they are missing a bunch and I really want to review "Alice" so that others can try it if they are interested.
I fell in love with this in a bath bomb I got from here...I wish they still sold this fragance, I would buy it in a heart beart :( It's so rose-y and delicious at the same time. 10/10

I fell in love with the shower gel......now I just wish the good people at LUSH would bring it back as a permanent fragrance! While that is a wish, I bought a couple of shower gel(the gigantic 500g ones) as backup! It is a bright, citrusy, spicy warm rose! Love it.
Fruity, rosy, rich, and complex. I think it's perfect for all seasons. This is it NOT old-fashioned rose. It's bright and fresh.

I love Rose Jam! I have the Gorilla perfume (in the black bottle) & the shower gel. I love a previous comment saying it was like rose-filled pink lemonade. On me, the dry down is a little chocolatey, in a good way. It's a great rose scent for people that don't want to smell like a garden. I get compliments everytime I wear this.

Great Rose scent - this edition was available when the amazingly yummy 'Rose Jam shower gel' was on sale in Lush stores in winter 2013.

You can tell there's real quality essential oils in this, without lpoking at the ingredients.

I picked up a bottle of Lush Rose Jam shower gel when they had it during holiday season...oh my! I just couldn't get enough of it! I promptly returned and got the biggest bottle of it and realised that they had matching perfume but it was all gone :(

It smells heavenly...like a mix of rose turkish delight and rosehip jam! The fragrance is very similar to the shower gel, only it has slightly more prominent rose note.

It lasts very long time and has good sillage. I also love the fact that they blend real essential oils, none of that cheap synthetic stuff.

Update: I wore it to bed last night despite "no perfumes in bed" policy enforced by my other half. It smells so much like my shower gel that he didn't even notice I was wearing one. I woke up with Rose Jam scent still radiating from my chest and it made my morning instantly good!

This is a very strong scent, it last on my skin for days even after several showers and washing my arms it stays on my skin for 3 days! It 's a pitty that I don't smell exactly roses in the beginning, it 's more like tomato's that I smell, strange. On day 3 I can finally smell some rose. However, I like the scent of tomato's, so that's no problem, the 3 day scent thereby... Well I'm not that kind of person who want to smell 3 days in a row the same, but that's my problem. This one will find a new home where it will be more appreciated.
Blissful perfection!! Top!

Thanx Sweetiepea: looking forward to it if it smells like the delightful rose jam bubbleroon! Its like a mix of strawberry, raspberry and pure rose extracts. So many people love that one. Unfortunately, I cannot buy online but if it were in stores I would grab it. It is uplifting. Compared to Imogen Rose, there is no vintagey,lipstick and powder note to be found. Instead, you get the zestiness of Turkish Roses in all their glory!

This is yummy! It's like pink lemonade made with roses and rose jelly at the same time, and the drydown is like a cozy sweet rose candy, but not sugary sweet at all. It's delightful, especially for me since I will usually not touch rose scents with a ten foot pole. This is so easy to wear and I think it's got a younger feel to it so anyone can wear it. If you love rose, or even if you don't but want to ease into it, you have to try this. Also, if you've tried Ro's Argan Body Conditioner or Rose Jam Bubbleroon by LUSH, this is the same scent. :) Longevity is moderate/average, same as with other LUSH scents. Sillage is moderate, which is nice. I feel very comforted when I wear this.

P.S. This smells exactly like the other Rose Jam in the database. Same formula, different bottle.

i highly rate this perfume, i love, love love it! i work at a restaurant, you'd think serving food for 6+ hours would get rid of the smell, without re-applying? nope! it lasts! such a summery, intense, sweet fruity smell. so sad it's limited, same for grape soda. i always get told i smell like a sweet, usually squashies or the kids pierce-able lid party drinks - i get that a lot as it settles

This has a sweat note in it. If it didn’t have it, it would be so much better!


Upon maturing however, this sweat note is essentially gone.
Delicious, summer candy drink. Got me complimented.
smells intensely like gummy worms and candy, wore it to work and it became nauseating. i was expecting a fresh passion fruit scent but its not and its unfortunately unwearable for me
Smells like a p*rn star martini! Passion fruit, champagne and vanilla sort of vibe :)
Dark spicy boozy cocoa. I don't pick up the vanilla so much. Not very sweet but definitely tasty. Very surprised its discontinued.

Yet another one of those gorgeous, sumptuous Lush fragrances that are criminally discontinued.

Boozy, luxurious, cosy, warm gourmand. Like others have said below, I miss when Lush would push the boat out a bit and make fragrances that were truly unique. This is the perfume that inspired my best friend to say I smelled like "a slutty cookie", and she's not wrong.

Lush scents are not for the weak. They're an experience & I'm Home is no different.
Starts out like dark espresso mocha drink with a shot of bourbon. It's a 1-2 punch but the beauty is in the dry down.
As stated, not for the faint of heart.
I personally love the experience of wearing Lush fragrances. I'm a big fan of Killian frags as well. Boozy & intense is my thing. 🍷🍸
Reminds me a lot of Cardamom Coffee. Can't believe I scored a 100mL bottle for $20! Seller had no idea what she was letting go of.
Perhaps if one's home is a haunted mansion. Not a sweet comfy gourmand.

Remember when Lush wasn't for the faint of heart and did crazy unique high quality perfumes? Well those days are long gone, but maybe you can hunt down someone's old bottle of I'm Home on ebay and relive them.

This is a wild cocoa. It's a skanky cocoa. It's very spicy, it's boozy. This smells like a very expensive chocolate praline that rolled around the spice market on such a fortunate trajectory that all the spices it picked up complement its dark, sweet nuttiness.

If you like perfume that smells like perfume, you won't find that here. But if you love spicy, warm, gourmands so much you want them to punch you in the face then this is for you.

This made me feel nauseated at first sniff. Not at all the chocolatey, warm spicy notes I dreamed and read about. Smells straight up like coffee liqueur. This is to me, absolutely vile and disgusting :(

[I’m Home]
⚫️⚫️⚪️⚪️⚪️

Somehow less than the sum of its parts. The materials used here are gorgeous, however the execution falls short.

The “I’m Home” sentiment here is closer in tone to a crazed Jack Nicholson axing down the front door, instead of the intended image of a loved one returning home to the welcome of baked goods. It is brash and crude.

The aggressive winter spices lift an extremely heavy cocoa / coffee liqueur accord and that’s about all the entertainment you get here. The perfume has too many unfinished edges to be a comforting experience. It feels like an octagon in a brief demanding circles.

I think the expensive materials and budgetary restrictions held this perfume back from reaching the intended heights.

Thick, pure, sumptuous, plush chocolate, vanillic benzoin, heavy dose of cinnamon.

Sometimes I would smell like a mug of hot chocolate with a glug of honey swirled into it. Then sometimes I would smell like a cinnamon bun. Shot of brandy on the side? Then I was told I smell like a hug. Then when people hugged me when I was wearing this, they wanted to embrace me for longer. My work colleagues would swoon when I wore this. An unconventional choice for a work fragrance but I just tried it out one or two days and it went down a treat. I smelt like a treat.

One of my favourite Lush perfumes by a long mile and it is criminal that this is no longer available. Come on, Lush?? What the frick????

I'm Home smells like eating boozy dark chocolates on Christmas day, with a touch of jasmine lurking in the background. Very cosy and rich. Very addictive when the cold nights come along! I spray this on my dressing gown for when I'm cosying up with a cup of hot chocolate. Perfect Christmas scent.

The smell is overall warm, it smell mostly of cinnamon and vanilla to me but has under notes of an almost honey like sweetness to it. I’ve never found anything the hold the scent notes in the same warm way. The smell radiates that same warmth for hours at a time and carries on clothing just as long if not longer. If they ever bring this back I’d 100% recommend it

I’ve actually had the solid perfume since 2019 and I actually only just found out today that it was discontinued. The smell has never changed or dissipated and I only just had the thought of buying a back up so this was a sad discovery to make

I love it, old Lutens vibe, spicy, rich, warm and alluring. It doesn't smell like cacao in a mug or chocolate bar, it smells like good mixed and harmonious perfume. It's not gormand and doesn't smell of anything edible. Think of old version of Santal Majescule to get the idea. And it's absolutely not similar with Cardamom Coffee.

Spray with care folks! One spray will last you a long time. This smells like christmas. Boozy rum, chocolate and cinnamon. More warm spicy (even a little smoky at times) than sweet. The vanilla doesn’t take over. And the chocolate note is quite photorealistic. It’s linear, but that’s just a positive thing, after all there are only three notes. I was happy to find it on an auction, so I believe this is discontinued? I haven’t seen this in Lush’s stores. If so is the case - please bring it back Lush! This is a very unique fragrance that many loves!
I wanted to love this, but it smells like old vomit on rotten wood to me :(

To me, this is a very dark cocoa liqueur with hints of black coffee. These notes then mingle with a sweet, warm and creamy vanilla as you get to the dry down.

This is such a beautiful scent, but it was definitely an acquired taste for me. This was a blindbuy and I got interested in this perfume as I loooveee Lush's Vanillary, vanilla and chocolate/cocoa notes. People describing "I'm Home" as a cup of hot chocolate got me excited.

Needless to say that it was far from smelling like a cup of sweet, hot chocolate on me. I'm a sucker for boozy notes and coffee in perfume too but I was not having this chocolate/coffee liqueur situation I just described earlier, at all. I'm Home felt too pungent, vintage and masculine to my nose. To my dismay, both projection and longevity were insanely powerful. I was super disappointed of my blindbuy and reflecting on selling my bottle.

I nearly needed an entire year to appreciate it and then fall head over heels over it. I guess spraying it on paper from time to time help me appreciate its different nuances more and more. I would let a paper strip lay in my bedroom an get surprised by how beautiful and inviting it would make the entire room smell. Also, my mom would always compliment the way my bedroom would smell while the paper strip would be going strong, and she's generally not a fan of gourmand nor chocolate/cocoa notes. She would also compliment me when I would actually wear the fragrance on my skin, when I ended enjoying it.

Believe me when I say I would never think about selling this beauty again, ever! I'm so happy to own it, it's one of my favourite and most precious fragrance now--- I've never smelled anything like it. The very dark, liquorish, unsweet cocoa punctuated with a distant, bitter coffee before opening to a sweet and creamy vanilla in the end. It's such a beautiful story unfolding on your skin and clothes. It completely blooms in the cold, winter weather and in the warmth of your home when you snuggle in your fluffy cardigan. It may not be a hot cup of chocolate, but it's surprisingly more complex and better. It envelops you with its warmth and incredible yet unsuspected generosity. No matter where you go, you're always home. You're loved, cherished and protected.

It works wonderfully with Al-Rehab Choco Musk roll-on oil. The oil is much sweeter, creamier, more vanillic after you leave it to age a bit. Its more people-pleasing sugariness mixes perfectly with I'm Home's boozier, darker and more bitter opening and middle phases.

It's a pity Lush doesn't sell it anymore, it's so unique among its current offerings. I have yet to smell more cocoa/chocolate-centric fragrances but so far it's nothing like I've smelled before. As a reference, I've tried:
- CSP Amour de Cacao -> owned it, underwhelming and short-lived fruity milk chocolate
- Montale's Chocolate Greedy -> owned it, realistic fruity and chocolate cake batter with hints of coffee and vanilla, but bears Montale's infamous synthethic DNA
- Chabaud's Lait & Chocolat -> tested on a paper strip, realistic sweet milk chocolate, seems really yummy
- HB's Private Accord for Her -> tested on a paper strip, a more conventionally-pleasing subtle, perfumey chocolate, but not bold nor gourmand enough for my liking
- Akro Dark -> tested on a paper strip, a dark, dry, powdery cocoa, feels very unique and interesting but not as gourmand as I'm Home
- Guerlain's Gourmand Coquin -> tested on a paper strip, a very elegant, delicate and romantic floral chocolate, but I didn't get to smell it for a long time so I have yet to witness the evolution of the chocolate note
- Cacharel's Yes I am Delicious -> tried on skin, more gourmand and slightly bolder on the chocolate note than Private Accord for Her, more long-lasting than Amour de Cacao, but still, is a perfumey chocolate-scent + fades into a white floral perfume as time goes by

Just wanted to add a recap of my references, in case it could help anyone deciding on whether to blindbuy I'm Home or not 😉

In this order
Jasmine, tonka, vanilla, cocoa and citrus.

Mainly a Jasmine and tonka scent and the vanilla just adds sweetness. It's more like sugar then actual vanilla. Burns the nose a bit. It's pretty though. Kind of smells like their hair milk. Also has a sliiight bug spray scent but I think it's animalic Jasmine mixing with the spicy tonka. It's very sweet but it does not smell like vanilla. It smells like a candied Jasmine and tonka fragrance. Also seems like the kind of scent that would smell better far way or in the air.

Edit: my boyfriend didn't seem to be a huge fan. If you want something gourmand get turmeric latte. He loves that one.

Gorilla I’m Home (2016) - vanilla cocoa - On a relaxing day, sometimes you need a fragrance as cozy as this #simonconstantine creation. Heavy in naturals and quite dense (vs. Guerlain’s Charnel Elixir), it’s a combination of Cocoa Absolute, Vanilla absolute, and Benzoin. So you’ll get a hot cocoa beside the fireplace vibe. The vanilla adds a delicious smooth element. I also get some cooking spices like Anise and Cinnamon, while I get floral elements from Rose and Neroli to balance the formulation.

I love this one I wish it wasn't discontinued.Its a rich cozy potent indulgence of coffee cocoa and spice.It layers nicely w chocolate greedy to bring out more of the cocoa.Even though some of the Lush line can be on the pricey side I'd pay it no prob if they still produced it since it is potent and fills a void in my collection.I scored a great deal on a full 100ml bottle that I'll savor until I can hopefully find something close to it or another backup of this.

Whoa. I was *shocked* with how potent this perfume is. It's syrupy sweet and I frankly can't think of a time or place to wear this except when I'm at home lounging in my pajamas drinking my pumpkin spice latte or something similar. This isn't really office friendly or date night scent. It's also not a comforting scent per se because it's a bit smokey. It's different but I think I can get used to this one.

UPDATE: This is my staple perfume when at home, and because it's quarantine, I'm at home most of the time. I love it! It also lasts long on my clothes.

This in no way smells like anything listed above for replica , it is dominated by fig which isn’t listed and is absolutely deep syrupy and sweet and I’m in love 😻, the cinnamon is absolutely gorgeous in this , what a beautiful scent I’m in love

Bitter coffee with a dash of cocoa and spices. It takes several minutes for a medicinal vanilla to peak through, which smells similar to the myrrh-vanilla in Mugler Alien Absolue. Hours later, the medicinal quality turns into rum-soaked bread. It's sweeter on my clothes than on my skin. I like this more than Cardamom Coffee as a coffee scent. Only really good in deep winter, but a nice comfy scent for cold mornings nonetheless.

Notes according to my nose (in order of prominence): coffee, aromatic spices, cocoa, sweet vanilla, astringent rum

Everyone I knew hated this. But I secretly lovely it. Coffee, chocolate and something ooh la la. This fragrance didn't perform well but it had an unforgettable smell. I wish I knew who stole it from my bedroom.

Is there any cardamom in here? I checked the ingredients but there isn't any though I could swear I could smell it (I'm Lebanese and let me tell you, that cardamom tinge is unmistakable (blame years of drinking Arabic coffee spiked with cardamom mmmm).

To me, this smells like they took Cardamom Coffee and Vanillary and mushed them together, maybe adding some cacao in there but honestly it's not that prominent to my nose at least.

So, to *me*, it smells spicey-sweet, a bit of honey, bit of vanilla. I dont smell the cocoa at all. Its a very warm scent, it makes me feel incredibly comfortable and safe. I think the name is very well fitting. To me, it also smells almost a little bit leathery and metallic, like an old gym, but thats pretty well hidden behind the sweetness. Its not a shameless in your face kind of sweetness, its more sophisticated imo, with some sour and some spice mixed in. Ive worn it all year round although i would say its more of a winter and fall scent. A personal favorite.

Sadly, my nose struggles with chocolate notes. They frequently come across as smoky, if I can smell them at all. To me, this is a "Not at all" perfume and the chocolate note hasn't left alone, it seems to have taken any notes of vanilla or rum along with it. I am very fond of other LUSH gourmand scents, Vanillary, Snowcake and so on, but this one left me very disappointed.

I love it and I don’t know why it is discontinued.

I bought the solid version and I enjoyed every drop.

I wanted to buy the full bottle but I found it expensive , just for acquiring that chocolate, vanilla and balsamic effect in my skin.

I found that I could bring this aromatic effect , by using cocoa butter; vanilla, myrrh or amber essence ( or even perfume ), and I saved allot of money.

Unique fragrance that smells like fall and winter holidays. The smell of your home during baking season! It is very nice but definitely a fragrance I have to be in the mood for. Not an every day kind of scent. I use around 4 sprays which is light for me since I typically am an heavy sprayer. I find if I spray more than four sprays it becomes cloying.

It lists three notes but there seems to be so much more in there.

Longevity with 4 sprays is around 5 hours on me
Sillage is around arm's length
Recommend: yes if you like gourmand fragrances that are sweet and spicy.

Yummy vanilla with a few drops of rum. I perceive heliotrope in there too, and a bit of jasmine.
I like it, but I have to be in the mood for it, it’s not something I would often reach for. I need my perfumes to take me out, not to remind me i’m home.
***(**)
This is a really unique scent. Lots of cacao powder and benzoin warmth. Quite intense and a little bit bitter, like pure dark chocolate is. For cold winter days.

It's a real shame Lush decided to discontinue this beauty. I got myself a few backup bottles because I love it that much. It is so simple- cacao, vanilla, and benzoin, yet it smells so much more complex, probably because the perfume is natural and not full of synthetic materials. It smells so comforting- sweet, a tad spicy, a tad powdery, and very warm and inviting like rich vanilla bean ice cream with the real vanilla flecks in it. There is also an almost woody aspect. It gives me a Christmas vibe but without all the spices- in fact there are no added spices in this, but there is a natural spice that comes from that gorgeous natural cacao and vanilla. The scent is just heaven and even though I own over 200 perfumes, I find myself craving this over and over. I am so glad I was able to snag a 100 mL on eBay at a good price before it gets impossible to find. And if you like this, I think you will also love Cardamom Coffee, which is in a similar vein, albeit not discontinued, yet (they already stopped carrying the smaller sizes though, but still offer a 100 mL for $200).

Apple pie and cinammon or gingerbread dough. This is 100% gourmand and I like it!

It stains your skin and has a oily consistency and will stain fabrics so careful where you spray. The bottle informs me it's vegan.

I love this perfume.. but I had to let it go because I think I’m allergic to something in it :(
I still have the solid perfume so I can smell it now and then.
It is now discontinued.
I’ve been searching and searching for something similar, and nothing compares. It has this warmth that you can almost feel when you smell it. I haven’t found that same experience from any other fragrance.

This right here is the perfume that has sent me on a “find the most perfect oriental” journey. Which has been tough, because I’m extremely picky.

It’s so well blended, and linear. But in a good way in my opinion. I can’t smell any particular note. But it still smells so wonderful.
Every perfume I’ve tried (so far) with similar notes are always very non-linear. I can always smell the cocoa, the vanilla and the spices separately.. which isn’t bad, just doesn’t fill the void I now feel I have without this in my collection.
I hope to find another wonderfully blended spicy/sweet scent like this.

Burnt cacao scent - in I say that in the best meaning of the words possible!

As others have said, this scent is like sitting next to a fireplace at home and having hot cocoa with marshmellows.

Very feel good, but still extremely sophisticated and complex. Not an overly sweet scent.

I pray this never gets discontinued. Reminds me of my grandma's house during Christmas. Warm cinnamon rolls and sweet potato casserole baked fresh in the oven with brown sugar crumbles, cinnamon spice candles burning, and little me sitting cozy next to the fireplace with hot chocolate and cartoons.

The warmth of the friction combined with the intoxicating sweetness that intertwines so beautifully with the spices...Pure Nostalgia. Not for everyday wear, but that is my personal preference.

I have moved out of the country to attend university now almost 20 years later. Every now and then if I feel sad or empty, I will spritz a bit on my wrists and rub them together. Then I'm home again.

Tip : get the soap bar and leave it with your clothes in the wardrobe.
Warm, creamy chocolate smell guaranteed without being sickly sweet.

I spritzed this on at a Lush store before heading to the cinema and hated it. I'm not a gourmand lover, and I'm Home smelled like a particularly offensive take on the scent family, as though someone had eaten a sickly-sweet vanilla sundae and then used the bowl as an ashtray.

BUT! I kept getting whiffs of it during the film and at dinner after, and it just got warmer, cozier, and lovelier as the night wore on. I found myself back at Lush a few days later buying a full bottle. It's not an overly sophisticated scent, but as far as comforting, homemade-smelling gourmands go, it's a beautiful confection of sweet vanilla, bitter cacao, and a slightly burnt, smoky crust. It's definitely worth considering now that it's being discontinued and is half off. And weirdly, I've come to like that cigarette-butt-and-dessert opening.

Im Home have beed discontinued here in Sweden, they only sell out what they have in the Lush stores and on the website.

Why? The most comforting fragrance and my go to.

Love it. Warm, comforting, simple, like a true embrace. It melts with my skin and my clothes, it is such a perfect winter scent. Not pugnacious, but friendly, smiling. Sharing a cup of warm chocolate, in front of a fire, after a hard day outside, perhaps.

It’s impossible to fight with someone wearing this fragrance.

It doesn’t seem to be discontinued as I see it the website (France) and in the shops in Europe.

I'm Home is a hyper realistic fragrance of homemade bakery, a cup of hot cocoa, all the flavors of Christmas time. It's comfort in a bottle.

Lush has discontinued I'm Home, so go buy one or two before it's too late.

At first, testing on a paper strip, the vanilla base seemed the same as in Vanillary, which I dislike, so it was a pass for me.
Trying a few weeks later on skin, I loved it! It is as simple as the notes sound: cacao, vanilla, benzoin. But I swear I smell coffee and also burnt sugar in the dry down. It's long lasting and with decent sillage: I got whiffs of it for hours. I don't find it too sweet at all, but still a gourmand. Very comforting indeed. I plan to get a small bottle today.

Since I went ‘cruelty free’ I’ve been looking for an alternative to my signature, Mugler’s Angel EDP. This is really nice!

It’s like walking through a soft cloud of cocoa powder, with smooth vanilla and warm powdery benzoin. Somehow... burnt sugar and candy floss are also present.

Performance isn’t as good as some Lush scents but adequate for 6 hours with soft/moderate sillage.

Lovely!

I got the solid version of I'm Home yesterday. I wore it today to work, and I swear I received 3 compliments in under 15 mins. I could not believe it. Most days I wear Angel edP, Angel Muse edP, Opium edP, TF Tobacco Vanille or recently TF Lost Cherry...and a compliment comes in here and there, but LUSH I'm Home must work very well on my skin!
I mostly smell a rich, deep vanilla and cardamom. On my skin, I do not smell any chocolate or cacao. Longevity on me is a good 3-4 hours, and then not gone, but a comforting skin scent. I can see layering this with their I'm Home spray parfum or any other boozy vanilla.
I'm impressed.
A tasty bar of dark chocolate. Only down point was that it could have more lasting power as it goes soft pretty quick

There's definitely cardamom in here. I use this spice a LOT in cooking / baking and it's undeniable to me. It's a rich, spicy scent, and I would say quite sweet. There are hints of cocoa but that's not as powerful as the cardamom (to my nose) Definitely has that signature lush vibe. That said I'm not sure this one will be a keeper for me...it's a bit more potent than I normally like to wear.

A nice, resinous gourmand, and one of my favourites from the Lush line. You can smell every note from the beginning, it's more that their intensity changes over time. The first spray has a bite to it, almost like citronella/bug spray (but in the best way!) from the benzoin. The benzoin also gives the perfume heat, which is where the 'cosy/fireplace' branding comes from, but I live in a warm climate and for me it's more of a burning summer scent. That's the beauty of orientals - in colder climates they are Christmas-y, and closer to the equator they are humid and spicy tropicals.

I'm Home is not overly sweet and most of that comes from the vanilla (the same blend in Lush's Vanillary, to my nose). I don't get much cacao, and it's not a powdery chocolate scent by any means. The cacao notes are more in the periphery, similar to the way cocoa is used as a background note in Mesoamerican cooking to add heat and complexity; an Aztec cacao.

Good longevity and moderate sillage. As the perfume wears on the benzoin mellows and you're left with a deep and lingering vanilla. This is a good perfume to spray in the morning that you can then layer with another later in the day/at night. I have the EDP, which I recommend, but it is one of the few Lush fragrances that translates well to their solid perfume format.

This perfume is so wonderful, so gorgeous and it suits me so well. I have gotten so many compliments that I smell so good.
The first smell is a little bozy and then it is cacao and vanilla. I am in heaven when I wear this and I do it a lot.

Hmm... Just tested this from a decanted sample kindly sent by Hell Commander.

On first spraying, I get a hint of cocoa... But then, on drydown, the cocoa departs and all I am getting is a smoky vanilla. Unfortunately, the smoke has a somewhat tar-like quality, which reminds me of cigarettes and ashtrays; as an ex-smoker, I can't bear the smell!

I'll give this another try in a few days time, as I hate to dismiss a perfume out of hand on only one test.

Very nice, sweet and comfortable. I get all the notes. Not a lot of projection or longevity, but a semi-closed to skin scent. Reminds me of Abdes Salaam Attars Perfumes Amber Chocolate. Even if there is no amber, the benzoin's sweet resonous quality makes it similar, although not identical.

I have tried this twice, and it has become on of my favourite Lush perfumes. On me, it smelled like a smoky hot chocolate, or drinking hot chocolate in front of a fireplace, if you will. Which makes the name very fitting. It is warm and comforting - but has some sensuality to it, gourmet- but not the bubblegum-sweet type. I am ready to buy a bottle, or the cream perfume version. What are your experiences with Lush cream perfumes?

hmm, at first this smells bready on me. literally smells like a piece of bread or muffin or something. it's quite strange and not what i expected. i guess that's the cacao? maybe this just isn't working with my skin chemistry. i get a hint of something mildly spicy...so it smells like mildly spiced bread. no vanilla. no benzoin.
mmmmmm Not for me, it's just too sweet. I don't get the cacao... It doesn't smell bad though and it's kind of a conforting smell. I can understand why people like it, not my cut of tea...

Yes! Finally added to the database!
I have fallen in love with this fragrance. It is chocolate-vanilla heaven, with a slight floral undertone, and it melts into the skin. It is not overpowering or overly sweet, and I say that as someone who has traditionally not been a gourmand enthusiast. Honestly might be the most accessible perfume Lush has yet made.

Got this as a bargain on vinted and it smells incredible! Not aromatic or herbal at all with my skin chemistry. I get vanilla, roses and almond milk. All in all it reminds me of an expensive body lotion. This is how I would have liked rose jam to be
The scent is very cosy and longevity and sillage are great.

Smells just like fresh, herbal rose-geranium with vanilla drydown. A rosey, fresh but also soft-vanilla scent. Very comforting and pretty imo. First/top note is a very natural smelling rose-geranium scent...Then the creamy vanilla note comes more. This perfume smells almost identical to Lush's Charity Pot coins.

This is my signature scent, I always get compliments and I feel it’s super unique. For me it’s got more depth than the listed notes- there’s a smoky, incense dry down that is so beautiful with the softer geranium after a few hours. I bought this online last year before it became readily available in high street stores as I’d loved the charity pot coins. I don’t think they’re entirely the same fragrance, but grassroots feels like a more grown up edition of the charity pot coin smell. Definitely one to try before you buy in my opinion as many of my friends and family have tried it on and hated it on themselves!

so happy i got my hands on this on a trip to the UK, at an excellent price no less. it's an adaptation of charity pot, which is my favorite scent in lush's bath product line (that's to say, their non-fragrance yet fragranced products.) i feel as if the notes listed don't convey the full story of this scent— intense, herbal, warm (powdery? nutty?), and incredibly nostalgic if you've been wearing charity pot as long as i have.

This smells exactly like their Charity Pot body lotion! So if you are a fan of that scent, you will most likely love this perfume.

Definitely worth testing if you're a fan of the lotion or the fragrance notes.

It is lovely but is way too strong with the geranium for me to tolerate it.

I'm delighted there's now a fragrance in the 'Charity Pot Lotion' scent!

Geranium is one of my favourite florals, this is such a relaxing scent. Plus all of the money minus the VAT, goes to small charities. What's not to love?

Yes it smells like the Charity Pot(new), which I adore. The nuttiness somehow pairs well with the voluptuous ylang ylang.

Better yet, it's for charity!

Wasn’t the rose scent I was looking for. Too tart and a bit bitter. Could be my skin or perhaps from the lemon. I’m wanting something soft, sweet and powdery. The solid perfumes are good value if you like the scent. Only $25 Australian.
I feel like it fades to a sort of chocolatey scent which I like!
Bright, pink blue and green. Feels like the wind on the first day of June. Clear

This is such a top-notch perfume for a company like Lush to put out! I have been going into lush for many years to smell their perfumes and have never purchased one. And a gorgeous new bottle as well!
Abiba is weird, fresh and floral while also being earthy, almost leathery, herbal and a little vegetal.
I’m sure most would not agree with me on this, but there is something about this perfume that reminds me of Dzing! By L’Artisan, especially in the opening. Like a deeper, richer nod to it. Don’t get me wrong, it is a quite different perfume, but the essence of it reminds me of Dzing.
As a vetiver hater, I can’t believe how much I love this, finally a vetiver perfume that is strange and beautiful and totally wearable for me.

I signed up on fragrantica for this perfume because it made me realize that I would love to wear more unisex/male leaning perfumes and also really like that on other people. If I wear them I just don't feel like myself though.
Abiba starts very woody and quite masculine on my skin. I am getting tropical flowers and some creaminess only after more than one hour. At that point is really lovely and quite sensual. Since Abiba does not really project on my perfume eating skin and does not have a lot of longevity, I need to reapply at that point which makes me get the woody opening again. I did not smell any smoke and the perfume appears quite sophisticated. I could imagine an architect or curator of modern art exhibitions wear it. Interesting but unfortunately not for me.
Possibly the most singlehanded vile scent on Earth, my god. It smells like rotting flesh and dirty cigarette water.

I decided giving this fragrance a try as its stunning bottle and name caught my attention. It opened with fresh, incredibly lovely, green and earthy notes. I was on my way home and rushed to catch my train. When a little later two women sat near me in the carriage I overheard them discussing what a nice, awesome scent they caught a whiff of, so Abiba was an immediate YES. It dries down to a bubbly and long lasting mixture of vetiver and frangipani (at least on my skin these notes dominate). I can't wait to try it again and experiment with its tones in the spring and summer season whenever I get to be around my favorite Lush store.
Fresh and earthy. The vetiver is great works so well with bay 💚 perfectly unisex . I only tried it on a tester strip so I don't know how powdery it will go on skin.
I'm going out on a limb and guessing from the notes that it will smell like a simpler Prada La Femme. I'll be interested in giving it a go.
This is amazing. Green, lovely, very classic but also modern. I think Lush have done amazing work with this new range,

I had the original Princess Peach and recently got this version on eBay, I really wish this was available all year round! Or at least just for summer! To me this smells like Starburst fruits, a mixture of the pink and orange ones. It’s really potent for a body spray, it has bigger projection and lasts longer than some of my perfumes. Lush perfumes are strong, but for a body spray this has the same if not more strength overall as a fragrance. To my nose it’s not a straight up peach scent, I would describe it as being more along the lines of pineapple but not exactly, it also has that signature lush note that I can’t put my finger on but if you’ve smelt various lush products before you’ll know when you smell them they all have that recognisable “lush” scent. It’s a well rounded fragrance that gets compliments all day long, it wafts a citrus peach sort of scent into the air at first and settles into a really bright summery, fruity and slightly aquatic/tangy scent. It’s ever so slightly ambery in the dry down but I think that could be my skin chemistry as it doesn’t have this note when sprayed on clothing. In the warm weather this smells absolutely divine!
It’s just a straight up Peach scent. For a body spray, this has an above average longevity. Easily lasts for 6-8 hours.

If you were hoping you would get the sweetness of Bitter Peach from Tom Ford or another popular, peach-inspired fragrance, then this is not for you. It has almost a medicinal smell and reminds me of children's medicine. A tarte peach as opposed to anything else. It's not a bad fragrance from Lush; I enjoyed wearing it on a hot day layered with something else, and it's OK projection for the price. Don't expect it to change your life.

Peaches smells like Orange Fanta, powdery effervescent Vitamin C, and peach juice.
A fragrance that combines oranges and peaches.
I don't get this scent. smells like straight up medicine or those kids multi-vitamins hard candy. however, I'm really surprised how long this lasts despite it being a bodyspray.

I enjoy the formula, it's pretty powerful - however this reminds me of toothpaste for some reason. Honestly bought it mostly because it's limited edition instead of the Avocado fragrance I had originally wanted. Next time I'll stick to Avocado.

I went into LUSH to buy a back up of Grape Soda . These are NOT going to be replenished any time soon.
I saw that there was just ONE Peaches body spray left - so I HAD to grab it. Peaches (LUSH: why no clever or cryptic title ?) smells like Peach flavored PEZ candy tossed into a glass of Tropicana Orange Juice that someone already threw in some Orange flavored St. Joseph's children's aspirin into and injected it with STEROIDS to make it STRONGER . LOL . Orange - Peach Candy BOMB . I LIKE this and will use it gingerly (but Grape Soda is a LOVE and I have been using it almost every day ) . The others in the "Limited Edition" set were not as special OR strong : Lemon Flutter and Space Girl. (They were nice enough).
This is very good and has excellent longevity for a body spray. If you like peach you will like this.
Smells like tarte candy peaches. I enjoy this for summer. I use these as room sprays
Princess Peach from Mario collab. The strongest body must ever!

Princess peach under a new name :)

I don’t get peach from this, I get pineapple and watermelon boiled sweets (hard candies!)
This smells like very high quality olive oil to me, which is actually quite nice, just not as a personal perfume haha! I’ll spray it on before baths to make myself feel zen.
I would do literally anything to get my hands on a bottle of this. Yoga was my favorite bath bomb when I was an employee. If you’re selling I am buying 😭🙏🏻❤️

Why does Lush always have to take away my favorite products?? This was one of their best body sprays, it make me fall in love with sandalwood as a perfume note. Cinnamon is not listed, but I always thought it smelled very much like it as well. Name fits, you will smell like a hot yoga master. A sexy spice cabinet.

One of my favorite scents from Lush. I’m glad I snagged a bottle of this before it was discontinued. I first tried the bath bomb because I am drawn to woody unisex scents. I really really loved the bomb so I had to buy this. This smells so pretty on me. For some reason I thought it had some neroli in it but I don’t see that listed. Something in the composition makes it lean a little feminine on me and I can’t figure it out, but I love it. (Maybe it’s just my own body chemistry.) Favorite body spray I own. I use it very sparingly now. I could see this one working year-round.

Too bad they took this out of their body spray collection. One of my favourite body sprays. The first association would be Karma when reading the name but they're definitely 2 different pair of shoes. This is a woody and grounding scent. The name is definitely spot on!

It is difficult to find camphor in the olfactory notes. Or it's unusual anyway. This body spray is really special, definitely dedicated to a male audience but that doesn't scare me. Definitely a very powerful meditative fragrance (hence the name YOGA). On the skin it remains "strange" for hours, perhaps it is this particularity that tries to open the mind .... It then dissolves over the hours in the meditative note of sandalwood. A fragrance that is difficult to understand, just like the fragrance, again by Lush, BREATH OF GOD, which I really appreciate.
Very strong and spicy to me initially, after a few minutes, I love how it softens up. I really love Karma, it’s a perfect bold orange mixed with patchouli.

This is absolutely stunning. I would say that it's not that different from the perfume, the longevity is obviously different but this still lasts a lot. I was dying for them to put this out cause I love Karma and it's 200ml! Great job for Lush to make this a body spray, definitely worth it.

just amazing... heavier on the orange than the patchouli but i don't mind that. i prefer wearing this at work than other iterations of this fragrance for that very reason. it's not as complex as the perfume but it's still Karma. it's amazing.

For YEARS now, I wished for a KARMA Body Spray. Dollar for Dollar : LUSH Body Sprays last forever and a single bottle will be with you for a year or 2. 4 sprays / all day ! Well, now they made it. I was not thrilled. It's $42.00 and lacking some notes that make KARMA , Karma. So I passed on the body spray and got the perfume . The latest batches last all day long.
used the tester in lush. smells really similar to avocado co wash to me??? in the dry down it's starting to smell like a graham cracker. its growing on me lol

It’s so weird to me to see other reviewers describe this as rubbery. But I guess that’s the beauty of fragrance, it can evoke different memories/vibes for everyone.
To me this is such a beautiful and unisex herbal tea fragrance that reminds me a lot of The Vert and The Blanc from Bvlgari but with a touch of Lush because well… it’s Lush lol. Think drinking a chamomile green tea blend on the countryside. Very zen and easy going. Really enjoy this one!
I hate that they keep releasing fragrances I love that are only available in a large size bottle though.
It smells like burnt rubber and cigarettes. Like a hillbillies old rusty Ford truck with a door missing and mold.

Honestly? It’s awful. Emma Vincent usually does much much better.

It’s some kind of chemical mess that smells like rubber and herbs. If you love the scent of chamomile, skip this one — there’s none of it here. This isn’t a spa, it’s a nightmare come to life.

The longevity is practically nonexistent.

Lush is a brand that will experiment and explore, leading to scents you either adore or hate.

Fronds is a hit for me.

This a floral fennel perfume at the core. Chamomile is definitely at play here to give this scent a very mild natural sweetness.

This lasts well and projects nicely also.

The only issue I have with this scent is that I have absolutely zero clue where it would be appropriate to wear this.

10/10 scent I will buy if I ever figure out when to wear it.

I really want to love this perfume and wear it, but unfortunately we're not made for each other. I adore how complex the scent is and how truly it reminds me of my dear Hungarian meadows in the summer with their air of wild flowers mixed with sun-dried grasses. The scent of chamomile and fennel definitely dominate after the perfume dries down. It's an absolutely long lasting fragrance that remained on my coat after I tested it in my local Lush store in Budapest. There's no way I could ever use a full bottle of 100 mls as if I still eventually decided buying it I'd save this scent only for special occasions.

This is my favourite of the new releases. It doesn’t literally smell like green tea but it has the same sort of feel. It’s herbaceous in the same way Green tea is - i.e, not overbearing or too green or too bitter. Imagine green tea with chamomile and a touch of sweetness and you can get an idea of how Hungarian Fronds smells. It’s soothing and calm and smells like a spa. It’s pricy but it performs well and has a beautiful bottle and juice.

Edit; I finally worked out what this smells like - a more natural and less screechy version of Fleurs de Lanvin’s Sweet Jasmine! That one gives me a headache but I enjoyed the scent. This is like a refined take on that same profile!

Be warned! The fennel here smells like herbs to me but my husband gets vegetables and hates it 😅
Smells like peppermint straight up

if you want to smell like a lush shop get this body spray. love the mint in this, makes me feel very home-y. ideal after taking a hot comforting shower and getting into your most comfy clothes, just to lounge around at home and read a book.

This is really popular in my city. After asking multiple people what they were wearing I grabbed a bottle for myself. Really fills a room, super fresh and the dry down has a deep old school fougere/barbershop vibe I love (Best sprayed on clothes for this effect)
It smells exactly like showering after getting out of the pool and I love it
I love the perfume version of this, but the body spray has a strange, plasticy dry down

i'm in the middle of kinda liking and finding it okay. i used to use this a lot a few years ago but these days it makes me feel like a tube of toothpaste. super duper minty, interestingly refreshing to a degree! it's not bad but i feel like you have to be in the mood for this one. maybe a quick small spray type thing.

A beautiful, fresh, realistic mint mixed with tarragon. Smells like the seaside and creates a wonderful mojito scent when mixed with a lime fragrance. As expected with Lush body sprays, incredibly long lasting with great projection.
If you want to smell like a swimming pool with possibly *too* much chlorine, then do I have the spray for you!
I absolutely love this Body spray. The lavender is so calming and soothing and the green mint adds some refreshing notes to it. It makes me happy smelling it as I find it very soothing.

Finally found my ultimate after shower scent! This is exactly what I was in search of and I'm kicking myself for not giving this one a go earlier. It's just so fresh and crisp, makes me feel extra clean and helps me relax. Really enjoying these Lush body sprays lately!

A good, simple scent for those who are new to perfumes! I got this for my boyfriend who has a sensitive nose and they loved it. Really good to wear to work as well as it's not so strong that it would annoy your colleagues.

I've been looking for mint vanilla combo. I love the combo and it performs better that niche IMO. This has no vanilla, but it itches the scratch. I liked Lord of misrule too. But, doesn't seem like many agree🙁.

I feel like this gets such hate, and I just don't get it! It's one of my favourites - zingy, fresh, cool, and incredibly uplifting. I've strategically worn this on hot days to feel cooler.

I think so much of it seems to depend on skin chemistry. Personally, I get a soapy mint scent, warmed and rounded off by savoury thyme. It's a complete compliment-getter, for me, with people saying they're straight off to Lush to buy it.

It has a barbershop quality that has filled the gap that Sandalwood by Elizabeth Arden left behind - suspect that's the soapy lavender.

Rather unisex, too. I have nothing bad at all to say about it!

#JusticeForDirty

Cheap cinnamon chewing gum.

Dirty, the body spray, smells like cinnamon bubblegum, the red bubblegum. Spicy and minty chewing gum.

Maybe it sounds tasty, unfortunately, it's a cheap version of it's smell.

Mmmmm i’m actually obsessed with this whole line of products from Lush lmao. the shower gel, body spray, solid perfume, and perfume spray all smell perfect to me. like do you want to smell like mint or do you not? if you love minty smells and want to smell like mint then yeah. it’s g r eat
Unisex, clean smelling spearmint. Like a cold, just brushed your teeth kiss. Can definitely see someone spraying this if they didn't have time to shower.

Hhahahah I am reading reviews and crying laughing, my boyfriend and I love this scent (apparently we are the only ones). This is such a spearmint/peppermint gum with all its natural sweetness. To me this is cozy, for autumn-winter season

i had it and finished it months ago, not because i wore it often, because i just wanted the day where i would never smell it ever again to come sooner, i used it as a room freshner or as a cleaning spray (crappy perfume works as a cleaning spray if you have kids around and they draw on the walls with markers and such) it smells almost sweet in a not good way, it's horrendous. people say it smells like a urinal cake and i thankfully haven't been sniffing urinal cakes lately, the mint doesn't help it either. it smells like maybe an expired mint tea blend that survived being buried 2000 feet under the ground.
The urinal cake comparison is on point and I hate it. The longevity and sillage is great! Unfortunately.
I have a hairless dog. He has to wear sweaters. I spray his sweaters with this and he gets a lot of compliments. Excellent perfume for a dog.
You see the chart, and it's promising; you smell it, and you want to puke. What kind of sorcery is this?
If I smell someone wearing this I'm turning violent. Cellotape and off brand mint sauce. I'm so mad right now

My partner loves this scent, but I had to kindly request she stops wearing it. All I told her was I really disliked it in order to protect her, but I have to speak my truth here and echo what a couple of other reviewers have said.

It smells like a urinal cake.

Please avoid unless you want to smell like a men's bathroom.
Let’s just say I’m glad i didn’t blind buy and went to the store to try

A freebie, I keep this mini spray in my gym bag. I would say this is definitely a spearmint and not a peppermint smell. I like the herbal notes but spearmint is not my favorite so I reserve this for overpowering genuinely stinky situations. Can be helpful as a car or room spray as well.

This perfume is the the physical embodiment of a suited crime boss chewing gum aggressively if that makes sense.
It smells exactly like an aquatic aftershave mixed with fresh chewing gum , when I wear it , the most common thing I get is that ' I smell clean' I personally adore this scent , but it's not the type of scent which is comforting and sweet , it's more and masculine and stated

This is the scent I use after a shower, when I'm home and want to read a book curled up on the couch all day. Something that is super calming and relaxing. It does have a very strong herbal/ lavender scent. The lavender is not the creamy warming kind and neither is the sandalwood, which is why so many reviews are stating its masculine leaning. I do think it's a true unisex because where it may be more sharp on the nose its a very soothing dry down and is very reminiscent of essential oils in a diffuser. Doesn't last forever on the skin, but I can smell it next day on my clothes.
This smells... interesting, to say the least. To me it's very clogging and gives me a headache.
Dirty smells like toothpaste to me
Very strong and headache inducing smell, all i smell is incense and unpleasant herbs.
Every fuckboi in my uni used to wear this… Dirty was like Dior Sauvage for skater boys in art school. This is the scent of untamed, untrustworthy young men lol

an old roommate of mine had it and every time she'd use it i'd try to hang out downstairs near her LOL its one of the most refreshing, pleasing scents i've smelled. super clean, laundry/fancy body soap smell but in the best possible way. it lingered in the air allll day much to my pleasure :) I think the spray bottle is hilarious too

I am the comment that you're looking for. Dont buy this if you dont like incense/ strong herb notes. I wanted to smell like shower fresh spearmint, but the mint note disappears after a couple of minutes, and Im left smelling like a strong, horrible incense. If anyone knows something fresh to pair this with, let me know.

my favorite everyday scent! i've used about 3-4 bottles of this since 2018 lol
fresh & clean with a pretty moderate scent trail for a body spray (enough that people know when i've been in a lift before them and i've been identified on public transport by scent as well - and i'm not an oversprayer!) find this to be stronger than the actual perfume version

can smell a little sharp in the opening but quickly dries down to a fresh mint with a very subtle floral/woody almost? undertone that makes it more clean vibes~ than straight up toothpaste. forever fav
for ref i live in a very hot & humid country and find that it doesnt work as well on me when i travel n use it in colder climates :-)

Okay, I see Dirty getting a bad rep and if you don’t vibe with mint I can understand, personally I find Dirty to be such a clean smell.
It’s clean, fresh, soapy and when layering with Britney Spears - Curious it’s an absolute match made in heaven.

I have to be honest, I do not use this one as a body perfume, but as a deodorizer for the bathroom. So as most people note, it's quite strong and overpowering which works for the circumstance. I love the of the mint and sandalwood, for me the lavender takes more of a back seat. It's very soapy, and largely because of the strong mint.

Something in this scent doesn’t work for me. There’s an overpowering sharp and bitter note that is really off putting. It reminds me of earwax. I think it’s the tarragon or the tarragon combined with the lavender that goes weird on my skin. It’s a shame cause I feel like this could work, but it just doesn’t..

Honestly don't vibe with the toothpaste medicine situation, but it is the favorite smell of one of my close friends. She lives in a different country and I bought a bottle just so I can spray it in my room from time to time and remember freezing my ass off when visiting her last winter and how much fun we had during that week.
Love you, Frances. <3

Exactly like spearmint toothpaste. When i spray it, its like i just cover my entire body in toothpaste or dowsed myself in mouthwash after brushing my teeth. It is however very fresh with a male aftershave kind of vibe. There is something in it which is very masculine.

Whenever I smell this on anyone, I recoil. It pairs so badly with sweat and the mint and herbal notes (tarragon/thyme) give it a medicinal, piercing quality….. reminiscent of hospitals , absinthe and mouthwash. There’s something about mint and sandal wood together that smells like brushing your teeth in a piss soaked men’s bathroom. The projection of this is sadly very impressive and likely this makes it a favourite among people with stronger BO. Genetically I think I detect androgens in sweat like piss, not the lucky other categories of grass /hay. To me , Dirty mixes with androgen heavy sweat in a way that amplifies the piss smell. Or maybe it smells so similar to a urinal cake that I’m inventing the piss smell. It’s also been described as “marine”, fitting if nauseating others like the sea is your thing. Looking at the individual ingredients too… none of them are ones I dislike, it doesn’t make any sense how it turned out this revolting. Lush’s other perfumes are decent but this is just so unbelievably awful I went out of my way to find out about it as self preservation.

Yes this is quite minty, but to me it was overpoweringly marine smelling which is surprising but also quite nauseating. For a fresh/herbal, it’s probably the strongest fragrance I have ever tried, and I am someone who wears a lot of heavy woody/amber scents. I still smell this stuff on my forearm two days later and after showers. Not for me.
Such a refreshing and energizing scent!

Not sure what I'd like to say about this one, got gifted it and used up the whole thing, so was pretty inoffensive, and cheap and simple enough to be room spray. Love the projection on these bottles, tho.

I love the idea of this scent, but not how it wears on me. This scent gets pretty strong/overwhelming pretty fast, even without a lot being put on. It lasts a long time and wears down well which is nice; that being said it's just not for me even though I wanted to like it

My signature scent; fresh, pungent, and effervescent. I love this stuff. Loved it since '15, officially my sign scent starting '20. Lush's body sprays are great in longevity and silage. Will forever repurchase and love this scent. The mint is the strongest note but the others give it more body and roundest so you just don't smell like a stick of gum. Never smelt this in the cologne/perfume concentration but so happily pleased with the body spray.

I received this awhile back, and have multiple items from the “Dirty” line. It is in the vein of “You Or Someone Like You” in that it has a very natural spearmint/mint note that is dominant. I have enjoyed this many times for the uplifting qualities it carry’s. I just ordered the actual perfume, but I did so for a reason.

Awhile back I purchased Blue Sugar from Aquolina, while that fragrance leans a little too young and immature on its own, I did get a sense that the sweet and the underlying Anise could layer with a darker earthier more natural scent. I know that layering is not for everyone, but if curious Dirty and Blue Sugar work very well together, even the inexpensive body spray. By doing this I find I can now wear Blue Sugar in public with this modified version. I was lucky enough to pick up a giant 200ml decant of Blue Sugar, and this body spray is inexpensive as well, so I should have a long run of this experiMINT. If anyone has layering suggestions for either please message me. Thanks again.

I have always stuck my dark, woody, spicy and gourmand scents (think TF Black Orchid, Noir Extreme etc.) but about 2 years ago I asked my friend what he was wearing as I loved the fresh smell of this and since have been hooked - I'm now on my 3rd (!) bottle of this stuff. This is my absolute go to everyday classic fragrance. I feel the notes listed here almost don't do it justice as you'd think it would be overpoweringly minty and lavender-heavy but it's really more of a fresh sea kind of scent.

This fragrance is not overpowering, it's not bold but it still has some subtle complexity. I always get compliments when wearing this and people always ask what it is! It's so comforting and refreshing, imagine walking through fields of lavender and mint while the cool ocean breeze hits your face.

In terms of how it wears, I find personally the top mint evaporates off very quickly which I actually enjoy, leaving behind the more floral and woody mid and base while still retaining a freshness that isn't pure mint. It's not super long wearing, usually lasts about 5h for me which I wish it would last a little more to be honest. The only thing I don't like is you need quite a lot to get the intensity of say an Eau de Parfum which is fair as this is a body spray. When this bottle finishes I'm going to get the actual Parfum and see if that wears better (same friend above said it does).

Just got this and am using it as a room spray (bedroom and toilet)... I want to smell mint everywhere I go. I have the perfume and bodywash, and now I need the mouthwash tablets and mask and it will be complete.

It seems like there is some missing notes in the pyramid. What I read from the bottle is that there is Thyme, Tarragon, Sandalwood, Lavender and Spearmint (not sure in what arrangement).

It's actually very mood lifting. I don't get the headache like some reviewers mentioned. Really love the minty scent this gives.

Careful not to overspray; smells like a convenient store bathroom. A little urinal cake like. I originally smelled it and thought this was a clean, fresh scent, and then it became so overbearing I ended up selling it in a garage sale.

Nice dry down, but only that. When you first spray it, it smells like minty gargle. I also get something like sour wood, I guess that it's oakmoss. It’s just not an appealing scent on me. Only part I like is that it’s herbal and aromatic.. I don’t get to use this at all because it's too masculine. This would be nice on guys as it smells clean, aromatic, and sparkly in the dry down. I can imagine it would be a great scent on guy’s shirt or as fabric softener for men.

Very big fan of this. Don't ever use this like an EDT. Body Sprays are more like mists where you just walk into the haze. This is quite handy when you have a stinky toddler or hubby who needs a freshen up. You can use it in place of incense too.

Bombastic opening and I love the wake up call of mint. This wil give delicate types a bit of a headache. But I'm pleased by stuff with dynamite character. However your first thought will probably be, why do I smell like Aquafresh toothpaste. :)

This is ultimately the cleanest scent. Dry down is quick and I appreciate the sandalwood base. It's a simple scent to put together. Wake up and relax. Best for clothes rather than a skin scent
Very strong opening but the die down is super clean good. I like it. Just don't go out right after spraying this, at least wait 30-40 minutes. Your clothes will smell great the next day.

My partner bought this last year and I think it is possibly the most headache inducing, nauseating, gut wrenching, foul concoction to ever have been sold under the guise of perfume. Never have my nostrils been so offended; not even by the stench of rotting animal carcasses or of pure undiluted ammonia. The fact that Dirty is packaged in the type of spray bottle that wouldn’t go amiss trying to exterminate a nest of killer hornets is an irony not all together lost on me. Once, my partner and I had a petty argument about goodness knows what and in his impulsive rage (knowing my utter revulsion with this disgusting poison) he grabbed the Dirty spray and proceeded to exterminate me. He almost succeeded as I screamed and coughed and spat on my knees, never have I felt so violated in all my many coloured days; I would have been less wounded had he taken a wrought iron skillet pan to my head. The memory has bought bile to my very lips and my face aches with the severe contortion of my features as I type this review. At the very earliest opportunity I threw that abhorrent spray in the trash. I do not speak with jest when I say should that Dirty spray stay in the house then I would not. I am a pacifist yet would feel more at ease if my partner kept a gun beneath his pillow.

I have never really enjoyed the smell (or the taste) of spearmint, I much prefer peppermint, but if you love spearmint and have ever eaten (and loved) those almost phosphorescent blue spearmint sweets that were around in the 1970s, you might enjoy this scent; but I beg of you to please never cross my path whilst wearing it unless you are prepared to unleash a demon of self defence within me that I have but little control over.

Don’t get this one if you’re prone to headaches, or really ever.
It’s very sharp and to be frank, nauseating
This starts out as if we're the base for Christian Dior's Poison kinda beautiful and then a soft spicy woody scent developed on me , I am very intrigued.

I have a bottle of the liquid EDP. I love the comforter as a bubble bar,so I was very exited about this perfume. And while it does smell a bit similar,it just doesnt have the same warmth to it. I see many people write about cat pee, licourice, bergamot and herbs, but I don't get any of that. To me,this is not layered at all. All I get is a very "thin" Black currant juice with some vanilla,and it mostly dries down to a sweet vanilla scent,and that's it. Not unpleasant at all, but very simple and child-like,to me.

I'm reviewing the body spray here. It mostly smells like blackcurrant to me. I can see where people get the cat pee from I guess, but it's only when I really think about it. I wore this a lot spring of 2020 when covid first hit the States, a very bittersweet time in many of our lives. It may have been stressful beginning to the year, but I got to spend lots more time outdoors in that bright old sun, with my partner whom I just started dating at the time, with this amazing fruity-green body spray. Every time I smell it now, it brings back those memories. I wanna buy a full bottle again some time soon for this coming season
Extremely strong, extremely sweet, black as fuck blackcurrant. No idea why anyone is talking about cats.

Folks, the 'cat pee' being smelled is coming from the black currant accord. Black currant scent profile per Fragrantica: "A tangy fruit note with a very characteristic ammoniac "cat piss" nuance sourced from green leaf buds." I despise black currant in fragrances for the very reason of that description because my nose is hypersensitive to such smells. I do find that when the fragrance pyramid indicates a scent has the leaves, the scent is more tolerable, but I still get a 'catty' undercurrent. I'm not sure why perfumers gravitate toward black currant rather than using blackberry, but I wish it would fall out of favor...

I know EXACTLY what people are talking about, when they say they can smell “cat pee”. BUT, it’s the “green” in the fragrance. If you’ve ever walked around, back in the bush, you can smell it on really hot days. It comes from the green on wild fruit, weeds, and some flowers. Some people even think it smells a little “skunky”, like a pot plant. I think their goal was to make it smell real, rather than synthetic. And they did a good job imo. Yes it’s a little “skanky”, but I actually like that. If someone is just wanting to get into some “skank” THIS is now the one I would recommend. It’s STILL fruity, but the scent really does remind me of a hot, and sweaty day in the sun. So it’s a LITTLE dirtyISH, but not really!?!?
up for swap,pm me if u are interested

Bought the solid and yeah, cat pee. Thought I'd try it anyway in case my nose was just being crazy and it smelled all weird and herb-ish on top of the pee smell.

Really hate Lush's "limited edition" shenanigans because the ebayers are killing me.

Anyone know how to get rid of the pee smell? Melt it down maybe?

Because the Comforter bubble bar and lotion, and the "You Snap the Whip" all smelled fantastic!

Edit: Just bought a bottle of the liquid -that arrived broken all to hell, but managed to save maybe a third of it- and while it is really, really sweet smelling I'm still getting hint of cat pee. Wtf is up with this perfume? The liquid isn't nearly as bad as the solid, but damn. Something in this is ruining the scent.

I have the solid version of this fragrance. It is a bit licorice-like at first, but then it develops into something creamy, fruity, and soft. I am a huge bergamot fan, and I do get a bit of that. I enjoy this fragrance, but it doesn't last all day. Since it is a solid, I can toss it in my purse to refresh, though. I can't comment on the liquid version, sadly.

I blind bought this online in 2012 during the Lush forum special sale that year (I say that in order to establish that the perfume was fresh, presumably no issues with it). I got a very strong cat urine odor with it, just nothing but cat pee -- some other reviews on the web say this as well. I wish I'd sought out more reviews before buying it, oh well. It's definitely one to try before you buy.

This is the same scent of Lush's best selling bubble bar.

I love it! There's a liquorice accord to it which i love (Try Lush's 'Lord of the Goathorn' if you're also a liquorice fan!) as well as the blackcurrants mmmm :)

I was lucky enough to buy a few bottles of this at the Gorilla pop up shop at the Edinburgh Fringe Festival last year.

product_name: Dad's Garden Chamomile And Honeysuckle Lush
review_content: i smelled this once in store and it was actual genuine piss. not even a hint of floral just straight PISS i had to leave the storw and wash it off of my wrist. i simply couldnt do it. i never have reactions like that to bad scents but it was just that bad. and i love lush too ):

product_name: Dad's Garden Chamomile And Honeysuckle Lush
review_content: I was so hopeful of this because of the chamomile but this is a super indolic, a bit pissy jasmine scent with insane strength

product_name: Dad's Garden Chamomile And Honeysuckle Lush
review_content: Smells strongly of urine to both my partner and me, I had to wash it off.

product_name: Dad's Garden Chamomile And Honeysuckle Lush
review_content:
This is exactly what it's name says. I get no other florals and no citruses. It's a perfect, clean impression of both honeysuckle and chamomile. They blend beautifully while remaining distinct.
Very, very, light for Lush, this could easily be used as body spray. (It's certainly lighter than a lot of their body sprays.)

product_name: Dad's Garden Chamomile And Honeysuckle Lush
review_content:
On me this smells very natural, realistic and light. For people saying the opening is giving urine, just get through the first 5 minutes and then you'll arrive at a girl next door and effortless vibe.
It has no throw unfortunately and you'd have to hug me to smell anything

product_name: Dad's Garden Chamomile And Honeysuckle Lush
review_content: i cant stand the piss smell

product_name: Dad's Garden Chamomile And Honeysuckle Lush
review_content:
I have a hard time finding floral perfumes that aren't heavy, sultry, and/or earthy which I dislike. This perfume is beautiful, and perfect for spring and summer. I absolutely love it!

If you're looking for a pretty and very feminine perfume without smelling synthetic this is a great one. I'm no good at describing notes, but I think it leans a bit sweet which I love too! 💐

product_name: Dad's Garden Chamomile And Honeysuckle Lush
review_content:
It’s like standing in a hot and humid, green and dewy flower garden while the sun beams down on you.

Then you piss all over it.

Then the piss dries and you are left with straight chamomile for the remainder of fragrance with hints of the green stem.

One of the few fragrances I actively dislike, that piss vibe is hard to ignore, and I typically really like chamomile as a note. 2/10

I have now unintentionally and unfortunately completed the list of “fragrances that smell like things that come out of my body.”

product_name: Dad's Garden Chamomile And Honeysuckle Lush
review_content:
-Seems innocuous enough at first: green, tart, fresh scent... then the chamomile hits hard.
-There's this off-putting a cat piss vibe to it. Big NOPE. (-)

product_name: Dad's Garden Chamomile And Honeysuckle Lush
review_content: This is a very comfortable, soothing scent to be in. Yet its not boring. Be aware, the first few minutes bring up the cat pee edge of chamomile but this smooths down after a while, allowing for the honeysuckle / white florals to come through. Something very innocent about this scent, like a summer meadow in your childhood. Its heading to winter as I am writing this, will be lovely to revisit this scent in the spring / warmer weather.

product_name: Dad's Garden Chamomile And Honeysuckle Lush
review_content: Cheery pretty Springtime floral. Prominent lavender and chamomile gives way to white florals and waxy-plasticky-fruity 'Lush' smell. The drydown smells like something from my childhood but I couldn't say what. Nice and happy.

product_name: Dad's Garden Chamomile And Honeysuckle Lush
review_content:
This is really beautiful, hazy, ashy, soft green and sweet scent. Yes it’s sweet, not synthetic sweet, It’s a realistic chamomile and honeysuckle sweet, but nothing offputting. The green edge and hazy-ness balance it out. It also has a bit floral milky, some nameless wild flowers that give soft milky scent. It’s serene and very comforting to wear in summer.


Updated on June 21, 2022:
The astringent, almost clinical edge from chamomile gives a sense of cleanliness, it cuts through the heat. I’m saddened to learn that this has been discontinued.

product_name: Dad's Garden Chamomile And Honeysuckle Lush
review_content: I love this scent. It was a blind buy for me and I was really anxious because it is a bit pricey, but it worked out! While I also love Demeter’s Honeysuckle, this is not it. Demeter’s is a bright, light honeysuckle. This perfume also smells like honeysuckle, but a beautiful, deep, syrupy honeysuckle, with a dash of chamomile to ground it. Would it smell ‘sickly sweet’ to some, like a commenter mentioned below, but also smell beautifully syrupy to me? Sure, why not! It all depends on what you like. For what it’s worth, my husband who does not like florals smelled this on me immediately after I sprayed it and loved it, asked me right away what it was! The longevity and sillage is not bad, people will definitely smell this as you walk by!

product_name: Dad's Garden Chamomile And Honeysuckle Lush
review_content:
I requested a sample of this from the Lush UK website and they were awesome and set me a squirt of it on a card. It wasn't ...too unpleasant (at least on the card), but it is definitely WHITE FLORAL. I really didn't pick up any chamomile, which what I was hoping would be more dominant. Sweetish. But not for me. So glad I asked for a sample before I paid!

I'll stick with Lush's Black Pearl and Demeter's Chamomile Tea for my chamomile scent needs.

product_name: Dad's Garden Chamomile And Honeysuckle Lush
review_content: Reminds me of an indolic honeysuckle if that makes sense and lasts long.

product_name: Dad's Garden Chamomile And Honeysuckle Lush
review_content:
This is my least favourite of the Volume 3 range.

It is a very sickly sweet floral. Screeches at me when I smell it. Not for me.

If you love Honeysuckle definitely try this! Don't let my opinion put you off.

product_name: Let The Good Times Roll Lush
review_content: First spray is very strong in alcohol but it quickly dries down to a sweet, cozy, sugary scent. It smells like soft salted caramel to me, not popcorn. But I don't really associate caramel to popcorn in the first place, so...? It's really sweet, but not as strong as Sticky Dates. I love sweet scents!!! I love this!!!!

product_name: Let The Good Times Roll Lush
review_content: For gourmand lovers only. You can genuinely smell the butter—it’s like hot, fresh, almost wet, buttery cinema popcorn. The sillage and performance are enormous; this is a true monster. I do feel the new formulation has a bit too much alcohol, so something has definitely changed, which I’m not a fan of, but it’s another one that will forever stay in my collection. It gets mixed reactions—some people can’t stand it—but that’s no surprise to me, as I adore thick, ultra-sweet fragrances.

product_name: Let The Good Times Roll Lush
review_content: Caramel is aggressive and smells artificial. The scent wasn’t really of popcorn, just a sweet, artificial corn smell. Kind of nauseating.

product_name: Let The Good Times Roll Lush
review_content: i couldn’t even go near this in summer. it was sickeningly sweet. definitely cold weather scent.

product_name: Let The Good Times Roll Lush
review_content: i guess in a way im grateful i blind bought this because...wow i hate caramel! this is one trillion percent caramel and super sickly to my nose :( just like lush perfumes has looooong legs ... the longest in the world probably and really good projection, if i liked caramel this would be perf but WOW I HATE THIS !

product_name: Let The Good Times Roll Lush
review_content:
It starts off smelling like rubbing alcohol for about 10 minutes, after that it smells like buttery popcorn and sugar and to me fades into a weak toffee scent
The longevity of this perfume is demonic!! , I wore it on my jumper for an exam, lost the jumper and found it again 6 months later, it still retained the smell
8/10

product_name: Let The Good Times Roll Lush
review_content: Smells like sickly sweet buttery candy, with a hint of mint. Almost like peppermint bark. Sadly its too powerful for me, but I can see how other people would love it.

product_name: Let The Good Times Roll Lush
review_content: I think i got a bad one or something. Ive had it for a year and its always had a hint of white vinegar that just overpowers everything else

product_name: Let The Good Times Roll Lush
review_content:
Just picked up bottle #2 of this rummy, creamy, super-strong and long-lasting olfactory perfection.

This will always be in my collection!

product_name: Let The Good Times Roll Lush
review_content: SO MANY COMPLIMENTS!!! My teacher who wasn’t even in the room yet said he could smell me while he was walking in the hallways into my classroom lol. Definitely recommend buying :)

product_name: Let The Good Times Roll Lush
review_content: I see some of the reviews about this smelling like alcohol, and for the initial spray, I would agree with this. BUT, wait! After a few seconds, that caramel, buttery, sweet smell will override that alcoholic smell. I don't know if Lush can address this aspect of the formula, but it doesn't deter me from purchasing and loving this body spray. It has projection and longevity. I feel like for a gourmand, it's a sweet but fresh. I don't know if that makes sense, but it's an overall sweet scent that isn't overly photorealistic or nauseating. I hope this smell does not go away!!

product_name: Let The Good Times Roll Lush
review_content: It's too much but I love it, at the same time I feel like I have a migraine from it, the top notes is just intense burt caramel, but the dry down gets better almost lactonic, great silage and long lasting as in all lush perfumes, But I'm going to get sick of this one soon.

product_name: Let The Good Times Roll Lush
review_content:
I originally really loved this perfume, it was exactly what I wanted. For some reason though, after using it for a month, I suddenly couldn't stand it anymore. It was so overwhelming and smelled way too much like alcohol, even after letting it air out. With a heavy heart, I sadly hat to throw it away :(
Maybe I just got unlucky...

product_name: Let The Good Times Roll Lush
review_content: It's... fine, but too similar to Yog Nog and Sticky Dates for it to exist. If you like to layer the two, you get basically this.

product_name: Let The Good Times Roll Lush
review_content: Listen... I have no idea what sorcery LUSH put in this body spray. I only sprayed 3 sprays. I left my room and came back, and I could smell it from 6 feet away. This is definitely strong, projects well, and is very long-lasting; however, I do not suggest more than 3-4 sprays because it can be a bit nauseating for some and others around you. It lasted 20 hours on my skin, absolutely insane. I love the smell too it's sweet, caramelish, and a bit like candy. It's not spicy, it's simply sweet and creamy.
