product_name: Let The Good Times Roll Lush
review_content: 😂😂😂😂😂😂😂 yall are such liars. or maybe my nose is broken at this point. it doesn’t smell bad at all i’m just confused as to where the caramel cinnamon rolls and yada yada that Tiktok told me this smells like are

product_name: Let The Good Times Roll Lush
review_content: I expected this to be really close to sol de Janeiro 71 but unfortunately it isn't. They definitely have similar elements yet they are so different. This is for the gourmand girlies. I sprayed this on me and 5 seconds later my mom asked if she forgot the stove on because it smells like burnt sugar, lol and this is exactly how I would describe the scent. I get the cinnamon faintly. The more I smell it, the more I like it.

product_name: Let The Good Times Roll Lush
review_content: Sticky, salty caramel that lasts forever and can kind of make me nauseous if I'm not careful, not unlike the kettle corn this scent calls to mind for me. I want more popcorn, this is straight salted caramel to me. The lotion smells more popcorn-y though!

product_name: Let The Good Times Roll Lush
review_content: a more faint and savory 71. starts off smelling like straight butter and cheese, then dries into a caramel-y popcorn type. very light

product_name: Let The Good Times Roll Lush
review_content:
this is AMAZINGGGGG. I will say that the lasting power and sillage is not as good as people are making it out to be. I ordered online and I've seen some people say that those batches are different so maybe that's why i feel it's a bit weaker?? For reference, I find that my sticky dates is stronger than this.

To put it frankly, this smells like straight up vanilla buttercream. There's nothing else. I don't get any popcorn or cinnamon or whatever tf (which tbf i was initially disappointed about), but this to me is the sweetest icing/buttercream esque fragrance I own and I am obsessed. I can see why people think it's too sweet, but I just have a problem lmao.

It also smells NOTHING like cheirosa 71 because that has a nuttiness to it, and this is straight up sugary frosting. So you can totally buy both.

product_name: Let The Good Times Roll Lush
review_content: I smelt this in the shop and I don’t get the hype. I definitely got the popcorn but it just smelt burnt…. The dry down also had a strong medicinal smell which my bf agreed with.

product_name: Let The Good Times Roll Lush
review_content: a little sweet and savoury balance, but too sweet to wear on me. a good room/bed spray

product_name: Let The Good Times Roll Lush
review_content: Smells like freshly baked cinnamon rolls with butter. I don't get popcorn from this 👽🤘🏻

product_name: Let The Good Times Roll Lush
review_content:
i went into lush today and sprayed around 8 things on me and now i smell amazing and don’t know which scent exactly do i love.. or all of them? my bf thinks this one is that smells amazing

these lush body sprays are so incredible

product_name: Let The Good Times Roll Lush
review_content:
Very yummy caramel scent. Whenever i put this on my grandmother asks me “who is making chai” or “it is smelling like Chai”. It does smell like the caramelization of sugar in milk when making chai
Hehe makes me love it even more

product_name: Let The Good Times Roll Lush
review_content: i love this, i think i wore this on its own for a week as i was out and didn’t want to bring any perfumes and it lasted ages. sprayed it at some time in the morning/early afternoon and it lasted until night time. it’s warm with some lactonic bits here and there but it’s so nice, i almost get warm caramel popcorn it’s very similar to 71 sdj

product_name: Let The Good Times Roll Lush
review_content:
Dont know if i got a "bad" batch.... I don't even wanna call it that because I can smell what the fragrance is TRYING to be. But I just can't see how anyone can wear this on themselves...

I've resulted to using this AND Sticky Dates as a room spray... and even as that, I'd prefer a Glade air freshener. I do give it points for being long lasting. The remnant smell of this in my room smells really food! Key word: remnant....

I was looking for Cheirosa 71... yummy caramel popcorn. The opening is heavy candy or something. Maybe just my bottle but the smell hasn't changed for months. :(

product_name: Let The Good Times Roll Lush
review_content: Sweet, cozy, and super nostalgic. It’s one of those really comforting, gourmand scents that sticks to your skin and clothes all day long. I was obsessed with it at first, but if you use it too often, it can start to feel a bit too much and kind of make you sick of it. The packaging is honestly pretty ugly to me. But the scent itself is pure comfort.

product_name: Let The Good Times Roll Lush
review_content: I love gourmand, but this just smells like caramelized popcorn. Sadly, not my cup of tea, everybody loves this fragrance but it’s just too complex in an unsettling way. Popcorn kinda smells similar to pee, so I don’t really want people to think I smell like caramelized piss :(

product_name: Let The Good Times Roll Lush
review_content: This is a gourmand lover’s dream! But it’s not just cloyingly sweet like Sticky Dates,it’s much more complex. The salty note from popcorn and the buttery creaminess add depth, and hours later it settles into a scent that reminds me of caramel body lotion. Honestly, why pay for Bianco Latte when you can get this for a fraction of the price? If you’re building a gourmand collection, this one definitely deserves a spot.It’s also incredibly long lasting probably the most enduring fragrance I’ve ever worn. That said, I wouldn’t go beyond three sprays. And it’s certainly not for blind buying,the scent is bold, distinctive, and something you’ll either love or find overwhelming. For some, it might even be a bit nauseating due to its intensity.

product_name: Let The Good Times Roll Lush
review_content: This is such a fun fragrance. It's a better version of SDJ 71. The "minty" quality makes this not disgusting, and cinnamon makes it more dimentional. The butter note is not overbearing. Better than the Yog Nog spray. I can't stand the Sticky dates scent, but this is amazing to me. It's a spicy buttery vanilla to me. I don't get a lot of caramel, it's like a whisper of caramel. Absolutely worth the money.

product_name: Let The Good Times Roll Lush
review_content: Smells so similar to Shagaf Oud Vanilla Toffee but less intense. I think it's okay, but it is not something I was expecting. It is not creamy or buttery, and very sweet. The cinnamon note is very strong on my skin. The opening is so headache-inducing, I think it is because of the alcohol+cinnamon note, which almost smells like liquor. The dry down is okay, it smelled like cinnamon-y/herby caramel syrup. I don't get the caramel popcorn vibes, which is so sad because I really want to like this😭

product_name: Let The Good Times Roll Lush
review_content: Buttered caramel in a spray bottle!

product_name: Let The Good Times Roll Lush
review_content: Very strong - 2 sprays still linger on my skin even after washing. Smells strange, nothing like popcorn: a little bit salty and sweet, but I don’t get the overall image. If you’re craving something sweet, try Sticky Dates - straight forward burnt/smoked caramel, maple syrup

product_name: Let The Good Times Roll Lush
review_content: literally smells exactly like caramel popcorn. i don’t like popcorn but I love caramel, so I feel eh about it

product_name: Let The Good Times Roll Lush
review_content: No need a perfume version of this because LONGEVITY IS ETERNAL and sillage is also very strong!!! I got countless compliments wearing this and these were not only from my friends, from strangers also. (I remember getting compliments from random people 5-6 times a day) Smells like a very sweet, gourmand buttery caramel, I love the way it smells VERY ADDICTIVE

product_name: Let The Good Times Roll Lush
review_content: I fell in love with this scent the moment I smelled it! So buttery, caramel-y and sweet, absolutely perfect for gourmand lovers. If you’re not a fan of lactonic notes you may not be a fan of this one though. Definitely get soft popcorn notes, smells like a candy shop that also sells popcorn! I think this will smell even better on me in the fall and winter. Get this!!!

product_name: Let The Good Times Roll Lush
review_content:
This perfume has the projection of a man's audacity - so wide ranged and invasively present, BUT what separates them is that this is pleasant and very much welcome!

Initial spray is introducing itself as a caramelized buttery popcorn (similar to Werther's caramel popcorns). What this perfume needs is time and patience (hence my first comparison) since after settling on your skin it turns into this beautiful, appetite-growing gourmand sillage that is almost photo-realistic melted sugar with buttery cream added into the process. Usually caramel fragrances tend to fall on the heavy side that clocks my alveoli (i.e. Candy by Prada or Cheirosa 71') but this one is super well blended that it comes off extremely smooth. I sprayed only 2 times on my wrist (which isn't a reliable placement for testing due to body temperature I know) but as I walked around the city the fragrance found it's way into my nostrils and it was still with me the next day!

The longevity is as strong as this one guy's will to add unsolicited commentary in my lecture every two minute- so pretty long lasting as you can imagine! And thus it's strictly a winter fragrance or specifically for cold days.

And plus points for also being a repellent against men who leaves comments on gourmand perfumes (and by comment I mean just straight up hating on women for liking a fragrance group) even though they loathe gourmands, thanks Lush for this 2-in-1 perfume!

product_name: Let The Good Times Roll Lush
review_content: Super delicious scent that gave me so many compliments from both men and women. Great price for how long it lasts too because you only need to spray once or twice as it’s very strong and long lasting. Definitely a colder month scent as in the heat I can imagine it would get quite sickly. Smells like caramel, super sweet and buttery. A great staple gourmand when I want to smell like a dessert. My boyfriend is obsessed with this one and I’m definitely going to repurchase now that I’m out!

product_name: Let The Good Times Roll Lush
review_content: I was gonna leave a review but since @DinoPal said it’s for women who don’t know about perfume, I decided not to. 🤗♥️

product_name: Let The Good Times Roll Lush
review_content: Thank God you are here to enlighten us …

product_name: Let The Good Times Roll Lush
review_content: Parfume for women who know nothing about parfume.

product_name: Let The Good Times Roll Lush
review_content:
sprayed this like 3 times in store and smelt it all day and it was phenomenal. I didn’t get the popcorn scent at first but I can def smell it now. I would use this for layering but I can see how it would be too much on its own cause it permeates a lot.
also worth noting that my first time wearing it I got like 4 separate compliments

product_name: Let The Good Times Roll Lush
review_content: Big fan of this one. To me it smells like salt, popcorn, and caramel. It can be very strong and overpowering, definitely do not spray more than 3 times. I like layering with other scents when I’m not in the mood for a super intense gourmand.

product_name: Let The Good Times Roll Lush
review_content:
Something about this body spray smells funky to me. It’s definitely an over the top sweet caramel buttery gourmand, but it almost has some kind of rancid undertone to it that always throws it off for me. It’s like a sweet caramel cheesecake that’s gone bad. Maybe it’s just me but every time I wear this I just feel like there’s some ick factor to it. Sad because it would smell amazing otherwise.

I also absolutely hate the bottle because it sprays a TON out and this fragrance is easy to overspray, IMO. I poured it into a different bottle that sprays less out so I can control how much I’m wearing.

product_name: Let The Good Times Roll Lush
review_content: Someone said it smells like mint tictacs and its so true! I was expecting a cake battery warm sweet vanilla but it smells exactly like mint tictacs instead. When you first eat them before you get to the minty inside, there's this vanilla, mint, weird taste; thats what this is. I absolutely love super milk, but I don't always have my hair down and it doesn't stay as long on my hair as it does for many of my other friends. I want a gourmand scent thats beautiful, sweet, non oriental but also projects like an absolute beast. This my friends is not it.

product_name: Let The Good Times Roll Lush
review_content: One of the best fragrances in my whole life. It does NOT smell like popcorn, nor Sol de Cheriosa 71 which smells like booze pistachios and hangover puke to me lol, nor a lick of cinnamon, nor even caramel to me. It smells like yummy buttery vanilla marshmallow cotton candy. It is so beautiful smelling. I had gone in to try Sticky Dates which I smelled on a girl doing the samples at TJs and luckily asked her what it was. The Lush employee sprayed S D on a paper, then this on a paper. I couldn't stop smelling this one so I had her spray 2 sprays on my arm. I left then went to another store fully exoecting ut to dissapear like 99% of all fragrances do on my dry desert like skin. But nah mane. I kept getting whiffs of buttery vanilla cotton candy. It's still just as strong as the minute I left the store and it's hours later. I was like YES! ugh after years of searching I found the ONE. It smells like a very very dry version of Eilish without the mint aftersmell and add lots and lots of butter and a dab of cotton candy. I'm so very happy. I wish they would come out with a cotton candy version too that's heavy on the cotton candy. If any of you don't want your LTGTR, please do contact me right away. <3

product_name: Let The Good Times Roll Lush
review_content:
This is amazing. This is what I what I thought angels share would be when people said it smells like a cinnamon roll (I heard apple pie and cinnamon roll and got neither)

This smells like a delicious cinnamon roll on my skin! When it dries down I get a bit more cinnamon than I did in the opening but I love that, it rounds it out nicely. Heads up it’s SUPER sweet! But I’m a way I can tolerate so it’s a love for me!

10/10 I will purchase!

product_name: Let The Good Times Roll Lush
review_content: i have such a love hate relationship with this fragrance... genuinely one of the most photorealistic caramel popcorn scents i think i've EVER smelt. it's buttery, it's sweet, it's salty, it's literally everything i thought i'd want in a fragrance... BUT. i've come to realize that sometimes, longevity and photorealistic scents don't always go well together. this stuff is soo powerful and lasts so long to the point where it becomes nauseating occasionally. i like using it as a bedtime spray/room spray, but i don't think i could ever wear it out. i personally prefer cheirosa '71 for a more wearable caramelly buttery popcorn scent.

product_name: Let The Good Times Roll Lush
review_content:
i wish i liked this...for the first 5 minutes after i sprayed it, i was amazed with how nice it smelled...but after that it became so strong and way too sweet (even for me as a gourmand lover) that i felt very sick. im glad i got a decant first because this is really, really sickeningly strong and i can not stand it
Now for the smell, i think it smells ok but i wish it was more on the caramel side, it really does smell like caramel popcorn 100%

I will stay away from this one...maybe i will like something else from this house

product_name: Let The Good Times Roll Lush
review_content: doesn’t smell like popcorn but it’s weird. i bought in store and it smelled exactly as notes describe i loved it but when i got it home straight bug spray/moth balls. idk where im pulling that scent from but i can’t even picture how my fragrance and the one i smelt in store are the same.

product_name: Let The Good Times Roll Lush
review_content: I just got this spray after testing it in the store last week. I was walking around the shops and I could smell it on me for hours, I was obsessed with how I smelt. Then I went home and looked at some reviews on it before I bought it, and I was getting thrown off by people saying it smells like popcorn. I do not like that smell and don't want to smell like popcorn. So I was hesitant to buy it but so happy I ordered it as it just smells like a warm, caramel butter dessert! I don't get much cinnamon or popcorn at all which I'm sooooo happy about. It smells like condensed milk and caramel syrup and I couldn't have wanted anything more.

product_name: Let The Good Times Roll Lush
review_content:
Honestly one of my favourite perfumes. I bought this as a blind buy due to the insanely low price point - which I have never done before - and it paid off immensely. I am a huge fan of vanilla type perfumes and was expecting a very generic flat vanilla scent I could use to maybe layer other perfumes (similar to solinotes vanilla) but was very pleasantly surprised to find that this worked as a full perfume on its own. Although this is a cheap perfume it does not have the cheap smell I sense a lot from bath and body works or lush scents. Overall has a delectable caramel, sweet sugar smell that projects insanely well and lasts forever but doesn’t smell too generic or cheap. Insane.

This has gotten me an immense number of compliments from both men and women, people adore it - both the people I live with thought I was baking cookies when they got home after I sprayed this! Knowing this, I would highly recommend this to gourmand lovers but would VERY strongly discourage this to those who aren’t.

I find it wears significantly better in the winter where it gives off a rich warmth, compared to the summer where it smells slightly sticky and heavy. I still wear it because it’s still nice, but it definitely isn’t a go-to summer scent.

product_name: Let The Good Times Roll Lush
review_content: The Lush body sprays are great because they're SO strong, you won't even need a perfume. I adore this one, but it does smell very sweet, almost straight up sugar, so if that isn't your thing, you won't love this.

product_name: Let The Good Times Roll Lush
review_content: Really confusing scent...initial spray is overwhelming, and has a plasticky note to it that makes it unpleasant, but after a few hours it settles and smells incredible, like to the point where you would want to eat yourself. I can see why everyone loves this but how do they get past the first spray???

product_name: Let The Good Times Roll Lush
review_content: first initial spray is too popcorny, but once it settles it becomes a really nice, sweet caramel scent. it’s very strong and lasts a while.

product_name: Let The Good Times Roll Lush
review_content:
I used to like it more. It’s still a nice scent, but there’s something in it that smells too alcoholic and slightly sour to my nose. I can’t quite define it, but I’ve noticed the same note in Sticky Dates as well.
That said, it does get better with time — if you have the patience to wait, it eventually turns into a pleasant caramel.

product_name: Let The Good Times Roll Lush
review_content: It starts off with a strong alcohol scent, but as it dries down, it turns into a delicious, milky caramel popcorn scent. On me, it projects moderately but it performs really well. I can get 6-7 hours on my skin, and it lasts even longer on clothes. Overall, it’s a cute and soothing caramel-milky fragrance. I'd definitely repurchase considering the price and longevity.

product_name: Let The Good Times Roll Lush
review_content:
I can smell sourness.. just tiny. But overall it’s sweet caramelized creamy buttery popcorn, it’s light but not too light, so I can wear it in the summer and it’s sweet enough to wear it in cooler weather. It is a “cute” scent not childish. it's edible, yummy 🍿🤤
Projecting not a lot but the longevity is freaking long… like 8+ hrs so amazing for just a body spray.
I LOVE IT.

product_name: Let The Good Times Roll Lush
review_content:
I smelled this on someone in my home gym and it just filled up the place.

Me and someone I was with both noticed it and we said it smelled like Lucky Charms 😂. This really is a nice fragrance and is very sweet and vanilla like.

Might have to get this!

product_name: Let The Good Times Roll Lush
review_content: The spray does smell like a more intense but also less complex version SDJ 71 but the lotion straight up smells like cat piss. Big nope on the lotion.

product_name: Let The Good Times Roll Lush
review_content: This can be very headache inducing as it can be cloying it’s very strong and has an off putting burnt plastic kinda smell but as long as you wear it in cooler weather and don’t overspray ig it has a similarish base to 71 cheirosa

product_name: Let The Good Times Roll Lush
review_content: I interpret two sorts of scents from this. Firstly, it smells like alcohol - not the type perfumes are made of, but booze. It smells like rum or Brandy - it has the sweetness of the caramel which is rounded out by the warmth of the booziness. The smooth, sweet notes remind me of the booziness of rum raisin ice-cream. The other scent I get is reminiscent of a more sweet ice-cream. The creamy, buttery richness reminds me of caramel ice-cream or milkshake. It's sweet and decadent, indulgent but not cloying. My boyfriend really loves this - he sprayed my bottle on himself and I was getting more of the icecreamy-ness on him. Unlike Sticky Dates which I feel is too sickingly sweet, this is more of a balanced sweetness. I really like this one :)

product_name: Let The Good Times Roll Lush
review_content: ive definitely posted a review before but over time my opinion keeps changing! after experimenting a bit more with layering and routines, honestly this is my favourite scent ever. it smells like a salted caramel milkshake and is so versatile when it comes to layering. i’ve been layering it with sweet tooth caramel dream and UGH it’s delicious. i spray it just once on my pjs before bed and i wake up smelling milky sweet and my sheets smell so edible. i love it.

product_name: Let The Good Times Roll Lush
review_content:
what a charming day if I wake up with this
I love this
I want a new one every time I run out
this is the best scent I've smelled
something that is gourmand and basic as caramel and vanilla
something that is affordable to replace
something that has a personality
something that PROJECTS and LASTSSSSSSSSSSSSSS
despite being a man it doesn't feel so wrong to wear it , it smells like food not floral
I will use this even if the weather is at 50c


im just triggered that the price is way cheaper in UK about 50% gap

product_name: Let The Good Times Roll Lush
review_content: Maybe i got a bad batch but this is disgustingly pungent. Pure alcohol, mint and black coffee.. if you smell hard enough you may find a slight vanilla in the background, but that’s a reach.

product_name: Let The Good Times Roll Lush
review_content:
Laissez les bons temps rouler my man, this fragrance is so good I just want to bathe in a cloud of it. I was a little concerned that, being a body mist, it would have a pitiful staying power but actually it lasts about forever on clothes. Well done Lush.

It reminds me of the (discontinued?) popcorn lip scrub. That was delicious...

product_name: Let The Good Times Roll Lush
review_content:
A perfect caramel, popcorn scent.

Be super careful not to overspray as it’s super strong and can be a little overpowering!
In my opinion it’s suited much more to winter time, as it’s a little too sickly for the summertime.

The lasting power is incredible and I can smell this on clothes for days after I’ve sprayed.

product_name: Let The Good Times Roll Lush
review_content: I love it deliciously creamy caramel aroma,accented by subtle hints of cinnamon. I don't find the scent too overpowering, !Initially, I compared it to the strong scent of sticky dates at the first spray, like a burnt sugar so strong but then I decided to chose the let the good times roll i don’t smell the popcorn 🍿 though

product_name: Let The Good Times Roll Lush
review_content:
Tried this at a lush store while I was looking for sticky dates, and while being almost repulsed by the overwhelming sweetness of sticky dates, LTGTR smelt perfect!! its definitely not delicate and an very strong fragrance (I sprayed it once on my wrist and smelt it on me the next day after a shower). But it smells so good and probably one of my favourite gourmands; sooo lactonic and sweet.
Also people who are saying this smells like Cheirosa '71 are lowkey lying

product_name: Let The Good Times Roll Lush
review_content: It’s very sweet and strong. Lasts a long time. I love it🩷

product_name: Let The Good Times Roll Lush
review_content: I went to the store to return Sticky Date as it wasn't what i was expecting. So I tried out few fragrances they have in the store, and this was one of them. I'm surprised no one mention LTGTR has a very sour opening and quite off putting, but if you were able to go pass that short lived sourness, you would get this very sweet caramel scent that i was looking for in Sticky Date. I was too scared of that sourness so i didnt end up purchase it

product_name: Let The Good Times Roll Lush
review_content: smells like a warm lactonic caramel sugar cookie, no other wayto describe it. I hate the ugly bottle and agressive spray though so I transferred it to a different bottle. Lasts super long on clothes especially and you can smell it on yourself, amazing sillage.

product_name: Let The Good Times Roll Lush
review_content:
creamy, punching sweet, you will smell like a walking candy! perfect for winter time, it keeps you cozy.
i always sprayed my furry coat and felt like a cookie.

product_name: Let The Good Times Roll Lush
review_content: I love this sweet beautiful scent so much I have been wearing it all Australian summer. In Perth, mind you. It’s HOT. But I can’t get enough of this delectable body mist. When I tell you this lasts me DAYS please believe me. It lasts so much on my skin that I need to scrub in the shower at the end of the day. I can still smell it when I’m taking my clothes out of the bottom of the wash basket at the end of the week. I have never gotten so many compliments on a body mist/perfume in my life. This is a bloody score!

product_name: Let The Good Times Roll Lush
review_content:
A delicious scent, genuinely mouth watering. I feel like it smells like a nice, old timey movie theatre that's still running in 2025 and has an arcade or something.

It STICKS. I've worn this all day from 7am to midnight and still had it lingering on me. It dries down at this point a little bitter and almost more fruity, but it's not unpleasant and I enjoy it.

product_name: Let The Good Times Roll Lush
review_content: BEAST mode oh wow. tried this on in lush before work thinking mmm yum this will be nice! but as my shift went on, it just kept getting stronger and more cloying. the best i can describe is that’s it’s THICK and WARM. smelling this for 8 hours was like wearing a winter jacket in a heated room for 8 hours. it’s objectively a pleasant and VERY SWEET scent, caramel and cinnamon heavy, but u definitely have to be in the mood to smell that for the rest of the day otherwise it’s sickening. everyone in your vicinity will be able to smell it too.

product_name: Let The Good Times Roll Lush
review_content: Sweet creamy and buttery and smells a bit like strawberry shortcake to my nose it’s beast mode and lasts ages on skin and clothing

product_name: Let The Good Times Roll Lush
review_content:
This is strong. It lasts for days and smells like caramel cotton candy. I like it for super cold days if I’ll be outside. I smelled it on my daughter’s jacket a week later. I’m not a gourmand fan, but this reminds me of Halloween and fall happy times. It’s super cold today, I’ve had it in my car, just sprayed a little and it’s developed and changed. I get no mint. That was probably a bad batch. When you first receive, it smells like caramel popcorn, let it sit for weeks and it’s like caramel cotton candy. Whoever said it doesn’t last, I have hyper momma nose, I can smell this a mile away. Don’t over spray. It’s a comforting fall scent. Great for camp fires.

I normally wear lavender, cedar and citrus scents. I never buy sweet gourmand. I do like the cotton candy smell only when it’s super cold.

product_name: Let The Good Times Roll Lush
review_content: Very strong, at first it smelled like caramel and candy but after a few months it kind of smells like overly sweet play dough? kind of cloying, wouldn't purchase again. don't blind buy

product_name: Let The Good Times Roll Lush
review_content: so I bought this body spray and it doesn't smell like caramel popcorn or any sweet in general it smells like a hospital and medication and some mint in the background and I can sense a little sweetness but it doesn't long because it smells horrible but it lasts like three hours and people are saying it lasts a whole day and it smells amazing but in my situation it doesn't smell amazing at all and it doesn't last as advertised and I wouldn't recommend this body spray or any of the other lush products to anyone because I've seen a lot of talking about lush products that the scent or the longevity or sillage Isn't as good as people say and its so overpriced for what i got. 0/10

product_name: Let The Good Times Roll Lush
review_content: so basically this is a gourmands lovers dream. it is lactonic caramelly sweet with a hint of bitterness of the caramel. I hate gourmands and all of my fragrances are " your skin but better " scents so this is an unusual purchase for me, I was hoping for the salty buttery caramel as everyone mentioned on TikTok but now left with the nauseating sweetness of the caramel.

product_name: Let The Good Times Roll Lush
review_content: Smells like Caramel & Vanilla. The gourmand to end all gourmands. Beast projection and the sprayer is literally like being doused with a firehose. All that to say I am usually not a fan of overly sweet notes, but this has a richness that I love and outlasts many of my perfumes!

product_name: Let The Good Times Roll Lush
review_content: alot of people say it reminds them of carmelised popcorn, while others say sickingly sweet grease. whilst i would say that this reminds me of an ice cold glass of milk, dumped with vanilla extract, sugared caramel and condensed milk. while that description may not seem apetizing, it smells wonderful. a vanilla gourmand dream with a touch of caramel to create that sultry and lingering aspect of it. so good for the pice, i find that projection is crazy especially for the price and the longevity.. FOR A BODY SPRAY?! insane. i wore this on my holiday to thailand so whenever i wear this it reminds me of a holiday. anyways, its great for layering or by itself, it also becomes nicer after you let it sit for a week or 2.

product_name: Let The Good Times Roll Lush
review_content: Straight up caramel popcorn but with a synthetic undertone that disappears after a while.

product_name: Let The Good Times Roll Lush
review_content: wayyy too sweet and usually gives me a headache. ALSO comes out smelling like cat pee sometimes. i would recommend cheirosa '71 as an alternative because it smells better and is more subtle.

product_name: Let The Good Times Roll Lush
review_content: was honestly super disappointed on my first impression — however you really need to wait for the dry down. initial spray was a blast of headache inducing industrial glue which was totally disappointing with all the gourmand hype around this! however give it maybe 20-30 minutes (which is longer than i’d like lol) it becomes a very soft and beautiful caramel-vanilla scent. im not getting any kind of straight up grease or butter scent people are describing, its definitely a very sweet and edible light vanilla! totally agree with another review saying its vanilla ice cream with caramel drizzle — just overall pleasant. but it sure takes its time!

product_name: Let The Good Times Roll Lush
review_content: Why would anyone want to smell like grease?

product_name: Let The Good Times Roll Lush
review_content: the drydown is creamy vanilla essence i love it. tiktok kinda overhype this as a crazy longlasting and projecting body spray but honestly its not. but it lasted more than some EDT that i own so yup its worth the money spent. and i stopped buying BBW after trying this because BBW (recent batches) really lasted 1 hour while this can easily go 5 hours..and it is multilayered not one straight note like bbw

product_name: Let The Good Times Roll Lush
review_content: expected much more but the butter note is not good w my body chemistry. kinda gave me vinegary/burnt/sickly vibes.

product_name: Let The Good Times Roll Lush
review_content: Yeah i rlyyyyy don’t like this I wanted to love it but it smells burnt and plasticky and sickly sweet

product_name: Let The Good Times Roll Lush
review_content:
I am so disappointed!

I had read and heard so many reviews about this spray that was supposed to smell like popcorn.

This perfume absolutely does not smell like popcorn. I’m not even sure what it smells like, to be honest. Licorice?
What I do know, and what I’m certain of, is that I’m very, very disappointed. It still cost me 35 euros. And in France, you can’t return products you don’t like. Yet, I think it’s misleading to claim that this perfume smells like popcorn. Just like it’s misleading to say that Honey I Washed The Kids smells like honey.

I bought three sprays. I received them today. Let the Good Times Roll doesn’t smell like popcorn. Honey I Washed The Kids doesn’t smell like honey. And Sticky Dates smells very, very strong.

For me, this is a huge disappointment. It’s a waste of money, even if the product isn’t extremely expensive. I couldn’t test it in-store before buying it, and I regret that. Now, I don’t even want to go to the store to try Lush sprays anymore. I think I’m done with Lush sprays for good.

product_name: Let The Good Times Roll Lush
review_content: At the start, to me it smells like a cinnamony, wintery, spicy, liquorice scent, not my favourite, but after 30 minutes, it turns into a vanilla ice-cream and caramel sauce kind of scent.

product_name: Let The Good Times Roll Lush
review_content: No cuz either everyone is lying or idk, this smells sweet yes but not a warm-vanilla-cookies-caramel sweet rather a cotton candy type of sweet… also lowkey a tiny bit floral but yea. Great paired with sdj 71 at least

product_name: Let The Good Times Roll Lush
review_content: So I went to Lush to try sticky dates. Thought id like it more. But no. This! At first spray there was a nail polish scent. But it fades in like 15 seconds to vanilla brulee imo. I've been looking for this scent for some time. 20 years ago bath and body works had TUTTI DOLCE CREME BRULEE line. Has anyone else shared this experience? This shares its DNA and it's not 150 dollars for a half bottle. This stuff was back ordered so I must wait to buy tomorrow with new shipment. To me this was more vanilla bean creme brulee and sticky dates was more intense caramel.

product_name: Let The Good Times Roll Lush
review_content: reminds me of apple strudel <3

product_name: Let The Good Times Roll Lush
review_content: Yummers

product_name: Let The Good Times Roll Lush
review_content:
Before smelling this body spray I would hear people describe it to smell like buttery / caramel popcorn and I was thinking how I hate the smell of popcorn in fragrances (hence why I hate SDJ 71) so I came into smelling this with low expectations thinking I wouldn’t like it BUT I WAS SO WRONG. It did not smell like what I expected it to smell like at all. I don’t smell any popcorn in this thank god 🍿 it’s hard to explain what this exactly smells like since it’s so unique and I haven’t smelt anything like this before. To me this smells quite lactonic and you do get that buttery smell but I don’t smell any popcorn in this. It smells a tiny bit smokey and you can really smell the caramel / vanilla mainly.

I can confirm this does preform beast mode like everyone says it does and silage is really good. You will definitely get compliments with this one. This definitely deserves all the hype it gets 😋

Score: 10/10

product_name: Let The Good Times Roll Lush
review_content:
some of these reviewers must have long covid or something bc where are you smelling mint 😭😭 maybe the american one is different???
this is a caramel popcorn scent like that’s it. don’t judge it on tester paper bc i did that and it was just straight up alcohol but after a while (on paper) it dries into such a lovely warm caramel. imo this is nicer than sticky dates (and i looove sticky dates but the body spray version is just too linear for me LTGTR has more creaminess)
the longevity/sillage are actually insane i don’t know how they do it

product_name: Let The Good Times Roll Lush
review_content: Butter, caramel, and popcorn are my guilty pleasure notes so there is no way I could dislike this. Please let this be in production, Perfume gods.

product_name: Let The Good Times Roll Lush
review_content:
Edit: HOLD UP! 5hs later this beast is still STRONG! Not only that, but it developed to a lactonic caramel-y goodness!!




Am I being gaslighted, or are the notes completely wrong?

At first spray, you will be hit with a wave of watered down alcohol, almost nail polish remover-esque.
Then, a minty note will take over, finally leaving you with a fresh, and sweet floral base that has 0 gourmand value to it?.
The sillage and projection are crazy. But, it's not as advertised
Not mad at her tho!

product_name: Let The Good Times Roll Lush
review_content: It smells like peppermint bark. It specifically reminds me of doves holiday edition peppermint bark body wash but just a bit softer on the mint. At the first initial spray It's alot like it then it kinda tones down into that caramelly milky gourmand smell. But yeah I still get the hint of that body wash even after it settles down though. Overall rating: 6-7/10

product_name: Let The Good Times Roll Lush
review_content: Lush always smells like grass clippings or nauseating, nuke-level, just-got-punched-in-the-face, strange, unnaturally intense gourmand or citrus. There is no sense of demure, there is no shame. There are no mysteries, and definitely no apologies. It's just straight-up, *here's-what-the-hell-this-is* and nothing you can do about it. Thanks Lush.

product_name: Let The Good Times Roll Lush
review_content: I was so looking forward to receiving this in the mail today!! I first smelled this on someone that came by for Christmas Eve dinner. Her scent was amazing, I don't typically ask people what they're wearing when they smell good. When she told me it was "let the good times roll" I ordered it within a few days. When I sprayed this on myself..omg. the feeling of disappointment overcame as I became suffocated with the scent of pure rubbing alcohol and burnt butterscotch candies. What is going on??? I'm so sad 😞

product_name: Let The Good Times Roll Lush
review_content: I truly wanted to love this but ended up returning it. It smells SO strong and artificial, like a bath and body works concentrated room spray. To me it smells like salted caramel with cinnamon, but the artificial cinnamon is quite nauseating. I'm not sure how people spray this on themselves, however it becomes more tolerable after a few hours. I will say the staying power was great, and for the amount you get and how concentrated it is, it's worth the price if you enjoy the scent. 1 spray is more than enough.

product_name: Let The Good Times Roll Lush
review_content: im not really sure why i bought this.. smelling it in store I wasn't a huge fan, but I ended up purchasing for some reason. there is this screechy weird nail polish scent that doesn't go away for a while, and it doesn't smell that sweet to me, more heavy and buttery :( I read some reviews saying that they macerated their bottle and it smelled much better after, so I'm going to try that.. hoping it was worth the $40!

product_name: Let The Good Times Roll Lush
review_content: My favorite body spray that I use every day. Very strong, long lasting, amazing value. To me, it smells more similar to (Palmers) Cocoa butter. Been gatekeeping this one, but TikTok leaked the info lol. Definitely recommend if you like very sweet scents!

product_name: Let The Good Times Roll Lush
review_content: Al principio lo amaba! Me duraba infinito y siempre me preguntaban qué estaba usando, también cuando entraba en algún lugar la gente empezaba a intentar adivinar a que olía, es potente, lamentablemente es tanto que me hostigó y eso que a mi me gusta mucho lo dulce, quizás abusé.

product_name: Let The Good Times Roll Lush
review_content: NO. NO NO NO!!!!!!!!!!!

product_name: Let The Good Times Roll Lush
review_content: Just can’t smell it. As soon as I spray it, it disappears. If you want a caramel scent, just buy Sticky Dates.

product_name: Let The Good Times Roll Lush
review_content: super yummy and syrupy. smells just like baked goods - think pancakes/waffles. however very very strong so not for those who enjoy a lighter scent.

product_name: Let The Good Times Roll Lush
review_content: I don't know if I got a bad batch or something, but when mine came in, all I could smell was burnt plastic and this strong synthetic smell. Definitely not a safe blind buy.

product_name: Let The Good Times Roll Lush
review_content: i normally enjoy gourmands but something about this smelled bad to me and my s/o

product_name: Let The Good Times Roll Lush
review_content: I tried my best to love it but when I smelt it in store it smelt like moldy nuts with sour milk. I really wanted to enjoy this as I heard good things but it’s sadly not for me ☹️

product_name: Let The Good Times Roll Lush
review_content: it's like cheirosa 71 from sdj, but wayyyyyyyyyyyyyy better

product_name: Let The Good Times Roll Lush
review_content: i love it, smells so sweet, dont know about the butter note though, very long lasting to the extent that its sickening

product_name: Let The Good Times Roll Lush
review_content:
Funny how this scent translates so differently for everyone. To me, it opens like a freshly made tiramisu—I swear I can smell the coffee!
The second stage quickly evolves, bringing buttery, salty popcorn into the picture. As it warms on the skin, caramel and cinnamon take center stage.
The projection wraps around you like sweet, warm clouds of cozy caramel and white chocolate. Yet, up close, I still catch those buttery, salty notes.
It’s a homey, comforting scent, perfect for a Netflix Sunday snuggled in a robe with popcorn in hand. Intimate, creamy, and not too strong or overprojecting, it’s also incredibly versatile. Good choice for all seasons—it pairs beautifully with a cozy sweater in the winter or sun-kissed skin in the summer.
It's a suitable layering option for coconut, chocolate, or milky fragrances.
Lovely!

product_name: Let The Good Times Roll Lush
review_content: i love her

product_name: Let The Good Times Roll Lush
review_content: I'm not going to say I hate it because I don't, but I really don't understand where people find the popcorn notes????? does popcorn smell different in other countries?? for me this smells just very burnt sweet sugar idk it's just very very sweet. I still enjoy it but I purchased expecting more toasty/buttery/salty notes as it was described but it was just very sweet. The opening note is also too alcoholic and idk where people find lactonic vibes, I only smell sugar. it's still ok but I feel like the label and notes are very misleading.

product_name: Let The Good Times Roll Lush
review_content: I never thought my fav vanilla would be in a £20 lush body spray. I used up all 200ml in under 2 months!!!! I am in love!! She smells like vanilla, toffee and strawberry and cream candy, yknow those ones you get at the pick n mix aisle?? Try her out for sure 😍😍😍😍

product_name: Let The Good Times Roll Lush
review_content: I like this, its ok but if i put it too many days in a row i will get a reaction of vomit, i do not know ehat is about me and the vomiting because of the smell of parfumes but it gets to my gut i guess. Anyways it is overly sweet and it's ok, nothing special. I saw girls on Tik Tok making this God knows what when i reality is regular sweet body spray... nothing wow and special.

product_name: Let The Good Times Roll Lush
review_content: i think it smells like the eilish perfume this one doesn't have vanilla in it but it feels like it does idk

product_name: Let The Good Times Roll Lush
review_content: I smelt this on someone and went and bought one! The best caramel vanilla EVER and it lasts on my clothes like 2 days. I love layering this with Kayali Candy Rock 🥰. You gotta let it macerate for the perfume to last. The first few weeks it didn't last long but now it's more creamier and lasts a lot longer

product_name: Let The Good Times Roll Lush
review_content:
absolutely obsessed with this and absolutely worth the hype, lush body sprays last more than some high end perfumes. beautiful and rich caramel scent without being overly sweet; almost spicy and minty at some point and the dry down is so chocolatey on me!
i’ve been wearing it to work and everyone keeps complimenting me on it; my coworkers can smell me from a distance!
also it clings onto your clothes so it’s a perfect wardrobe spray…you’ll never stop smelling it :p

product_name: Let The Good Times Roll Lush
review_content: This smells like buttery popcorn with sugar on top. I like sweet perfumes. I’m a vanilla and caramel fan but something in this made me a little nauseous I did spray it as a bathroom freshener and it worked well for that. It didn’t work for me but I can see why people love it as an air freshener it lasted almost an entire day! Pretty impressive

product_name: Let The Good Times Roll Lush
review_content:
Ugh I love this!!
I don’t really get caramel popcorn here - but that’s okay because I do get a caramel pie crust, with just an ever so light dusting of spice, and a heaping dose of airy sweetness. It’s so delicious and sooo long lasting! Highly recommend!

product_name: Let The Good Times Roll Lush
review_content:
I love this perfume so so much!

🫧 At first spray, it smells like this milky caramel sent to me, but as it dries down, it turns to this vanilla caramel sweet scent with brown sugar dusted on top of it! It smells really good and it’s perfect for gourmand lovers!
🫧 It also lasts very long, so I really like it My mom said that I smell good and she doesn’t even like gourmands lol

product_name: Let The Good Times Roll Lush
review_content: I absolutely love this. A very realistic gourmand smell. Smells like a softer/less nutty version of SDJ 71 and lasts so good. I am gonna be honest though and say that I don’t think this smells like popcorn at all(even though that’s the main note) but I don’t mind because I never wanted to smell like popcorn either way.🥰 smells caramelly, vanilla, lactonic, VERY sweet and slightly buttery. The projection is amazing. Just one spray and you can still smell it hours later, it’s crazy. My friend wore this and the scent filled the whole room! I could smell her meters away. Definitely my new favorite💕

product_name: Let The Good Times Roll Lush
review_content: unfortunately for me, i assumed that the perfume would smell like a cinnamon roll, but apparently it’s supposed to smell like caramel popcorn. however, it doesn’t even smell like that. it just smells like really buttery popcorn sprinkled with cinnamon. the dry down is beautiful and smells far better than the initial smell — but if i wanted that smell then i’d just use whiff of a waffle cone.

product_name: Let The Good Times Roll Lush
review_content:
A photorealistic cooking fragrance. Let The Good Times Roll smells like that time when you cook and you add a lot of butter in a bowl, mix it with a mixer to make it more airy, you add sugar, a drop of vanilla essence and mix it again. That resulting smell of you mixing those ingredients, is very subtle, delicious smell, but subtle and light.
The problem is, Let The Good Times Roll smells just like that, but at an insane intensity. I think that there are some scents that are good when they are barely noticeable, becoming sickening if they were intensified. This is exactly that case.
It's a very unique, gourmand fragrance, but to me, the sugar vanilla butter is so strong that it makes me want to vomit. Even so, I understand why someone would like this body spray.

product_name: Let The Good Times Roll Lush
review_content: Smells soooooo good ! very warm and gourmand, reminds me of lattafa eclaire (vanilla and caramel dessert) but more buttery and sugary. I don't get the popcorn but at this point it doesn't matter, it really reminds me of a fluffy cake or yummy pancakes being baked in the oven in the morning. Very powerful, a blind buy success. ♡

product_name: Let The Good Times Roll Lush
review_content:
very strong, very sweet! if you do not like gourmands obviously this is not meant for you but i do think the popcorn thing is severely overblown – it just smells like salted caramel to me. definitely super festive though, i'm excited to wear it through the holiday season but im not sure how wearable it'll be if you live somewhere hot or humid. i on the other hand, WILL be wearing it to the christmas market lol.

also lasts an absolute age! my jacket still smells like it from when i first sprayed this at the store weeks ago!

product_name: Let The Good Times Roll Lush
review_content: First spray is really strange, smells like cleaning chemicals. It smells a lot nicer from 10 minutes onwards, I get a lot of the caramel and butter. I do like it but I'm not a huge fan, probably because of the popcorn note. It also smells really sweet to the point it feels synthetic (agree with someone below, there's a slight nail polish scent in there?), which I don't love.

product_name: Let The Good Times Roll Lush
review_content: More powerful than a lot of my other fragrances. It stayed two days on my skin even after showering. Amazing! It does smell like pop corn. Caramel and butter .

product_name: Let The Good Times Roll Lush
review_content: I Hope that one Will be one day available in edp very concentrated I could bath in

product_name: Let The Good Times Roll Lush
review_content:
First Spray I wasn’t too sure about it but the dry down was so tasty. I still have a paper swatch after a week later and it still smells so heavenly and strong so projection is there. I have it laying on my bathroom counter and my whole bathroom just smells so tastefully sweet.

I think this spray would be perfect for going to the gym and spraying your gym bag with or going to school and you spray your backpack with it. This sweet screams caramel scent will just linger for days on end.

It kinda reminds me of Cheirosa 71 vibes however that smell does not last long.

product_name: Let The Good Times Roll Lush
review_content:
For me, it's a hyper-realistic scent of buttery shortbread cookies. I don't get popcorn at all, but that's not a problem. Comfortable, enveloping, fluffy. I don't smell artificiality.
The scent is very long-lasting (you can smell it in rooms even after many hours) but delicate, it's not a killer. On paper it's meh, but on the skin magic begins to happen. Milk, sugar, butter, cookie, everything delicious, without jarring and dissonance. The lack of dissonance may be a disadvantage for some, as the scent is linear, but for comfort and escape into a better world, you don't need anything more. I love it.

product_name: Let The Good Times Roll Lush
review_content: Smells like sweet caramel popcorn with a touch of nail polish

product_name: Let The Good Times Roll Lush
review_content: this stuff has lasting POWER. i sprayed it on a test strip at lush, brought it home and put it on the shelf. no joke, for about a month the entire corner of my room where the shelf is smelled so strongly of it. very thick and tooth ache sweet buttery caramel, lovely.

product_name: Let The Good Times Roll Lush
review_content: I literally HATED this scent on immediate spray, but it settled sosososososo amazing within 2 minutes of it settling in my skin. I prefer this spray over the Sticky Dates spray for some reason; although I do own the entire sticky dates collection lol. I love to layer this with sticky dates lotion and if I want to add a bit more, I’ll go in with a few spritz of turmeric latte. You’ll smell like a coffee shop bakery hehe.

product_name: Let The Good Times Roll Lush
review_content: the first whiff is always nauseating but the dry down is heavenly, I’ll spray on my clothes before I shower just to let the scent settle in a bit. Very overpowering, do not recommend for summer but great for cold weather.

product_name: Let The Good Times Roll Lush
review_content: one of those fragrances i reach out to when i want to stand out. beast mode lasting power and sillage, you only need two sprays on your pulse points and you're good for the whole day. yes this is overpowering on initial spray but the dry down is sweet and leaves a trail. worth the hype but definitely not for everyone

product_name: Let The Good Times Roll Lush
review_content:
Before purchasing this perfume (a blind buy), I sorted the perfumes in my collection into two categories:

Perfumes that make me want to hug people, and perfumes that make people want to hug me.

The first describes fragrances that are wonderful but stay really intimate in terms of projection. I want to seek out close contact so people can enjoy the fragrance that stays quite intimate.

The second category are fragrances with adequate projection. People can smell them if they're in my little bubble, and want to come closer to better appreciate the fragrance.

This knocks them all out of the ballpark. It smells amazing, don't get me wrong, but you don't need to come any closer to me to smell it. It literally fills rooms, and I love sweet scents but sometimes honestly find myself avoiding close contact because I get self conscious about this absolute beast of a fragrance. I would describe it as a fluffy vanilla cupcake with caramel frosting. I bought this to layer with other perfumes, but it seems to outperform and outshine them.

product_name: Let The Good Times Roll Lush
review_content: OMG THIS IS SO aSTRONG!!!!! very caramel, very sweet, overpowering, if you wear this, you need nothing else. You can spray it on your body, hair, etc. Just that it's too much for everyday wear. If you like strong sweet smells, this mught be for you, it's very nice, just try it first. Not a safe blind buy!

product_name: Let The Good Times Roll Lush
review_content:
I know most will come after me for saying this, but this is kinda nauseating.

There is something so off putting about the buttery note, it is kinda rancid, and I am saying this with a heavy heart as I was waiting for more than 2 months to buy it.

Someone said that this is “the it girl Cheriosa 71 aspires to be”. Not true. At all. Cheriosa 71 is wayyyyy better!

product_name: Let The Good Times Roll Lush
review_content: I have enjoyed Lush cosmetics for over 15 years, am aware of the extreme potency of their body sprays, and I do enjoy vanilla/caramel based, sticky gourmands, so and it pains me to say that this is hands down THE most vulgar thing I have ever smelled in my life. It’s weird and waxy, salty and INCREDIBLY sweet, sooo cloying, overwhelming, nauseating. Has the power of nuclear waste, one spray is enough to fumigate your entire home, for days. The butter note is positively vile, a spoiled and rotten funk lurking behind a giant bowl of raw cookie dough the size of King Kong. I can think of absolutely no circumstance where this would be appropriate or pleasant. Even a Yankee candle in this scent would be revolting. I weep for the co-workers of anyone foolhardy enough to wear this in public. “Someone smells like cookies!” (or whatever) is not necessarily the compliment you might think it is. In fact, this is the type of scent that makes me want to mention that not every comment on one’s fragrance is a compliment, you know. Oftentimes people simply remark because the scent is strong, not because it’s enjoyable.

product_name: Let The Good Times Roll Lush
review_content: Love The smell, its ok but not beast like all people say barely can smell it on myself ( sillage) way over prized and hyped but its Nice smell i just wish it lasted longer

product_name: Let The Good Times Roll Lush
review_content: My New Fall Favorite!!! 😍 Keeps giving a pop of caramel several hours after applying two small sprays. It does have the lactonic note I like with vanilla and caramel but not like Cheriosa 71. I can’t wear that it’s so buttery it makes me nauseous. LTGTR is way on the right side of caramel popcorn. I use it for daytime and even sleep but for a night out I’d layer it with something more spicy. I don’t detect the cinnamon note but do get something that reminds of pineapple 🍍

product_name: Let The Good Times Roll Lush
review_content: I kept getting a whif of something that smelled exactly like cotton candy in the grocery store. I asked and she said she was wearing this. It's a shame cause I decluttered my bottle a year ago. It never smelled like cotton candy to me. But I guess the scent trail is different than smelling it up close. Ugh I wish I still had my bottle!

product_name: Let The Good Times Roll Lush
review_content: i had to sell it cause is tooo much like synthetic butter. I think sol de janeiro 71 is what I wanted this to be :(

product_name: Let The Good Times Roll Lush
review_content: I have used the facial scrub many years ago, and I quite like the scent in that formulation, but it doesn't translate well to body spray form.

product_name: Let The Good Times Roll Lush
review_content: My most complimented fragrance! Definitely noticeable, you’ll have people commenting on it smelling like syrup in the room lolol but don’t worry they’re appeased by it and not nauseated

product_name: Let The Good Times Roll Lush
review_content: I smell this everyday at university lol but it's pretty strong and smells nice. Got a compliment when I wore LTGTR and vanilla candy rock suger together:)

product_name: Let The Good Times Roll Lush
review_content: This is STUNNING! New favourite body mist! Smells like a creamy caramel sweet treat! Amazing 🍮🍰

product_name: Let The Good Times Roll Lush
review_content: This is not creamy caramel that i expected at all. Its straight up burnet sugar. I tried new egg nog scent and it was much better.

product_name: Let The Good Times Roll Lush
review_content: I really don't like this. It's horribly synthetic. The only way I can describe the scent: Imagine the breath of someone who's just vaped. And forgotten to brush their teeth. Eww.

product_name: Let The Good Times Roll Lush
review_content: I had to return it (shoutout to Lush's generous return policy!). On first spray it has a weird synthetic undertone. When it dries down its a hyperrealistic caramel corn. Super sweet, but unfortunately the butter note made me sick. Could maybe work as a linen or room spray depending if you're feeling festive.

product_name: Let The Good Times Roll Lush
review_content: PERFECT scent. Performs more like a perfume on me. It’s very buttery, sweet and sticky smelling. It really does smell like caramel popcorn. I have SDJ71 too and they are NOT the same! :) SDJ71 is amazing but extremely nutty. This one has no nutty scent and the vanilla is prominent in it

product_name: Let The Good Times Roll Lush
review_content: Honestly I was expecting more caramel and vanilla but on me it smelled of buttery popcorn with some kind of sweet synthetic undertone which a lot of lush scents have. I’d buy it if I currently didn’t have enough vanilla/gourmand body sprays. However I do prefer SDJ 71.

product_name: Let The Good Times Roll Lush
review_content: I asked my friend if she was wearing Sol de Janeiro '71, and she said it was this. I thought I was 100% sure on '71, so I'd definitely say this is a dupe. A strong buttery caramel smell, and delicious!

product_name: Let The Good Times Roll Lush
review_content:
this is the perfect fragrance for me. i’ve been a huge lush head for probably a decade now, so this scent isn’t new on my radar like it is to many, but i can’t sing it’s praises enough even after spending significant time with it. if you’ve ever smelled fresh, warm caramel corn or stepped foot into a fisher’s popcorn shop on the east coast, you’ll find a lot of that in a bottle of this. it’s an incredibly decadent, rich, warm melted caramel scent with a grounding saltiness to it and an ample dose of something like pancake syrup - like a step up in maturity and depth from those bath and body works gourmand sprays we all used to have, but with that same indulgent syrupy sweetness. if you don’t love warm gourmands, for the love of god, look elsewhere.

i say “love” instead of “like” for a key reason: this spray is absolutely nuclear. if you use more than one spray of this, god in heaven himself will smell you. i last sprayed my sleep shirt with a single spray of this three days ago and after consistent wear, it still smells freshly sprayed. this is the most incredible value for a fragrance because you only need one spritz to smell of it for the next 5-7 business days. PLEASE exercise restraint in spraying this - i cannot stress enough that you can’t get away with 4-5 sprays around your whole body with any lush body spray, much less this one. all that considered, it means you really get your money’s worth and then some out of this bottle, especially if you find the scent as delicious as i do. for sticky sweet gourmand lovers, this is your dream.

product_name: Let The Good Times Roll Lush
review_content:
I have only had this fragrance for a few days so it may be too early to judge, but I am kind of unsure about it. I am a DIE-HARD gourmand so on paper this seemed great for me, but something about this fragrance, especially in the opening, has this weird gasoline undertone. I can't seem to get past it—it smells like this extremely synthetically sweet vanilla mixed with alcohol and gasoline. I even tried letting it dry down, but that is still all I'm picking up on. Am I missing something? Where is the popcorn? The caramel? The Cinnamon? The butter? I must need to let this macerate because I just can't understand how others are picking up on those notes. It is super long lasting so I will give it points there.

EDIT: OMG!!!! Ignore everything I have said above. On initial spritz this fragrance truly needs at least a few days to macerate. Don’t give up if you had the same experience, I have now absolutely fallen in love.

The gasoline note is pretty much GONE now, if anything it’s only there for 1-2 minutes after initial spritz. This fragrance is amazing. It smells like if you were to walk into an icecream shop and you are getting whiffs of freshly made waffle cones with rich caramel and toffee ice cream in the background. I don’t get much popcorn in this because the popcorn in this fragrance is not movie popcorn, it’s like sweet kettle caramel popcorn. It is so freaking delicious. I sprayed only 2 sprays (that is seriously all you need) it and even 2 hours later I had someone ask why it smells like toffee and icecream. GO BUY THIS!!!

product_name: Let The Good Times Roll Lush
review_content: I get butterscotch with extra rum but no popcorn at all. It does smell a little like Sticky Dates but no where near as intense. This one is actually more wearable to me. Also I had to let mine sit for a few days because it smelled like straight cashmeran at first.

product_name: Let The Good Times Roll Lush
review_content: such good bang for your buck like genuinely so long lasting especially on clothes and the smell is fucking amazing. i wore this to work layered with tumeric latte and a customer told me i smell like cookies >v< idk about you but having someone tell me i smell like cookies is like the best thing ever. i like to spray this on my pyjamas and i can still smell it the next night. also has the smoothest atomiser, maybe because it's in a literal spray bottle but it gives a really nice even spray. only thing is i'd be careful if you dont want too much sillage because this thing sprays a lot in one go

product_name: Let The Good Times Roll Lush
review_content: The performance on this thing is absolutely crazy, I put this in my hair sometimes, still radiates. Synthetic yes, still a lovely little gourmand for a low price point.

product_name: Let The Good Times Roll Lush
review_content: i really really wish i got it like everyone gets it. i was so excited to try "let the good times roll", i looove anything sweet, yummy, hyperrealistic. but it was the biggest disappointment. it smells just like very burnt caramel with alcohol that doesn't disappear and kind of feels like it was supposed to be there? as if you took sticky toffee pudding, burnt it and then drenched in vodka. still, lasts forever and projects everywhere, lush is really good with this sort of thing. but no popcorn, no deliciousness, so it's a no in general. :(

product_name: Let The Good Times Roll Lush
review_content: Much better than Cheirosa 71 but still a no buy because I don't want to smell like popcorn :D

product_name: Let The Good Times Roll Lush
review_content: The name fits this one really well. “Let the good times roll” sets my soul & heart on fire. It does in fact evoke all the good times. I feel like a young man who has just been to the fun fair after school, being a good student, he decides to give himself a present by going to the fair. He then comes back home, the lollies’ smell he ate at the fair are lingering on his clothes & hair. A memory that is going to stick with him forever. It is probably the best scent I have ever smelt in my entire lifetime!

product_name: Let The Good Times Roll Lush
review_content: I want to love LTGTR but no matter how hard I try, there’s just something there that doesn’t work for me. Being a gourmand lover, on paper the notes are what I want in a fragrance, but in reality it’s very cloying. Have relegated this one to the bathroom as it makes a great air freshener! Will stick (!) to Sticky Dates instead.

product_name: Let The Good Times Roll Lush
review_content:
I love, love, love the "Let the Good Times Roll" face scrub which was the original product for this scent, if I'm not mistaken. Seriously, I have to slap my hand for wanting to eat that stuff. This is really damn close to how good that product smells, but sadly too synthetic in spray form (totally understandable for a gourmand scent, though). Still has a really great buttery, caramel popcorn scent. Very strong to my nose, and lasts a really long time on my skin. Definitely dries down to a strong vanilla, as I am cursed with in all the gourmand scents I love, so not one I can wear without diluting.

As an aside to anyone who is interested in the body lotion in this scent that Lush also recently put out - omg, it's soooo strong smelling. For me, it caused intense headache and nausea. Which sucks, because the lotion is Lush's good, heavy stuff that works amazingly at restoring my dry, rough skin back to something that doesn't resemble someone who moves cinderblocks with their feet all day. It was next to impossible to wash off in a hot shower, too. The scent lingered for days, even on surfaces I didn't even realize I'd touched. This product line is a beast in silage and longevity. Which isn't necessarily a bad thing, just not for people like me who are very sensitive to strong scents.

But yeah, I'm currently experimenting mixing this lotion with Vanicream to dilute just how freakishly concentrated it is. It takes a very small amount and it is still so strong. So great for someone looking for a stubborn gourmand.

product_name: Let The Good Times Roll Lush
review_content: Um what the hell did I stumble upon here? THIS IS A BEAST gourmand that is so edible I just want to rip my pyjamas off and eat them (yes I want to smell like a buttery caramel cupcake when I go to sleep). This will stay on your clothes (or pyjamas in my case) till you wash them, it will literally just create this beautiful gourmand bubble that just keeps reminding you of how delicious you smell every time you move the slightest. My wife thinks I'm weird but that's fine because cupcake.

product_name: Let The Good Times Roll Lush
review_content: this reminds me of bianco latte mixed with sol de janeiro 70. really lovely and strong, smells like a dessert

product_name: Let The Good Times Roll Lush
review_content: I can’t stop sniffing myself i smell like a dessert🍨

product_name: Let The Good Times Roll Lush
review_content:
This fragrance smells absolutely HORRIBLE omg. I blind-bought this fragrance and was absolutely shocked when it arrived. It is one of the worst smells I have ever smelled and I am SO disappointed. So many people on TikTok have raved about this scent and I was expecting something cozy and sweet, but this is sickeningly sweet in the worst way, to the point of making me nauseous. It’s so harsh and synthetic smelling. I immediately ran to the bathroom to get this smell off of me.

🌷 Make sure to smell this in the shop first because this is definitely not a safe blind buy and most likely not what you expect from reading the notes on here!!🌷

product_name: Let The Good Times Roll Lush
review_content: The opening is a hard pass. Straight up buttered popcorn with a side of foul. However, the dry down? The silage? Gourmand heaven. It’s got a cake batter vibe with a side of gooey caramel. Super sweet and not for the faint of heart. Performance is phenomenal.

product_name: Let The Good Times Roll Lush
review_content: I wish I was more fond of this fragrance, but it was the first to go in my collection. It smells like caramel movie theatre popcorn. I’m a gourmand girlie, but I couldn’t love this. I don’t enjoy smelling like the cinema or a Garret’s Popcorn or something. Not for me, but it doesn’t mean it won’t be for you. It may be your next favorite scent. I will say, it smells delicious when I smell the exfoliator which it’s based off.

product_name: Let The Good Times Roll Lush
review_content: The scent definitely lasts for ages and projects a lot. People can smell me from very far. The initial spray is incredibly intense and a lot gets released in one go because of the spray bottle packaging I think, so I spray way less than I usually do for any kind of body mist. The initial spray also smells overwhelmingly like MINT to me and my sisters. As it dries down it transitions into the more "buttery caramel" scent that I was expecting and LOVE. I just wish it was like that from the beginning because it was even off-putting to me as someone who loves strong gourmand scents on myself.

product_name: Let The Good Times Roll Lush
review_content: The best sweetest butteriest most heavily projecting caramel scent on the market at least when factoring in store accessibility as there are other nuclear projection scents on the market that are only available online or some snobby niche hipster apothecary in Los Angeles after sitting in hours of traffic lol

product_name: Let The Good Times Roll Lush
review_content: excuse me but this smells like honey garlic?! it’s awful i’m sorry but my friends and i gasped at the smell

product_name: Let The Good Times Roll Lush
review_content: I love gourmands but this one is just a little bit too sweet for me. When I wore it I got compliments when I'd enter a room even when 6ft away from someone. The buttery popcorn smell is really there so if you're after a strong gourmand this is it.

product_name: Let The Good Times Roll Lush
review_content:
although it's still pretty warm here in maryland, i've been on a gourmand craze lately lol.
maybe i'm just trying to prepare myself for the BEST SEASON EVER! fall is around the corner and i am going to be wearing the hell out of this!

"let the good times roll" is soft, buttery, caramel popcorn without being overly sweet. the popcorn isn't all up in your face so thank goodness!
lush, please make an EDP version!!

product_name: Let The Good Times Roll Lush
review_content:
Soooo good ! I’ve never really been into gourmand scents before since I’ve always reached for florals but man this is amazing. This combines a sweet caramel scent with a really nice vanilla. At first, I was really hesitant to buy it because of the popcorn note (I absolutely cannot stand sol de janeiro 71) but it adds so much to this fragrance.
I combine it with other stories “perle de coco” body lotion which has notes of coconut vanilla and caramel. It’s quite subtle but I really recommend it if you’re looking for a budget alternative <3
It’s a very strong fragrance and incredibly long lasting for a body mist ! But other than that I can’t recommend it enough.

product_name: Let The Good Times Roll Lush
review_content: Fell in love with it the moment I sprayed it on my sweater in the store, the fact that it stayed over 4 days sealed the deal for me. Unfortunately, I very quickly realized that I don't like gourmand smells on myself. I always felt sticky, the crazy sweetness numbed everything around me, it caused me headaches. After fighting it for several months I gave it to my friend, who, on the other hand, rocked it until she didn't have anything left in the bottle, and told me that a huge amount of people complimented it. I think I'd recommend it ONLY! if you know you like gourmand notes on YOURSELF!

product_name: Let The Good Times Roll Lush
review_content:
An extremely buttery, caramel fragrance. If you are a gourmand lover, this will be something you'll enjoy very much.

Pros:
- An incredibly sweet gourmand fragrance; the butter and caramel are extremely strong notes, along a popcorn, vanilla, sweet base.
- It will last an extremely long time (I sprayed it and can still smell it on me the next day)
- Sillage is powerful, you walk into a room and the scent will linger after you're gone.
- Extremely good value, I got it for 45AUD, 200mL. For just a body spray with 12h+ wear, this is incredible.

Cons:
- Sweetness can be way too overpowering, cloying and nauseating.
- Initial blast will be powerful so hold your breath for about 5 seconds.

Overall I would give this an 8/10. Extremely delicious, you will smell edible, like a walking baked goodie. And for the value, the product is just phenomenal. Apparently most body sprays from Lush have phenomenal longevity and projection, excited to try more!

product_name: Let The Good Times Roll Lush
review_content: the opening is sharp and a little sour, just not pleasant at all. Dry down is sweet, gourmand and creamy. I really like the dry down but the opening is just not worth it to buy.

product_name: Let The Good Times Roll Lush
review_content: This is one I always come back to. I’m a huge lover of gourmand fragrances, especially the ones that smell more edible and literal. This is the perfect edible caramel with that savoury buttery quality that makes it so unique to other sweet scents I’ve tried. The sillage and lasting power are huge, it lasts on my skin for hours and on my clothes for days. Definitely more suitable for the colder weather but I come back to it all year round.

product_name: Let The Good Times Roll Lush
review_content: Sweet artificial butter smell with a little bit of a spicy dry down

product_name: Let The Good Times Roll Lush
review_content:
This is amazing!!!!
Reminds me a lot of the OG Pink Sugar by Aquolina only this is much better, this is like the organic version of it.
I mostly smell the caramel and cinnamon, it’s a very warm milky scent, reminds me a lot of the sticky caramel candy I ate when I was a kid.
A really really great gourmand.
However, I am not a huge fan of Lush’s body spray bottles, that’s the only downside.

product_name: Let The Good Times Roll Lush
review_content: It smells extremely sweet and artificial, which is not a problem for me. The spray bottle, however, is. This perfume last an eternity. I put it on before work, and even after a 10 hour sweaty shift, it is still half as strong as when I applied it. The fact that it lasts so long makes me nauseous and over stimulated. The spray bottle applies a generous amount per spray, which is way too much for such a strong perfume. I've transferred some of the perfume to a smaller tester bottle with a better atomiser, and now I'm able to use multiple sprays to apply my perfume in multiple places without overwhelming the senses.

product_name: Let The Good Times Roll Lush
review_content: Creamy caramel, reminds me of christmas time sweets. Uplifting. Lasts a long time, I can smell it the next day. Two sprays is enough or even one. I enjoy it

product_name: Let The Good Times Roll Lush
review_content: It smelled so good on the paper tester that I almost bought it on the spot. Like a Starbucks caramel frappe. Thankfully I tried it on skin, as on me it's a blast of burnt caramel. It's a no for me.

product_name: Let The Good Times Roll Lush
review_content: scrubbed immediately. probably shouldve let it develop but it was the most intense initial spray ever. my sister told me i smelled good tho. before blind buying make sure u can handle ur gourmands cause this one is extreeeemely sweet.

product_name: Let The Good Times Roll Lush
review_content: Let the good times roll is definitely my most complimented perfume, all of my friends went out and bought themselves a bottle. The longevity of this perfume is like no other - if sprayed on clothing it will last for weeks.

product_name: Let The Good Times Roll Lush
review_content:
At its best, this fragrance is the gooiest warm, slightly spicy, caramel cookie fresh out of the oven, with sweet creamy butter on the side. It is walking into a cake shop and tasting the thick, light brown syrup dripping down from the centre of a freshly baked cinnamon sponge. The type of treat I promised myself I would indulge in every day of my adult life when I was a kid.
The opening is rather harsh and overly synthetic. If it stayed like this, this fragrance would be one of my least favourites. But it melts into you and becomes you, it takes you over and shrouds you in the most deliciously sweet and approachable scent as the day goes on. When I wear Let The Good Times Roll, people treat me like I am their favourite sweet treat. I become the cookie or cake they have been craving, thus they respond with incredible warmth and softness towards me.
When I don't want to be perceived as overly sweet and approachable, but I still crave a strong gourmand, I love to pair this with Coffee Break. As a much softer gourmand which has similar lactonic and sweet notes, it is balanced out by the pepperiness, and refreshed and awakened by the coffee notes.
Overall a dreamy and dazy gourmand that will send you into a soft daydream of caramel. I receive compliments EVERY time I wear this, people stop me at work or in the street to ask me what I have on. Let The Good Times Roll will be a stable in my collection for the rest of my life. A blind buy I will never regret and truly my signature. A little goes a LONG way!

product_name: Let The Good Times Roll Lush
review_content:
