Edit: decant this and wait patiently. It needs to oxidise and then some. All the synthetic vanilla has fallen away and I get to skip right to the good part.

It opens pretty synthetically, and then it's a decent caramel syrup for a minute, and then it turns into an annoyingly strong cheap vanilla bathroom spray, and then I spend the rest of my afternoon craving Werthers Originals and ice cream and wondering what smells so good. I'm glad I don't get any popcorn from this. I find it to be a pretty convincing caramel ice cream in the drydown, but it's hard to justify sitting through that obnoxious artificial vanilla cloud very often. The in store tester smelled much richer from the get-go, so I'm hoping it will age gracefully.

product_name: Let The Good Times Roll Lush
review_content: When I first got this it smelt rancid to me and had a burnt smell and reminded me of mosquito repellent, not sure why. I was so disappointed and put it in my drawer and forgot about it until about 2 months later. I gave it another chance and it smelt so delicious and completely different, I’m not sure whether it was the fragrance or me that changed but I absolutely love it now. It also performs like a high end perfume, lasting over 24 hours when I spray it on my clothes, even surviving the washing machine when sprayed on certain materials and projects like crazy. I sprayed it in my upstairs bedroom and could smell it downstairs when I was walking around. My family always says they can smell sweet cinema popcorn when I spray this, but in a positive way. I’ve also seen this be described as candy corn smelling but I’ve never tried so I wouldn’t know. Definitely great value for money but I’d recommend trying it in a Lush store if possible as Lush scents seem to be quite polarising. 100% recommend especially for fall/winter and a bottle will last you ages since you don’t need to spray much at all, 1 or 2 sprays is already enough and very strong.

product_name: Let The Good Times Roll Lush
review_content: Gourmand lovers on a budget !!!!! This is for us !!!! It’s caramel it’s delicious yummy!!! Give it 10-15min for it to bloom on your skin. This is wayyyyyy better than Cheerios 71. Heavenly!!!!! I smell like ice cream!!!

product_name: Let The Good Times Roll Lush
review_content: This spray is very intoxicating. I was a bit disappointed that it didn't really have the buttery caramel popcorn scent, like the face scrub and limited edition body wash do, instead it has an overwhelming spicy butterscotch scent, which sadly gives me a headache. I kept trying it every now and then because I wanted to like it, but it just smells like a Christmas fruit pie with heaps of cinnamon. I ended up gifting it to a friend as it just made my head hurt. I am a bit sad that I didn't end up enjoying this as much as I hoped, as I am a gourmand girlie, but it's just too overwhelmingly spicy and not quite what I expected. It does have great longevity - I can smell it on my clothes even the day after. It definitely lingers and you don't need to spray much. If you like warm spice, then this might be for you.

product_name: Let The Good Times Roll Lush
review_content: Can’t even be objective on this one. I’m in love with it, wearing it non stop. So I think that you can get an idea of my opinion. Everything is perfect.

product_name: Let The Good Times Roll Lush
review_content:
SOOO YUMMY!! For me this smells like a creamy and milky vanilla with a faint hint of caramel. Can’t smell the popcorn note but I’m not complaining as the scent is delicious! Someone said that it smells absolutely good when I walked by and all my friends like it. My friend says it smells like vanilla and my brother says it smells like the fairy floss zooper dopper.
After like 5 sprays and 20 minutes I go noseblind to it and I can’t smell it but other people can if they’re close to me. This lasts for 2-3 hours. Would defo repurchase this one.

product_name: Honey I Washed the Kids Lush
review_content: It goes on completely citrus cleaner, but dries down to a very intimant honey sweetness quick enough to be worth it. Not a perfect honey perfume, but a pleasant entry to that category which doesn’t mix in too many other scents. Now if only Lush would release a Sticky Date perfume.

product_name: Honey I Washed the Kids Lush
review_content: Sweet honey that has a beautiful soft dry down. Perfect.

product_name: Honey I Washed the Kids Lush
review_content: I'm not much of a gourmand girlie, so I'm more than content with my wee 10ml via the Kitchen box, but my goodness do I love the HIWTK scent family! Brings to mind orange chocolate, honeycomb and gooey caramel all at once. Makes me feel like I'm being hugged by the person I love most. Super sweet, decedent, and above all, comforting -- but HEAVY emphasis on that 'super sweet' part. As much as I love HIWTK, in perfume format it's a bit too much for me a lot of the time (it released about 2 years ago according to the label, and I've only used about 3ml so far!), so I gravitate towards the handful of other gourmands I own a lot of the time. (FWIW, that would mainly be Replica Matcha Meditation & Kilian Angels' Share.) I'm still glad to own this vial for the handful of times I'm in the mood to rock it, but admittedly I prefer it a lot more in bath bomb, shower gel and soap format.

product_name: Honey I Washed the Kids Lush
review_content: Why oh why don't they make this scent perfume anymore and why is it always stuck in the U.K. and never in thr states , I just received a lush kitchen version and it it's awesome and honeyed unlike the body spray which is enjoyable , and both have different facets why they should both be here .

product_name: Honey I Washed the Kids Lush
review_content:
Initially candy caramel but dries down to vanilla yogurt quite quickly.
Not what I had expected - wanted a thick, rich caramel!

product_name: Honey I Washed the Kids Lush
review_content:
This is such a comforting, feel good fragrance. Imagine a creamy toffee, milk and honey, french nougat and orange marmalade. This is probably what Paddington Bear would smell like if you gave him a snuggle!

I own the body spray version of this fragrance, and longevity is really really good.

product_name: Honey I Washed the Kids Lush
review_content: This review is for the 2018 body spray. It opens with almost a yogurt tang. That tangy scent dries down quite quickly and morphs into a white floral/honey/toffee scent. It eventually settles into a lovely honey/toffee/white chocolate with only a hint of the white floral. I do not detect any citrus in this version. Not huge sillage or lasting power.

product_name: Honey I Washed the Kids Lush
review_content: I expected a perfume replica of the soap (cf. Devil's Nightcap) but to my surprise it's actually not. There's a bit of sour, white wine tinge. I'd liken this perfume to vanilla yogurt.

product_name: Honey I Washed the Kids Lush
review_content:
Wow! It smells just like the notes listed! If you love sweet gourmands then one not to miss. Quite an intense opening. Too sweet for me. Loads of toffee! I was hoping the citrus might be more dominant but nope.
Moderate sillage and longevity

product_name: Honey I Washed the Kids Lush
review_content:
I'm reviewing the 2015 Lush Kitchen formula.
This is absolutely divine! This smells like toffee/caramel and honeycomb with a light soapy feel which is very true to the original scent in the LUSH soap. There is also a slightly white chocolately vibe which reminds me of the best hot chocolate money can buy. Or a bar of "crunchy" chocolate which they sell here in the UK (honeycomb covered in chocolate). It is very wearable, however, and not overpowering. I usually would not wear gourmands this thick in the summer heat, but this is light enough that it works in all weathers. Very clean smelling, despite the foody notes, and perfect those looking for something sweet and yummy without being too much.

product_name: Honey I Washed the Kids Lush
review_content: This perfume is certainly something else. With a very prominent Play Doh note, crayon waxy toffee, very sweet and unmistakable. The honey is sweet, a little pee-y and the orange is mostly sweet and just a little zesty, bringing out the higher pitch in this caramel. Don't say I didn't warn you. The liquid, long discontinued, smells the same and is as strong as the solid currently for sale in Japan. The perfume is exactly the same as the soap, except the perfume is ten times more potent. Wear in minute amounts and this can be a real beauty.

product_name: Honey I Washed the Kids Lush
review_content: They have discontinued the parfum, but you can still find the scent in soap and in the solid shampoo bar. I love the honey with a hint of carmel/toffee scent. It is sweet but not cloying and doesn't make me hungry. My favorite Lush scent.

product_name: Honey I Washed the Kids Lush
review_content:
I LOVE "It's Raining Men" shower gel from Lush. It does fabulous things for my hair and smells delicious. I love the "Gold Fun" bath playdough, the "Honey I Washed The Kids" soap (minus the wax on the top), and even the "Honey Bee" bath bomb even though it leaves clay in my tub. So naturally I had to hunt down the perfume to complete the scent circle. I always use their solids when first trying out a scent if I can, since my allergies can be iffy-wiffy. Omg, this smells so amazing and just like the bath products!

Buttery goodness with just enough citrus to balance out the sweetness, and just enough floral to make the honey smell realistic and not like cheap vanilla.


Edit: So the solid of this definitely leans more toward a butterscotch scent, whereas the spray version has a slightly more floral feel going. Both are awesome, though.

product_name: Honey I Washed the Kids Lush
review_content:
For anyone wondering, the Lush shops in Japan still carry this as a solid perfume: other than the UK, Japan has the most Lush shops in the world! If anyone's looking for this discontinued perfume, you may want to get one shipped in from there. (Japan Lush also carries The Olive Branch solid perfume)

Delicious honey/caramel smell.

product_name: Honey I Washed the Kids Lush
review_content: Simple 3 note wonder. First scent is largely of caramel, rich and thick but not too syrupy or burnt. It is seamlessly layered with bee's wax and honey, which evens out the smell of the caramel and gives it a 'thick' smell. Lastly, is a bit of orange which keeps the whole thing from smelling too sweet and gives it a slight fruit identity. It smells kind of soapy too, like the wax of glycerin soap. Sort of like clean skin musk. I think this helps create the illusion that the scent was transferred onto your skin by soap rather than perfume.

product_name: Honey I Washed the Kids Lush
review_content: They should make this perfume into food so I can eat it. Smells delicious, definitely gourmand but clean as well with a soapy finish which makes it very wearable. I wore this at Christmas all the time as it seemed perfect for the season.

product_name: Honey I Washed the Kids Lush
review_content: I had a solid version of this perfume and enjoyed it. Cozy and playful, clean and warm, with a touch of honey sweetness. The name of this perfume helps to bring these diverse sniff-impressions together :)

product_name: Honey I Washed the Kids Lush
review_content: The soap is great, but the perfume (might have been the bottles I got--I got two different ones, one from each release, though) was kinda...well, it smelled mostly like alcohol and something bitter from the bottle. On the skin, it mellowed out to something closer to the soap, but usually still a little too bitter/waxy for me.

product_name: Honey I Washed the Kids Lush
review_content: It smells like the soap, but not as subtle. It was a special edition. I can see why they didn't put it in their permanent line. Something was just off..

product_name: Honey I Washed the Kids Lush
review_content:
Unfortunately discontinued.
I know they still sell it as soap, but I recently tried Flying Fox and actually liked it better. Probably because I love jasmine. I'm hoping they'll eventually produce Flying Fox as a fragrance.

product_name: Honey I Washed the Kids Lush
review_content: I keep buying the soap , but can't find the perfume in my country ( ITALY)

product_name: Honey I Washed the Kids Lush
review_content:
When it comes to gourmands, I am much more enthusiastic about wearing something that smells like honey rather than cotton candy. I've been searching for a realistic honey scent for quite some time. I did enjoy Serge Lutens Miel de Bois, but it wasn't what I wanted. Since finding Honey I Washed The Kids, I believe I may have found the closest to what I was looking for.

Honey I Washed The Kids is a fairly linear scent, with syrupy honey, sugary vanilla and gooey caramel. It smells delicious and foody, just like a gourmand should be.

The opening is where the honey note is at its strongest. I was amazed by how realistic it smelt on my skin. It was just like sticking your nose in a jar of honey and inhaling. Although the honey note is dominant throughout this composition, it does tend to lessen in intensity. The heart and drydown introduces the vanilla and caramel which helps in balancing out the fragrance.

As far as I'm aware, Honey I Washed The Kids was a limited edition that has long since been discontinued. The last time I inquired about this fragrance in a Lush store, I was re-directed to a shower gel named It's Raining Men and told that it's the same scent, just re-named.

I was lucky enough to be sent a sample from a kind Lush fragrance collector. Since falling for it, I guess I'll now have to join the ranks of fans waiting for a bottle to appear on Ebay.

product_name: Honey I Washed the Kids Lush
review_content: I wanted to love this and I am a honey fan. But the orange and bergamont made this too lemoney for my taste. It dries down and for like an hour, smells divine. It smells like honey, toffee and creamy vanilla. I also didn't care for the solid form which I had to scrape with my fingernail out of the tin. Luckily the Bath and Body Works reformulation of Warm Vanilla Sugar smells like the dry down of this. I highly recommend.

product_name: Honey I Washed the Kids Lush
review_content: Does anyone know of a fragrance that truly smells like Honey I Washed The Kids soap and hasn't been discontinued?

product_name: Honey I Washed the Kids Lush
review_content:
Sweeeeeeet but dont care coz HIWTK is lovely super YUMMY scent! It's rich caramel toffee!!

If you still cant imagine how is the scent and dont have LUSH shop nearby, u can go supermarket & find Werther's original candy, it is the same!!!

product_name: Honey I Washed the Kids Lush
review_content: Yummy! They captured this scent very nicely. Smells just like HIWTK soap and It's Raining Men shower gel. It is extremely sweet but so yummy. It's a very honey, caramel, and slightly floral scent that just makes you want to eat yourself!! lol

product_name: Honey I Washed the Kids Lush
review_content: Oh how I WISH they still had this available... The one LUSH perfume I cannot find anymore :-(

product_name: Honey I Washed the Kids Lush
review_content: YUMMMMMMMMMM

product_name: Honey I Washed the Kids Lush
review_content:
I am a fan of Lush's Honey I Washed the Kids Soap and was excited when the fragrance edition of this scent came out. Unfortunately there's something here that's not quite right with this scent.

On my skin it never settles down to that gorgeous toffee/honey/caramel scent that I've come to love. I believe the bergamot and orange mixture in this is what's making this rather sharp. There's no warmth here, its very much a cold sharp sweet smell that reminds me of white bleached sugar.

However, when my bottle of this leaked onto a scarf I was delighted to find the resulting scent a lot closer to the warm toffee caramel scent I love. I wont be repurchasing this but its a nice thing to have in my collection.

product_name: Honey I Washed the Kids Lush
review_content:
I really love Lush a lot.They care so much for the Mother Earth,and for the animals. I still have a pinch left of the solid for this lovely vegan scent,but I am running really low. I am sad that mine is almost gone.

I simply cannot afford this spray (I want it though,and I am so happy it is vegan)

I have a GORGEOUS dupe from a sweet online seller. It is a roll-on oil. It smells like sweet orange candy, and toffee. Very softly scented.

product_name: Honey I Washed the Kids Lush
review_content:
There is something fresh lingering behind the sweetness, something that refreshes you while it lulls you. It's not really citrussy rather what's left after the citrussy has gone. A tingy sharpness that gives this sweet scent its charm.

Whenever I use it, people react. I love it, it lifts my mood.

product_name: Honey I Washed the Kids Lush
review_content: Toffee, salted caramelised oranges and honey. Not enough honey IMHO, there's an almost Greek Honey yoghurt quality to this, not too bad at all, but works better in the Lush soap form.

product_name: Honey I Washed the Kids Lush
review_content:
I used to work in Lush so am very familiar with this smell. It's a one of kind gorgeousness that's hard to describe. The description of Citrus/Gourmand is wrong in my opinion. It's not citrussy.
If you think this blend is going to be overwhelmed by honey then fear not.
It's a very light, almost Tofee-Lite smell which is sooo addictive and comforting. Beautiful beautiful smell. The soap and other products are just as gorgeous. If you've ever had a chocolate bar called "Caramac" then you're onto the right track of what this smells like.
Smells JUST like Snowy Fairy. If you have that, and couldn’t get your hands on this one during the recent launch, you’re not missing anything.

Wanted to like this based off of the description and other comments but there's a synthetic cloud that overshadows the powdery sweetness offered by it. By the time the plasticy smell fades, so does everything else. To me it smells more like trying to smell a strawberry, creamy taffy through the wax paper wrapper. There is a tinge of vanilla but I smell the creamy strawberry more.

WIll let it sit for a while to see if it's having an off day or if macerating will help, but for now it's giving car freshener where the cardboard card overpowers the fragrance itself.

This is a really soft, powdery, strawberry-and-vanilla scent, it’s not as bright and strong as snow fairy, but they are in a similar vein.
It reminds me of their candy fluff scent, but that was more sweetie shop, and this is more strawberry candy.
I love it, it’s super sweet but not cloying, very girly but I don’t care, I smell lovely.

To me Creamy Candy and Snow Fairy are cousins, not sisters. Both exude "if pink was a smell" energy, but SF is fruity and unashamedly synthetic, whereas CC is a powdery vanilla with hints of violet. They're both extremely sweet so I definitely understand why some insist they're the same scent -- it's like how I feel like Grass and Tramp "basically smell the same" even though every time I say this I get an inevitable barrage of WTF?! responses LOL. Scent is subjective et cetera... Anyway, I'll copy & paste my thoughts from my review under the 2012 formulation:

Snagged a bottle from the re-release and I'm pleased to report it smells the same as my 2012 bottle, though noticeably lighter/softer. I'm not too concerned though, it's a freshly made perfume so should grow stronger with age. For now I'll put it aside and allow it to macerate a bit more. **EDIT: well, I have to eat my words. I'm beyond gutted. On release people were comparing this to smelling like Red Bull and I couldn't see it at first, but as my bottle has macerated and grown stronger I can smell it... it's NOT the same as my 2012 bottle. Like okay I know that one is over a decade old but it ACTUALLY smells like the bubble bar, this 2023 version smells sweeter and more synthetic and almost like it has a beer/yeasty note to it. Ugh....

I’m happy to have this but as other reviews state, it’s basically snow fairy. Even my Husband who uses Snow Fairy shower gel and also knows my body spray smelt it and said "That's Snow Fairy"! It’s slightly less fruity than the current snow fairy body spray but essentially it is snow fairy in a (light!) perfume concentration. The vanillic creamy candy comes through in the deep dry down but the perfume has become a skin scent at that point. It's almost white chocolatey before it disappears and it's a shame that doesn't come in sooner, because that's the part that diverges from snow fairy and actually smells creamy.

This is the one I’ll wear as it works a bit better on my skin than snow fairy body spray. I’ll use the body spray on my bedding! Yes it’s a bit of shame that this isn’t quite the creamy candy people wanted but I think it's worth having.... I just think Lush might have annoyed a fair few customers with this and supermilk as neither seem to smell the way people were expecting, but I really like both! Wish they lasted a bit longer though.

Love,love,love it sooo much.It is very nutty gourmand fragrance,very strong,with good projection.I feel a lot of the sweetness from vanilla, sugar and fruits,also the heart of the seed from apricot.Do not compare to fairy snow,there is a very small similarity.

The change in packaging is the biggest cancer ever so maybe getting the spray is the next best move! My signature one of these travel Lush perfume’s, super clean… smells almost like dove soap with sandalwood shavings. Love it!!!!!!!!!!

Very pretty. It's nothing much in the tube, but on skin it becomes a nice second skin scent which smells like high quality sandalwood body cream over skin that was washed with Dove soap.

It's simply an extremely nice fragrance, especially for the price. Byredo Bal d Afrique could never.
